loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom attend school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Editha requested her second loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a cake and pastries making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like cake flour, margarine, sugar, milk, etc.

Merlyn has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like cake flour, margarine, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Mona Mae

texts.en:
Mona Mae is 18 years old with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur, trying to help her family.

Mona Mae has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional gallon of coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Mona Mae would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallon of coconut wine

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 59 years old and married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Marietta has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Marietta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucia is 43 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Lucia has a buy-and-sell frozen food business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and buying and selling bananas. Nenita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, etc for her food vending business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 48 years old and has two children. She is married and both children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Perlita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs.

Perlita has been doing pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Perlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 35 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mary Ann has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and frozen foods for her food-vending business.

Mary Ann has been in this business for four years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and frozen foods for her food-vending business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 37 years old, married and lives at Lazi, Siquijor, Philippines.

In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from her neighborhood. This was a great opportunity to start up her own business. The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending on their agreement.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. 

Through Pauglam MPC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy more head of pigs and bags of feed. She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions and she wishes to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy pigs and bags of feed.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
In 2012, Paulo learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Paulo tried his luck on doing a business focusing on his farming activities. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital.

Paulo borrowed another amount to pay for labor costs and seed bed prepation. This will help give his farming income a big boost. 

Paulo looks for better business opportunities, and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and seed bed preparation

loans.name: Jesreel

texts.en:
Jesreel is 40 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is single, with one child now at school age. 

Jesreel earns a living from a salary as a casual office clerk in one of the offices of the Local Government Unit of her town; she has been doing this for more than four years already. Jesreel earns approximately PHP3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used for paying the tuition fees and other school expenses of her son. 

Jesreel has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Jesreel hopes to engage in direct selling and an eload retailing business to add to her income.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees and other school expenses

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials needed like thread, needle, fabrics, etc for her tailoring shop business.

Jesselyn has been in this business for 16 years. She earns more income from direct selling Natasha products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Jesselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials like thread, fabric, needles, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Cecilia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 55-year-old woman from Dulag, in the province of Leyte. She is married with three grown children. For 15 years now, she has been into selling fish and vegetables to earn a living. Juanita's husband also help in their business.

Her business was instrumental in raising her children when they were young. She is asking for a loan to buy fresh fish, bananas, tomatoes, chilies, and onions. 

Juanita hopes that with her business, she can continue to support herself and her husband and not rely on their children.
 
In the future, she aims at making her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, bananas, tomatoes, chilies, and onions

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and a widow woman with six children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Delia has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Luisa has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмире 32 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. У Гулмиры высшее образование, работает в школе учителем, также  уже более 10 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством, вся семья активно помогает в ведении бизнеса. Сегодня в хозяйстве Гулмиры есть 2 коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулмира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 коров. Доходы от кредита позволят Гулмире в дальнейшем развивать ее бизнес.
texts.en: Gulmira is 32, married, and has four children. She has a higher education and is a schoolteacher. She has also been a farmer for over ten years, and her family helps her with the business. She currently has two cows and earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, Gulmira applied for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) to buy four more cows. She plans to use her profits to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase four cows and expand her livestock business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma, 45, is married with three adult-age children. 

Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 21 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. 

She is still continuing the business because it provides a good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. 

Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. 

She already took previous loans to purchase additional stocks and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her sari-sari store (small grocery)

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 43 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is separated from her husband, with two children now at their school age. 

Arlyn is a sole bread winner and earns a living from a salary as a casual employee in one of the offices of the Local Government Unit of her town.  She has been doing this for more than 3 years already. Arlyn earns approximately PHP3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used for paying the tuition fees and other school expenses for her daughter and son. 

Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Arlyn hopes to become a regular employee and plans to engage in a buy and sell business so that she can support all their family needs.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and other school expenses

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur from Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is 45 years old and has children. Rodrigo, her husband, works as a driver. She oversees the operation of their Jeepney unit, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) Jeepney, from which she is paid *boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,500 every day. Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippine.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the Jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

Teresita is requesting a PHP 24,000 loan assistance to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her Jeepney unit. She will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, Teresita wants to have more units of Jeepney to be used for their business operation. She hopes that her children will be able to complete their studies and then find right-fit jobs. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Robinson

texts.es: Robinson de 53 años de edad habita en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, lugar donde tiene su pequeño taller de ornamentación desde el año 1998. Él desde muy joven aprendió el oficio y como le gustó hizo un curso para poder abrir su taller, en  el cual elabora cerramientos y artículos de hierro en general. Su trabajo lo realiza por encargo de su clientela a quien le vende a crédito, y para ello trabaja desde los lunes hasta los sábados en un horario que va de 8 de la mañana a 8 de la noche. Sus compras las realiza de contado y sus principales clientes son empresas y personas naturales que poco a poco ha ido ganando como sus fieles compradores. Hoy en día,  Robinson se ha trazado la meta de incrementar los contratos de sus clientes y más adelante ampliar su taller, todo esto con el fin de ganar más y aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará materias primas, con el fin de elaborar rejas, ventanas que son los artículos de mayor venta en el último trimestre del año, aprovechando que  las personas se preparan para hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda y tener una imagen elegante, para cuando lleguen las fiestas en el mes de Diciembre,   temporada en la que reciben ingresos adicionales y se lo invierten a su vivienda, haciendo de sus ingresos por concepto de  las primas bonificaciones laborales el ahorro más productivo del año.
texts.en:
Robinson is 53 years old, and lives in a neighbourhood in the city of Soledad. Here he has had his small ornamentation workshop since the year 1998. From a very young age, he learned this trade, and because he liked it so much, he took a course to be able to open his workshop, where he makes fences and things from iron in general. 

He does his work upon requests from his customers, to whom he sells his items on credit. For them, he works Monday through Saturday with a schedule that goes from 8am until 8pm. His purchases are made in cash, and his main customers are businesses and individuals who, little by little, he has won over as his loyal buyers.

These days, Robinson has set his goal to increase contracts with his customers, and later expand his workshop, all with the goal of earning more and improving his family's quality of life. He is asking for a Kiva loan, his first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which he will buy raw materials. With these, he will make more bars and windows, which are his best selling items in the last third of the year, as people prepare to make improvements to their homes, to appear more elegant for when the holidays in December arrive. It is a season where many receive additional earnings, and invest these in improving their homes, making it for him the most productive and high earning time of the year.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, with the intention to build bars and windows.

loans.name: Leidy

texts.es: Leidy de 61 años de edad es una mujer separada que habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su hijo de 32 años de edad.  Desde muy niña siempre le gustó la actividad comercial, que hoy en día y desde hace 5 años ejerce con mucha felicidad, aprovechando cada temporada para invertir y vender más.  Portarretratos, muñecos de peluche cosméticos, utensilios de cocina maquillaje cremas, perfumería etc, son sus principales productos, los cuales vende de contado, abriendo  desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, un punto comercial ubicado en el lugar donde habita, por eso sus vecinos son sus principales clientes, pues allí encuentran todo lo que necesitan y a precios competitivos. Su meta es tener un gran almacén y finalmente apoyar a su hijo en todo o que lo organice en su vida., pero su gran desafío es tener el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas mercancías e incrementar sus clientes. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a La Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará   Portarretratos, muñecos de peluche cosméticos y dulcería, así aprovechará la temporada de fin de año que llega muy pronto con sus fiestas y grandes descuentos de proveedores, así como también ocurre el incremento de las ventas en esta época de gran integración de la familia colombiana.
texts.en:
Leidy is 61 years old, and is separated. She lives in the city of Barranquilla with her 32 year old son. She has always been interested in business since childhood. She has now been happily working for 5 years, taking advantage of each season to invest and sell more products. She mainly sells picture frames, stuffed animals, cosmetics, kitchenware, makeup, creams, and perfumes. She sells these products from 8 am to 8 pm, from a store located in her home. Therefore, her neighbors are her main customers, as she can offer them everything they need at competitive prices.

Leidy’s goal is to have a large store, and to support her child in all aspects of his life. Her biggest challenge, however, is having enough money to buy new merchandise and increase her customer base. This is the reason why she is requesting a Kiva loan, which is her first request through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use it to buy picture frames, stuffed animals, cosmetics, and sweets, so she can take advantage of the end of the year, which will come with big parties and supplier discounts. This way she will be able to increase sales during the time of much Colombian celebration.

loans.use: to buy picture frames, stuffed animals, cosmetics, and sweets,to sell.

loans.name: Saron

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Cham province, Saron is 37 years old and a mother of three children. For her living, she makes wine as her main source of income and grows rice to supplement her income. She has been involved her business for 17 years. 

This is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to pay school fee for her sister, who wants to study English Language. 

She hopes that her sister can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay the school fee for her sister

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lorayne Paola

texts.es: Desde muy pequeña a Loraine le gustaron las ventas y gracias a esta aptitud hace un año, sus padres la apoyaron para convertirla en una buena comerciante, otorgándole su primer capital semilla, para que invirtiera en mercancía como realmente lo hizo. Hoy en día tiene como metas incrementar sus ventas y con ello mejorar su calidad de vida, aunque su mayor desafío es obtener fuentes de financiación que le ayuden a incrementar su negocio y mejorarlo.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará jeans, blusas accesorios etc. Sus ventas las realiza de contado a sus principales clientes que son sus vecinos y referídos por estos y ellos a final de año aumentan sus pedidos, para lo cual Loraine se preparará con esta inversión haciéndola así muy exitosa.
texts.en:
From a young age, Loraine loved sales, and thanks to this aptitude, a year ago her parents supported her in becoming a good merchant, granting her the initial capital so that she could invest it in merchandise, which is what she did. 

Today, her goals are to increase her sales, and with this improve her quality of life. Her major obstacle is obtaining sources of financing which would help her grow her business and improve it. 

She is asking for a Kiva loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy jeans, blouses, accessories, etc. Her sales are done in cash to her main customers, who are neighbours and those who are referred to her. At the end of the year, they increase their orders, for which Loraine will prepare herself with this loan, to make her business very successful.

loans.use: to buy jeans, blouses, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия — из Виноградово. Она торгует женской одеждой на рынке своего городка. Занимается торговлей уже 10 лет. Наемных рабочих нет — работает сама. Один из самых популярных товаров в ее бизнесе — это женские костюмы. 
На 25 000 гривен Наталия хочет закупить партию одежды под реализацию в этом сезоне, а именно она хочет приобрести блузки и кофты разных фасонов и размеров, чтобы удовлетворить самых разных своих клиенток. Умение развивать бизнес и вести торговлю помогает Наталии правильно и взвешенно строить бизнес, делая разумные капиталовложения в нужное время.
texts.en:
Nataliya is from Vinogradovo. She sells women's clothing at the market in her town and has worked in sales for over ten years. She does not have any employees and does everything on her own. One of her most popular products is women's suits.

Nataliya wants to spend 25,000 hryvnia on clothing for the new season, specifically blouses and sweaters in different sizes and styles, in order to appeal to a variety of clients. Developing her business and sales helps her to prudently build up her business in the right way and make reasonable investments at the right time.

loans.use: to buy blouses and sweaters to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez in Misamis Occidental province, the Philippines. She is widowed with 2 school-age children.

Grace has been engaged in the sand and gravel quarrying and distribution business for 15 years already. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of activity which is of great help to her family. At present, she is also receiving a monthly honorarium as an active barangay health worker. 

She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing construction materials for her house renovation and extension.

Grace has been a member of PMPC for more than 7 years. In the future, Grace hopes to expand her sand and gravel distribution business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her house renovation and extension.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, re-bar and construction materials for local improvements.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 42 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez in Misamis Occidental province, the Philippines. She is married with 2 dependent children, now school-aged.

Matilde is a sales manager in a real estate development company and has been engaged in real estate brokerage for 5 years. She earns approximately 20,000 PHP each month from this type of business. This helps her family a lot in sustaining their needs, even though she also receives support from her husband who is a seaman. 

Matilde has requested a loan to be used for paying the tuition fees of her daughter who is presently studying at one of the universities in Cebu City.

She has been a member of PMPC for almost 1 year. In the future, Matilde hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition fees of her daughter.

loans.name: Sadmira Del Rosario

texts.es: Samira de 50 años de edad habita en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 14 y 32 años. Hace 5 años emprendió su propio negocio, pues requería una fuente de ingresos adicional a la venta de lotería y chance. Su primer apoyo fue su amiga quien le entregó la primera mercancía para la venta, con la cual he ha ido muy bien hasta la presente. Como quiere mejorar sus ingresos con el fin de aumentar su calidad de vida, está enfrentando su mayor desafío, lo cual es que no tiene fuentes de financiación de manera fácil. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará jeans, perfumería, blusas entre otros artículos, que son de mayor rotación en su negocio para mejorar sus inventarios y hacer que la inversión de Kiva sea muy exitosa y mejore las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Samira is 50 years old and lives in a municipality located in an urban area of the city. She has two children that are 14 and 32 years old. Five years ago she began her own business because she needed to earn more than she could by only selling lottery tickets.

Her first help came from a friend who gave her the first pieces of merchandise to sell, with which she has done very well until the present. Because she would like to increase her income in order to improve her quality of life, she is now facing her greatest challenge: it is not easy for her to find sources of financing. For this reason she sought out credikiva, a first loan offered by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, that she will use to buy jeans, perfumes, and blouses, among other items. These things have the best rotation in her business, and will increase her inventory and ensure that the Kiva investment is a great success and improves the conditions of her business.

loans.use: to buy jeans, perfumes, and blouses, among other items.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: Alfonso de 20 años de edad habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla y tiene un gimnasio donde ofrece paquetes de entrenamiento y gimnasia a clientes que optan por tener cuerpo sano menta saludable y espíritu evolucionado.  Su idea de negocio nació porque conoce los beneficios físicos y mentales del ejercicio del cuerpo pues asistía a uno, ubicado lejos de su habitad. Esto lo llevó a observar la necesidad de que su comunidad tuviera uno muy cerca y decidió aventurarse y organizar un gimnasio que poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Ofrece paquetes de contado y a crédito por sesiones individuales y grupales durante todos los días desde la 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Su meta más adelante es comprar su propia vivienda y organizarse en un mejor local, pero su mayor desafío es la competencia y desde ya necesita posicionarse pues hace pocos días dieron apertura a uno nuevo en el barrio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, prime financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará proteínas en un mayor volumen para competir mucho mejor con precios y asesoría, ofreciendo un nuevo producto complemento del ejercicio físico, para mejorar la salud de sus clientes y hacer de esta inversión todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Alfonso is 20 years old, and lives in the city of Barranquilla. He has a gym where he offers fitness and training packages to customers who want to have a healthy body, a clear mind, and a well developed spirit.  The idea for his business was born because he recognizes the mental and physical benefits of exercise as he attended a gym, located far from his home. This brought him to observe the need for his community to have a closer gym, and he decided to venture into organizing one, which little by little has been growing. 

He offers packages for cash and for credit, with individual and group sessions every day of the week from 6am until 9pm. His goal is to later on buy his own living space and find a better location for his business, but his major obstacle is competition, as another gym just opened in the neighbourhood, so he needs to position himself better to compete.

He is applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which he will buy a large volume of protein, in order to better compete with prices and advice, offering a new product to go along with physical exercise, to improve the health of his clients and make this investment a success.

loans.use: to buy a large volume of protein.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 64 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is widowed and has two adult children. 

Carlos runs a tailoring business in his home which specializes in polo shirts, pants and uniform making. He has been doing this work for 40 years, and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP each month. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional cloth, thread, buttons and other accessories for his tailoring business. 

Carlos has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Carlos hopes to establish his own tailoring shop in the center of town.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth, thread, buttons and other accessories.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo de 66 años de edad habita en un municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad, donde se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, hace 20 años cuando una amiga le propuso la idea y ella la acogió y empezó vendiendo cosméticos mediante guías especializadas de productos; hoy día está afiliada a varias de estas empresas y genera ingresos que benefician su hogar. En su catálogo se encuentran ofertas de ropa, perfumería y accesorios que usualmente vienen con descuentos especiales, que ella ofrece a sus clientes para que les salga mucho más económico y al mismo tiempo que ella rota  rápidamente sus cuentas por cobrar. Su meta más adelante es lograr incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, pero su gran desafío es no tener fuentes de financiación muy oportunas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, accesorios, perfumes, provisionando su punto comercial para lograr incrementar sus inventarios y vender mucho más, especialmente en las temporadas venideras de fin de año, donde las familias se preparan para celebrar estas fiestas y en el hogar hay muy buena rotación de dinero por concepto de primas bonificaciones y descuentos especiales por parte de los productores y proveedores de sus productos. Con esta inversión sus inventarios crecerán y esto es muy bueno para su negocio.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 66 years old and lives in a municipality in the metropolitan area of the city where she sells a variety of merchandise. Twenty years ago a friend proposed the idea and she welcomed it and started to sell cosmetics through specialized catalogs of products.

Today she is affiliated with a number of these companies and generates income that benefit her household. In her catalog you find offers of clothing, perfume and accessories which usually come with special discounts. She offers these to her clients so that they are more economical and at the same time she rapidly fills her accounts receivable.

Her goal for the future is to manage to increase her revenues and improve her quality of living. Her great challenge is not having appropriate sources of financing. For this reason she is requesting a loan from Kiva, her first loan that she has had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

She will use it to buy clothing, accessories and perfume, stocking her sales point with to increase her inventory and sell much more. Especially with the approaching end of year season, when families prepare to celebrate these holidays. There is a good turnover of money in the homes because of the bonuses and special discounts offered by the producers and suppliers of her products. With this investment her inventory will increase and this will be good for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, accessories and perfume.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is driven by her passion for selling. At the age of 54, she is a hardworking mother of 5 adult-age children in Cartagena Proper, Plaridel in the Philippines. She runs a store to supplement the income of her husband for their family. Every day she never tires of tending her store. 

Erlinda is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She has religiously made her repayments without any record of default. 

Now, she has taken another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, soy sauce, oil, noodles and canned goods to sell in her store. Having enough inventory would mean better income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store in order to continuously provide for her family and live a decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of sugar, soy sauce, oil, noodles and canned goods to sell in her store.

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa est une dame très engagée dans la gestion du groupement ainsi que de ses activités génératrices de revenu. Elle fait parti des plus dynamique et s’active dans la vente de poisson fumé et autres produits alimentaires à savoir la pâte d’arachide, le thé vert, le sucre et autres produits à usage domestique tel que les batteries électriques pour radio et torche. Veuve de son état elle prend en charge ses 03 enfants dont 02 filles de 12 à 15 ans et un garçon de 07 ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle désire acheter du poisson fumé par panier pour unE valeur de 60 000 Fr FCA, 02 seaux de pâte d’arachide de 20 litres et le reste pour divers produits facilement vendable dans son village.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices en grande partie pour la gestion scolaire, sanitaire et alimentaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa is a woman who is very dedicated to managing the group, as well as her revenue-generating work. She is one of the most energetic and is active in selling smoked fish and other grocery items, namely, peanut butter, green tea, sugar, and other household goods, such as batteries for radios and flashlights. A widow, she supports three children (two girls, aged 12 and 15; and a boy, aged 7).

With her new loan, she would like to purchase some smoked fish by the basket worth 60,000 francs CFA and two 20-liter pails of peanut butter. The rest is for a variety of goods she can sell easily in her village. 

She uses her profits for the most part to manage the schooling, healthcare, and food for her children.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish by the basket and pails of peanut butter

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia an industrious mother. She requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more fish to sell. This way, she will be able to raise more income, and the income will enable her to help her husband to provide their family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fish for selling.

loans.name: Rexes

texts.en:
Rexes is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business buying and selling frozen foods, in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell. Rexes has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Normita

texts.en:
Normita signed up for her membership with PMPC. She availed herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store. She is thankful for the capital that PMPC extends, to small-time borrowers like her.

Normita has been able to turn the tide in her favor, and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she obtained a new loan, which she used to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to establish a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Dienaba's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été mise en place ce 14 Mai 2008 jour de son inauguration. Il est composé de  femmes très engagées dans le développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles  sont issues d’un même groupement féminin du quartier. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce, la transformation de produits agricoles et l’artisanat.

Madame Diénaba, âgée de 41 ans (debout à l’extrême gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est divorcée et mère de deux garçons dont elle a la charge. Elle s’active dans la couture depuis plus de 05 ans et gère un atelier avec deux tailleurs. Elle achète les tissus et divers fournitures et garnitures pour la confection de prêts à porter.

Avec son  nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des tissues qualités chiffon pour un lot et demi de 150 métres et divers garnitures.

 Les bénéfices lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille (alimentation) et d’assurer un meilleur suivi pour l’éducation de son second fils.
texts.en:
The ’banc villageois’ was set up on May 14, 2008, the day of the inauguration [of this group], which is composed of women who are very dedicated to developing of their revenue-generating businesses. The women are from the same women’s group of the district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce, processing farm produce, and arts & crafts. 

Ms. Diénaba, aged 41, is standing at the far left with a hand raised. She is the featured borrower of the group. Divorced and the mother of two boys, whom she supports, she has been active in sewing for over five years and manages a shop with two tailors. She purchases fabrics and various trims and supplies for making ready-to-wear clothing. 

With her new loan, she is going to purchase 150 meters of chiffon-quality fabrics [1 ½  lots] and a variety of trim.

The profits will enable her to improve her family’s living conditions (food) and to ensure that her second son continues his education.

loans.use: to purchase chiffon fabrics and various trims and some carrots, cabbage, and legumes

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, age 36, requests a loan of PHP 12,000 from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to expand her resources. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell at retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell at retail

loans.name: Madisson

texts.es: Con 18 años Madisson es propietaria de una miscelánea, ubicada en el lugar donde habita con su familia. Madisson tomó la experiencia de su madre, una mujer comerciante, para seguir su ejemplo y generar ingresos de manera independiente, primero lo hizo buscando clientes para su madre y luego su padre le dio su primer capital semilla, para que emprendiera su soñada aventura comercial. Camisas, pantalones, accesorios femeninos y para el hogar, además de pañales papelería son los artículos, que los clientes encuentran en el punto comercial de Madisson. Sus ventas las promueve casa a casa, cliente a cliente,  de quienes obtiene solicitudes pedidos, que hacen que sus inventarios se adapten a las necesidades de su clientela potencial. En la actualidad está aplicando a un  credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la   Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará camisas y pantalones, mercancía que es la más solicitada para el fin de año, donde todas las familias esperan pasarlo elegantes entre abrazos y sonrisas, y bailando para esperar las navidades y el año nuevo.
texts.en:
Madisson is 18 years old and is the proprietor of a general store, located in the place where her family lives. Madisson follows in the footsteps of her mother, who is a saleswoman, and followed her example of earning money independently. She began by helping her mother find clients, then her father gave her some seed capital to embark on the business adventure she dreamed of.

The articles that can be found at Madisson's store include blouses, pants, women's accessories, home decor, diapers and paper items. She goes around to households and to clients to promote her products, then she takes orders and purchases inventory according to the tastes of her customers.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she will receive through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to purchase blouses and pants. Such merchandise is in high demand towards the end of the year, when families want to be dressed elegantly as they hug, smile and dance and await Christmas and the new year.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: En el año 1988, hace 25 años, cuando Oscar quedó sin empleo, fue al mercado público, para invertir, seguir produciendo y generar ingresos; fue así como sin saber que hacer,  acudió a sus amigos quienes le recomendaron vender pescado y desde entonces no ha dejado de hacerlo. Su negocio lo ofrece puerta a puerta de contado y a crédito, en todo el barrio donde habita y en sectores aledaños a él. Hoy su meta es lograr tener una pescadería, para aumentar sus ingresos y apoyar la educación de sus hijos, con el fin de que tengan a futuro éxito. Para todo esto se prepara aumentando sus ventas mediante nuevas inversiones, con las que planea aumentar su productividad comercial  y esta es justamente la razón por la cual  ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará, pescado y como se acerca el fin de año, tambien incursionará como es su  costumbre en esta temporada, en la venta de ropa y calzado, pues aprovechará a su clientela cautiva para venderle adicionalmente los vestidos con los cuales esperaran las navidades y el año nuevo disfrutando con sus familias, haciendo así que esta inversión tenga éxito.
texts.en:
Twenty five years ago in 1988 Oscar found himself without work. He went to the public market to invest and continue to produce and generate income. As he didn't know what to do he went to his friends who recommended that he sell fish and he hasn't stopped doing it yet. He goes door-to-door with his business selling in cash and on credit all over the neighborhood he lives in, and in adjacent areas.

Today his goal is to have a fish store to increase his revenues and support the education of his children so that they have a successful future. To achieve this he is preparing to increase his sales with a new investment of money as he plans to increase his commercial productivity. This is the reason he has requested a loan from Kiva the first loan that he has had with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

With it he will buy fish and since the end of the year is approaching he will also venture into the sale of clothing and footwear as is his custom in this season. He takes advantage of already having his clientele to additionally sell them clothing as they are waiting to enjoy Christmas and New Year's with their families. This will make it a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy fish, clothing and footwear.

loans.name: Christie

texts.en: Christie landed at the right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet after her first business went bad. PMPC came to her as a rescue, lending her money when she needed it the most. Now, she has requested another loan for the next cropping season to pay for labor and land cultivation. Christie perseveres and always strives to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay labor cost and land cultivation

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is 43 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with six children. Mary Ann has a mini grocery store. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for coco land redemption. Mary Ann has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Mary Ann hopes to have a descent home for her family.

loans.use: to pay for coco land redemption

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is 50 years old, married and lives at Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She requests a loan of PHP 27,000 to buy additional bags of pig feed. She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, supplementing the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to improve sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of pig feed.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Carina works hard to support her family. She has a prepared-food-vending business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from buying and selling oysters.

Carina is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 31 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, and noodles to sell.

Catherine has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Catherine aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 74 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, and milk.

Florenda has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 38 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear products.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs,and milk.

loans.name: Grey

texts.es: Hace 5 años inició la experiencia de Grey, en la reparación de todo tipo de radiocomunicadores , negocio que actualmente realiza con empresas que compran estos servicios y con la comunidad donde habita, con las que le va muy bien. Como su esposo conoce la parte técnica de reparación de tele comunicadores, ellos decidieron dar apertura a su negocio en el año 2009 y desde allí se dividieron el trabajo, él trabajando la parte técnica y Grey en el área comercial, promoviendo el servicio mediante visitas a las empresas, para ofrecerlo. Su meta es tener un taller más amplio y contar con nuevos trabajadores, con el fin de generar más ingresos y lograr profesionalizar a sus hijos en las edades de 3, 14 y 17 años. En el taller de esta pareja, se realizan mantenimiento y reparaciones de radios, micrófonos y accesorios afines, lo cual realiza de contado y a crédito trabajando todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Su desafío es generar todos los días nuevos clientes  y justamente debe tener en sus inventarios de todo un poco, para aventurarse a impactar nuevos mercados, Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación maro Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará, repuestos de radios, micrófonos y otros accesorios, como insumos de su tarea y para comercializar entre nuevos clientes. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará  pues tendrá nuevos repuestos para la venta y nuevos radios en su oferta y  el mercado de clientes se moverá mucho más, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Grey began her experience in repairing all types of radio-communications devices 5 years ago. She now works with other businesses, who purchase her services, and in the community where she lives, and it is working very well. Since her husband knows the technical part of repairing telecommunications devices, they decided to open their business in 2009, and since then have shared the work. He works in the technical part, and Grey takes care of the commercial side, promoting their services by visiting businesses and describing their offer.

Their goal is to have a bigger workshop and hire new workers, in order to generate more income and provide a professional education for their children, who are now 3, 14, and 17 years old.

In this couple’s workshop they provide maintenance and repair radios, microphones, and similar accessories, both paid on the spot and on credit. They work every day from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. Their personal challenge is to get new clients every day, and to do this they need a little of everything in their inventory, in order to reach new markets. 

For this reason they are seeking a credikiva loan, a first source of financing offered by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. The loan will be used to buy radio parts, microphones and other accessories, the materials needed in their work and in order to market to new clients. This investment will improve their business because they will have new parts for sale and new radios to offer. Their client market will be much more dynamic, making this credikiva a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy radio parts, microphones, and similar items.

loans.name: Kiswendsida Silgo Group

texts.fr:
Mme Basga est la représentante du groupe KISWENDSIDA SILGO. Elle se porte très bien. Marié, Elle est mère de 04 enfants, le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 04 mois. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 10 personnes en charge.
Madame est productrice de boisson locale depuis 03 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 sac de mil.
Mme Basga veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son commerce et se lancer dans la vente du bois. Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Basga is the representative of the group KISWENDSIDA SILGO. She is in good health. A married mother, she has four children. The oldest is 12 years old, and the youngest is 4 months old. One goes to school. Ms. Basga has ten persons to support. 

She has been producing a local beverage for three years. She gets her supplies from nearby markets. Her customers are the residents of her district. 

She is going to purchase a sack of millet. She wants to use her profits to expand her commerce and get started in selling wood. She wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of millet

loans.name: Namanegbzanga Kaligri Group

texts.fr:
Mme Koudougou est la représentante du groupe NAMANEGBZANGA KALIGRI. Elle se porte très bien. Marié, elle est mère de 03 enfants, le plus âgé a 45 ans et le moins âgé a 27 ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.
Madame est agriculteur et vend du mil germé depuis 40 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle  veut s’acheter 01 sac de mil et 01 sac d’haricot.
Madame veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour aider à la scolarisation de son enfant  et avoir son propre magasin de céréales.
texts.en:
Ms. Koudougou is the representative of the group NAMANEGBZANGA KALIGRI. She is in good health. A married mother, she has three children. The oldest is 45 years old, and the youngest is 27. One goes to school. Ms. Koudougou has three persons to support. 

She has been farming and selling sprouted millet for forty years. She gets her supplies from markets in her district. Her customers are the residents of her district. 

She wants to purchase a sack of millet and a sack of beans. She wants to use her profits to help cover her child’s education and to have her own grains store.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of millet and a sack of beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for updated equipment to meet growing demand.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John needs a loan to support his marketing efforts.

In July 2013, John got his insurance license and currently sells life, health, and accident insurance as an independent representative in his home town of Oklahoma City, Oklahoma. He is licensed in Oklahoma and Texas. Most of his clients are local, and referrals are an important part of his business. While that has helped to establish John’s practice, he would like to reach a wider customer base through advertising. Having built a track record with his existing clients, John believes he could help more people make appropriate insurance-related decisions.

John is originally from Jordan, but has lived in the US for over forty years. His wife and three children depend on his income to support the family. John understands the value of his hard work, saying, “I want to provide my family financial freedom and security and also be able to help others make a difference in their lives.”

loans.use: to pay for marketing efforts and generate new leads.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, 47 years old, is married and a resident of Panalsalan, Plaridel in the Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches are sold at public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already. Since she wants to be more productive, Imelda decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at market. 

On July 9, 2009 both Imelda and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to take advantage of a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. However, aside from not only the financial assistance they received, they say they also enjoyed add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  

Imelda has applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy more fish for resale. She hopes that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband, she can one day become a successful fish seller who supplies both the public market and neighboring town.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Wendpouire Silgo Group

texts.fr:
Mr Samuel est le représentant du groupe WENDPOUIRE SILGO. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 02 enfants, le plus âgé a 05 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. Personne ne va à l’école. Il a 02 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est  vendeur de carburant et pratique l’élevage depuis 02 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés  environnants. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Il  veut s’acheter 03 bidons d’essence ; 02 moutons ; 01 chèvre.
Mr Samuel veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour accroitre son activité et  améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Samuel is the representative of the group WENDPOUIRE SILGO. He is in good health. A married father, he has two children. The oldest is five years old, and the youngest is 2. None goes to school. He has two persons to support. 

Mr. Samuel has been a vendor of fuels and a livestock farmer for two years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. His customers are the residents of his district.  

He wants to purchase 3 containers of gasoline, 2 sheep, and a goat. He wants to use his profits to grow his business and to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 3 containers of gasoline, 2 sheep, and a goat

loans.name: Jenisa

texts.en:
Jenisa is 23 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field and planting vegetables.
 
In need of additional working capital, Jenisa joined Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans and recently requested a loan for 50,000 PHP, which she will use to buy for vegetable seedlings and two sacks of fertilizers. Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income and provide for the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables seedlings and two sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is married and works hard to support her family. Jean operates a fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 40 years.

Jean requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Uniqua

texts.en:
This loan will help Uniqua purchase updated software and work on her website.

Uniqua prepared her first tax filing at age 16 after completing an accounting trade class, and she has not looked back! She now runs her own tax preparation business, serving individual and business clients in the Bronx. She supports herself and her twin sons.

Uniqua comes from a family of small business owners, and she takes prides in “the opportunity to help people and create jobs during the tax season.” Her goal is to have her own office and employ community members. 

Uniqua needs this loan to keep her tax software up to date and to build out her website. Both investments will help her provide the best service she can to her clients, as well as grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for updated software and launch her business website.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 68 years old, widowed, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 50 years. She earns additional income from pig fattening and selling charcoal.

Lucia requested her twenty sixth loan from NWTF for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more items to sell such as noodles, eggs, chips, canned goods, etc. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, eggs, chips, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement and sand

loans.name: Ansel Graham

texts.en:
Ansel needs a loan to help manage employee payroll and build up his credit.

Some people struggle with how to fill their retirement time – not Ansel. “I just wanted to continue the passion of what I love to do – to serve.” Ansel served in law enforcement for twenty years, and after retiring, he started Chameleon Security Group. http://www.chameleonsecuritygroup.com/

His business has “a proven method of strategic planning, attention to detail, and seamless execution.” Ansel employs four full-time employees and is proud that he can provide quality employment to support those families.

Ansel’s business offers security services and bodyguards on a contract basis. As a contractor, it can be difficult to access traditional credit. As Ansel grows his business in the Port St. Lucie, Florida area, he is building more regular clients. This loan will help manage employee payroll between jobs and build up his credit.

loans.use: to manage employee payroll for his security service.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This loan will pay for new equipment for John’s construction company.

John is excited to start his own construction business, focusing on home improvement, in Luzerne County, Pennsylvania. He is eager to build out his portfolio of projects, contributing to the visual appeal and residential décor of the area. As his business grows, John anticipates increasing his head count and recognizes the importance of taking good care of his employees. 

John’s company needs this loan to get the necessary equipment for client projects. Your support will allow John to build out his capabilities and attract new customers.

loans.use: to pay for new equipment for his construction company.

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen is 45 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Arleen operates a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. 

Arleen requested a loan from NWTF for 29,500 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients such as meat, beans, vegetables, fish, etc. for her food production business. In the future, Arleen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as meat, beans, vegetables, fish, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.en:
Gaspar is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in hand-carved wood sculptures. He would like to invest in a purchase of wood.

Gaspar has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is his story:

"I was born in 1981 in Santiago Atitlan, and ever since I was a little boy I've always enjoyed making things with my hands. For a long time I worked in textiles and crafting beaded jewelry until I found my true passion: wood carving. I began carving wood in 2003 and I've done apprenticeships in several workshops. Now I work along my brother, Diego. I love working with him because I'm always learning from him all the while he encourages me to create my own designs and products."

Use the link below to view Gaspar's hand-carved wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8977

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in handcrafted jade jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of green jade and sterling silver.

Pablo has been selling through NOVICA since 2013. This is his story:

"I find the history associated with jade to be inspiring. This beautiful stone has been treasured and worked since the times of the ancient Maya. Jade can only be found in a few countries around the world, so I feel fortunate to have the privilege to have it nearby and to create something so valuable. The first piece I ever made was the replica of a Maya mask from Tikal. It was a lot of hard work, but in the end my bosses were pleased with it and soon sold it at their store. I continued working hard to save enough to set up my own workshop, and I finally got it set up in 2000."

Use the link below to view Pablo's handcrafted jade jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8890

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of green jade and sterling silver

loans.name: Jamie

texts.en:
This loan helps Jamie purchase an updated computer and improve her ability to provide services to her clients remotely.

Jamie had been doing bookkeeping for a few companies and realized that she could combine her specialized skills with her desire to spend more time with her two children. “I love doing bookkeeping, but I also thought it was a good plan to help small businesses that cannot afford to hire a full-time bookkeeper or a part-time CPA,” Jamie said. She enjoys helping her local community’s business owners and provides a much-needed service at an affordable rate. She and her two children live in Jeffersonville, Indiana.

Jamie is optimistic about her future and hopes to one day run this business full time. As with any start-up, she needs equipment to meet the needs of her clients. For Jamie, that means a new computer with updated software that will allow her to remotely access client systems for her work.

loans.use: to pay for an updated computer.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es  enfermera y está terminando la licenciatura en enfermería con el propósito de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y a la vez poder ayudar a sus seres queridos
Para ella es fundamental terminar su carrera ya que es madre soltera con un hijo y ella quiere poder darle una vida sin privaciones ni carencias, es por el que se está esforzando al máximo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is from the town of Carapeguá. She is a nurse and currently completing her nursing qualification so she can improve her own standard of living and at the same time that of her loved ones.

For Maria it is vital that she complete her professional qualifications as she is a single mother with a son. She wishes to be able to offer him a life without hardships and shortages. This is the reason she works so hard.

She is seeking a loan to pay for the cost of her professional qualification so she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: Play university fees

loans.name: Sona's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été mise en place ce 14 Mai 2008 jour de son inauguration. Il est composé de  femmes très engagées dans le développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles  sont issues d’un même groupement féminin du quartier. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce, la transformation de produits agricoles et l’artisanat.

Madame Sona (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle mariée et mère de 02 filles et un garçon. Elle est vendeuse de légumes frais au marché central. Elle s’approvisionne via des transporteurs après envoie de son argent auprès de vendeur en gros des zone maraichers. Elle fait cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.  

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle envisage d’acheter en quantité : 20 sacs d’ognons, 10 de pomme de terre, 300 kg de carotte, choux et divers légumes.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte assister son mari en chômage, assurant les frais scolaires des enfants, la nourriture de la famille, les frais de santé et l’habillement.
texts.en:
The ’banc villageois’ was set up on May 14, 2008, the day of the inauguration [of this group], which is composed of women who are very dedicated to developing of their revenue-generating businesses. The women are from the same women’s group in the district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce, processing farm produce, and arts & crafts. 

Ms. Sona (standing at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of two girls and a boy. She is a vendor of fresh vegetables at the central market. She gets her supplies via transporters after sending her money to wholesalers from market farm areas. She has been in this business for over ten years and enjoys good experience in this domain. 

With her new loan, she envisions purchasing: 20 sacks of onions, 10 of potatoes, 300 kg of carrots, some cabbage, and a variety of legumes. 

With the profits, she is planning to help out her husband, who is unemployed, and to ensure the children’s schooling and the family’s food, healthcare, and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase onions, potatoes, carrots, cabbage, and various legumes

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years. She earns additional income from selling fish. 

Beatriz requested a loan from NWTF for 45,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sonkar's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été mise en place ce 14 Mai 2008 jour de son inauguration. Il est composé de  femmes très engagées dans le développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles  sont issues d’un même groupement féminin du quartier. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce, la transformation de produits agricoles et l’artisanat.

Madame Sounkar (debout à gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 garçons. Elle fait le commerce de tissus teintés qu’elle achète dans un pays frontalier pour la revente par pièce dans son quartier. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 45 pièces de tissus teintés et 30 pièces de bazin pour la revente par pièce.

Les bénéfices qu’elle réalise lui permettent d’aider son mari pour la prise en charge des frais d’études des enfants et d’accroître son épargne.
texts.en:
The ’banc villageois’ was set up on May 14, 2008, the day of its inauguration. It is composed of women who are very dedicated to developing their revenue-generating businesses. The women are from the same women’s group in the district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce, processing farm produce, and arts & crafts. 

Ms. Sounkar (standing at the left with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is a married mother of three boys. She does commerce in dyed fabrics, which she purchases from a bordering nation, and then resells in lengths in her district. She has good experience in this domain for having worked at it for years.  

With this loan, she intends to purchase 45 lengths of dyed fabrics and 30 lengths of damask to resell. 

The profits she makes enable her to help out her husband in covering the costs of schooling for the children and to grow her savings.

loans.use: to purchase 45 lengths of dyed fabrics and 30 lengths of damask to resell.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald needs a loan to purchase additional computer equipment and update his database system.

Ronald has found a way to combine justice, art, and business. He has a background in photography and design and quickly learned the importance of protecting intellectual property. He decided to study law and now runs Gregg and Associates (http://www.greggandassociates.org). Located in Staten Island, Ronald’s law practice specializes in business, entertainment, and immigration law. 

Ronald’s business strategy includes community empowerment and business development. He is proud to also provide pro-bono work in his community. “We offer the best legal services, even when the clients cannot afford the best,” he says. In addition to his law practice, Ronald engages in public speaking and mentoring at local civic and religious organizations for youth development.

This loan will help Ronald purchase additional computer equipment and expand his capabilities to provide immigration and intellectual property law services. Ronald says he aims “to assist clients to get their work seen worldwide.”

loans.use: to pay for additional computer equipment and upgrade his database system.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Calling all fashionistas! While holding a down a full-time managerial position at a local university, Augustina realized that she could use her fashion and retail knowledge to open an online boutique. To establish her store, she needs a loan to purchase merchandise to sell.

Augustina is originally from Nigeria and has lived in the US for over twenty years. As a start-up online retail store, she says that “financially supporting my dreams” has been most difficult. But, she knows she is at the start of an exciting journey!

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her online boutique.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, es una persona que se esfuerza para poder salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de sus estudios.
Quiere ayudar a las personas por medio de su carrera y realizarse como profesional y como persona.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y de esa manera poder seguir.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the town of Carapeguá and is studying Business Administration. He is a person who makes a lot of effort to get ahead and help his family. He wishes to help people through his work and make something of himself both as a professional and a person.

Carlos is seeking a loan to pay his university fees so he can continue his studies.

loans.use: Pay his university fees

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Tita has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Tita has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, es una mujer muy dedicada a sus estudios, que se esta esforzando para poder salir adelante y dar a sus seres queridos un buen ejemplo.
Ella esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y sueña con poder crecer y salir adelante por medio de su carrera.
Pide este prestamo para poder pagar las cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Liz is from the town of San Ignacio. She is a woman who is dedicated to her studies so she works very hard to be able to get ahead and give an example to her loved ones. She is studying Accounting. Her dream is to able to grow as a person and make progress in life through her work.

Liz is seeking a loan so she can pay her university fees and continue her studies.

loans.use: Pay her university fees

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es: María de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 17 y 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como vendedora de ropa para hombre y mujer, además vende sandalias y zapatos de mujer en los mercados cercanos desde hace 15 años. María esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo recibido ya con el crédito anterior logró reparar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que desea obtener un nuevo crédito para construir una galera con pasamano en la parte de su vivienda que se muestra en la fotografía y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro, lámina y polines para construir una galera con pasamano en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children who are 17 and 14 years old.

She is an entrepreneurial woman who earns a living selling men’s and women’s clothing, as well as sandals and women’s shoes. She has been selling in local markets for 15 years.

María is grateful for the support she has received as with her previous loan she managed to repair the roof of her house. She wishes to obtain a new loan to build a staircase with handrail in the part of her house that can be seen in the photograph. She is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, steel sheets and roofing supports to build the staircase in her home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, steel sheets and roofing supports to build a staircase in her home

loans.name: Earnest

texts.en:
Born and raised in Oklahoma, Earnest started his own janitorial service company, “The Professionals”, in 2007. At the time, his goal was to help himself and his wife through college. Now, he employs eight to ten employees and supports his wife and daughter, an accomplishment he is very proud of.

Earnest’s business provides janitorial services for commercial buildings such as warehouses, professional office space, and government offices. As Earnest establishes his business, he must juggle all the variables of setting up contracts for these services. His vision is to build his company into the top janitorial service provider in the Sooner State.

One difficulty Earnest has is consolidating his finances and building his credit. This loan will help streamline his debt burden, while helping him get on stronger financial footing. Earnest has great potential to keep Oklahoma clean!

loans.use: to consolidate his finances and build his credit.

loans.name: Mame Bousso's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 37 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 31 juillet 2013. Ce banc est constituer par des femmes qui habitent le même quartier et ceux des alentours. Leurs activités principales: le commerce et la couture.
Ndeye debout à droite de la photo et levant la main , est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d' une fille.
Avec le prêt elle envisage e de faire de la couture. Elle achète des tissu pour drap qu'elle confectionne. Un drap fini coute 12500f . Elle fabrique aussi des chaussures en perle et le paire lui revient à 3500f.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de soutenir sa fille et son frère et toute autre personne qui sollicite son aide. Elle renforce aussi son épargne.
texts.en:
This group of 37 women is part of the ’banc villageois’ that was created on July 13, 2013. The ‘banc’ is composed of women living in and around the same district. Their main work involves: commerce and sewing. 

Ndeye, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is 51 years old and a married mother of one girl. 

With the loan, she envisions working in sewing. She purchases fabrics for bed sheets, which she makes. A finished bed sheet costs 12,500 francs. She also makes beaded shoes, and a pair brings in 3,500 francs. The profits enable her to support her daughter and her brother and anyone else who asks for her help. She is also bolstering her savings.
