loans.use: to purchase cloth, thread, and beads

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Born in Detroit, but raised in the Dominican Republic, Tania now lives and works in Miami in the custom sign business. “I’m very creative, and I have a passion for design and the arts,” Tania says. She supports herself, her husband, and two teenage sons. She and her two full-time employees handle both the design and construction of the signs, providing one-stop shopping for clients in the Miami area. Major construction firms regularly use Tania’s business (www.SARmiami.com).

Tania has been a small business owner for over a decade. Over that time, she has appreciated being her own boss. She says, “I was not tied to a fixed schedule, and this gave me lots of flexibility. Now, it’s giving me the opportunity to expand to other areas.” But, like many small businesses, Tania has found getting traditional bank loans very difficult. 

Tania needs a loan to purchase supplies and take on some new clients and their (initially) smaller projects. Tania expects these smaller projects to lead to larger projects and steadier contract work with these clients. This loan will also help build up her credit.

loans.use: to pay for graphic art supplies for her custom sign business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 51 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. 

Wilma has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her farming equipment.

Wilma has been farming rice for 9 years now and has borrowed from NWTF five times in the past to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her farming equipment

loans.name: Ma. Nilda

texts.en:
Ma. Nilda is 53 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Nilda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Nilda has been fattening pigs for two years and earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Beogneere Tanghin Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Tibo est le représentant du groupe BEOGNEERE TANGHIN. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 10 enfants, le plus âgé a 34 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 10 vont à l’école. Il a 12 personnes en charge.
Mme est éleveur depuis 14 ans. Il  s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les commerçants des villes voisines.
Il  veut s’acheter 04 brebis.
Monsieur Tibo veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour accroitre  son activité. Il  ambitionne créer une école d’élevage  et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Tibo is the representative of the group BEOGNEERE TANGHIN. He is in good health. A married father, he has ten children. The oldest is 34, and the youngest is 2. Ten go to school. He has 12 persons to support. 

Mr. Tibo has been a livestock farmer for fourteen years. He gets his supplies at nearby markets. His customers are the merchants from neighboring towns. He wants to purchase four ewes. He wants to use his profits to grow his business. His ambition is to establish a school for livestock farming and to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase four ewes

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 30 años, está casada, tiene 2 hijos, es empleada asalariada y en otras horas realiza trabajos en una consultora agraria. Ella está realizando su tesis de la carrera de administración agraria.
Ella se esta esforzando para poder ser un ejemplo para sus hijos, a la vez que lucha por realizarse como persona y profesional.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus gastos de tesis, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por esta ayuda que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
Mirian is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She is a salaried employee and works on the side at an agricultural consultancy. She is doing her thesis for a degree in agricultural management.

She is striving to be an example for her children, at the same time that she is seeking fulfillment as a person and a professional.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in paying the expenses for her thesis, to be able to cover this expense that she has. She is grateful for this assistance, which will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to pay for her thesis expenses.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a hog farmer and just made a significant investment in a 160 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, in order to proactively take advantage of his animals' waste and produce his own biogas. The purchase of the biodigester is a crucial step for the growth of his business, since operating costs on his farm used to be very high, especially because of the regular purchase of expensive fossil fuel (propane). 

He now has the opportunity to manage his pigs' manure in an efficient way: he transforms it into renewable energy and can supply his farm in energy he produces himself. From now on, the piglets will stay warm thanks to a biogas-powered heating system that is directly connected to the biodigester! In addition to reducing costs, Victor will transform his hog farm into a model for a productive and environment-friendly waste management system. 

This loan represents 24% of the total cost of the Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 160 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.en:
Juan Luis, who works alongside his wife, Carmen, is an artisan from Peru who specializes in silver jewelry with mate gourds and gemstones. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of sterling silver and gemstones.

Juan Luis has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"We love to let our imagination run free and be as creative as we want to be. We are inspired by everything we see, even by the discarded pieces from other things we made! We put them together and play with them, like a jigsaw puzzle. I love to see how mistakes can be transformed into beautiful things."

"We'd like to use this microcredit to prepare new designs and deeper inventory for the upcoming holiday season. Thanks!"

Use the link below to view Juan Luis's silver jewelry with mate gourds and gemstones on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/6054

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of sterling silver and gemstones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an 8 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics and perfumes to resell to her customers

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement des Femmes Commerçantes est composé de 05 femmes qui font pratiquement  la même activité et sont dans le même marché. Elles se regroupent  à la fin de la journée pour faire des tontines journalières et ont en même temps des liens de voisinage.  Elles sont à leur 3ème prêt et demande ce dernier pour renforcer leur fond de roulement et augmenter leur stock de marchandises.  La dame Madame Rokhaya est leur présidente. On l’a reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation de divers produits alimentaires et a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa  journée à 9h pour la terminer à 18h. A l’avenir, elle souhaite renforcer son volume de vente et augmenter ses revenus.
texts.en:
The 'Femmes Commerçantes' Group is made up of five women who all work in similar businesses, at the same market.  They get together at the end of each day to contribute to their daily savings group, and all live in the same neighbourhood.

This will be the group's third loan and they have requested it in order to build up their working capital and stock levels.

Rokhaya is the group president.  She is seen in the photo with her hand raised.  Rokhaya has more than five years' experience selling various food items.  She helps her husband to provide for the daily needs of their children and their school fees.  She works from nine in the morning until six in the evening.

In the future, Rokhaya would like to increase her sales volume and improve her revenue.

loans.use: to buy food items such as rice, oil, sugar and soap, for resale.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 56 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 4 children who are now adults. 

Nelia as the sole breadwinner has been selling dried fish for four years now. She earns approximately 1,500 PHP each month from selling dried fish to her neighbors and friends in the community. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stocks of dried fish for retail.

Nelia has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Nelia hopes to acquire a stall in the market place for her business.

loans.use: to purhase additional stocks of dried fish

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está en su quinto año de la carrera de Derecho, comenta que es funcionaria judicial por lo que le es de mucha ayuda su carrera.
Quiere ser una buena abogada que luche por los derechos de las demás personas, de manera a poder realizarse como persona y profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera, y así poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Fabiola is from the city of Caaguazú. She is in her fifth year of a law degree. She says that she is a judicial civil servant, because her studies are so helpful to her.

She wants to be a good lawyer who fights for the rights of other people, so that she can be fulfilled as a person and a professional.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her degree, so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Midji Koffi

texts.fr:
Midji Koffi est un homme âgé de 40 ans. Il est marié à une couturière. Il a 02 enfants.
Midji Koffi travaille comme revendeur de cassettes depuis 2010. Il exerce seul son activité dans un quartier de la ville de Lomé et achète ses marchandises à Lomé. 
Midji Koffi a requis son cinquiéme cycle de prêt de WAGES afin d’acheter des cassettes.
Dans les prochaines années, Midji Koffi voudrait avoir une boutique pour répondre plus à la demande de la clientèle. Et pour mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Midji Koffi is a 40-year-old man. He is married to a seamstress and has two children. 

Midji Koffi has been selling cassette tapes since 2010. He runs his business by himself in a neighborhood of Lomé, and he buys his products in Lomé. 

Midji Koffi is asking for a loan from WAGES in order to buy cassette tapes. 

In the coming years, Midji Koffi would like to open a shop in order to better meet the demands of his customers, and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy cassette tapes

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est une femme mariée de 49 ans et mère de 3 enfants dont 02 sont scolarisés). Son conjoint exerce la profession de chauffeur tandis qu’elle pratique le commerce. Elle achète et revend du maïs et du riz. Elle est très souvent confrontée au problème de fluctuation de prix des produits sur le marché. Adjowa fait partie de l’aimable clientèle de WAGES et elle sollicite un troisième crédit dans le but de réaliser de l’approvisionnement en marchandises. Elle espère que ce crédit permettra l’éclosion de son activité et l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adjowa is a 49-year-old, married woman, and the mother of three children, of whom two are in school.  Her husband is a chauffeur by trade, while she works in commerce.  She buys and sells corn and rice. 

Adjowa is very often confronted with the problem of product price fluctuations on the market.  She is a client of the field partner, WAGES, and has requested this third loan in order to stock up on merchandise. 

Adjowa hopes that this loan will enable her business to flourish and her family to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of corn and rice to sell.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 24 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child now an infant.

Melba earns a living from a direct selling business, particularly RTW products of GTY (Ready to Wear products from GTY Trading). She’s been doing this business for more than one year already. Melba earns approximately PHP 4,500 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stock of RTW products from GTY for resale. Melba has become a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Melba hopes to expand her direct selling business and to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of RTW's.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is earning a profit from selling snacks to her neighbours. Her business does well when she doubles her time making delicious and nutritious food snacks. With her husband's help, she has maximized her profits and keeps pursuing her goals for the good of her family.

The reason why she availed herself of another loan from PMPC was to buy more inventories of raw ingredients for her chosen business. Today, Susan is able to provide for her family and is willing to help others to do retailing business with her food snacks.

loans.use: to buy more inventories of raw ingredients for her chosen business

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es una persona luchadora, día a día se esmera para poder ser alguien en la vida y lograr ese ideal que tiene. Comenta que es su familia quien la inspira a poder seguir luchando.
Está estudiando la carrera de derecho, y por medio de su conocimiento quiere ir ascendiendo y llegar a un alto cargo en la empresa donde está.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que eso representa un gran gasto y quiere poder cubrirlo.
texts.en:
Olga is a hard working young woman. Every day she takes great pains to make something of herself and to reach her goals. She says that her family is what inspires her to work hard.

She is going to school for a law degree and she hopes that her education will help help her to continue to grow and to reach a high level position at the business where she works.

She is asking for this loan to invest in paying for tuition because her schooling is expensive and she wants to be able to cover the costs.

loans.use: pay for tuition.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima es estudiante de la carrera deIngeniería  agroindustrial, está en el tercer año de la facultad, vieja todos los días varios kilómetros para poder seguir sus estudios.
Cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres y hermanos, quienes la apoyan a seguir sus estudios y luchar. De          aquí a cierto tiempo se ve como una persona realizada.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de una computadora, ya que de esa forma podrá cumplir con los trabajos de su universidad, y realizarlos de una manera práctica, ya que será una buena herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Fatima is a third year student working towards her degree in agricultural engineering.  Each day she travels several kilometers to continue her studies. She has the help of her parents and siblings, who support her education and success. In time she hopes to become a successful person who achieves her goals.
 
Fatima is requesting this loan to buy a computer, so that she will be able to keep up with her university work, and complete her assignments in a practical way. It will be a good tool for her work.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
In the year 2010, Luz learned about Paglaum MPC and borrowed capital for her farming activities. Luz feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used to fund her business.

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase farm inputs, fertilizer, and a carabao (water buffalo) for her rice field for the next cropping season. Luz wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighbouring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, fertilizer, and a carabao for her rice field

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa owns a rice farm in Molave. Being a farmer, she strives hard to support her family. This is how she supported their daily needs and the education of her children. Paglaum MPC is her constant partner for her capital needs. She is able to roll her capitalization and has saved enough.

For this cropping season, Marcosa wishes to harvest more produce, so she applied for a loan to pay for labour costs and 5 sacks of fertilizers. Marcosa wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighbouring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs and 5 sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 44 years old with five children. Her husband is a fisherman and she personally sells his catch in the market.  Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 10,000 for the purpose of expanding her inventories to increase her income. The loan is intended to buy her more fish, and she also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Hean (pictured here) is a weaver and raises cows at home. Her husband is a garment factory worker and grows pumpkin and rice when farming season comes. They live on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has two sons who have attended school. 

Hean wants to apply for a loan to buy one more cow to raise. Currently she is raising four cows at home. When the cows give birth, she will be able to earn more income from selling the calves.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to raise.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, 62 years old, lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, with her husband and two children. Her husband is a farmer. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, Norma has found ways to attain income through snack & food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands & snacks to their neighbors. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she is applying for 30,000PHP to buy merchandise for her store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Luminada

texts.en:
Luminada is 58 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Luminada works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Luminada has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Luminada would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores, who is married, has operated a general store business in the Philippines for 10 years. She has requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. 

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, who is married, works hard to support her family. She has been selling generic medicines in the Philippines for two years now, and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional generic medicines to sell.

Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional generic medicines to sell

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 42 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, etc. She has been in this business for four years.

In the future Annie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 58 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Estrella has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft drinks, sardines and other groceries.

In the future Estrella would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cornila

texts.en:
Cornila is a 49-year-old married mother of eight children, one of whom is in school. She has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 10 years now,  and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Cornila has requested a new loan of PHP 13000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 62 years old and married with three children.

Fely works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Fely has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Fely aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 51 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia has been pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan is a 44-year-old married woman. She has four dependent children and one married child. She lives in a small village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer on a small rice field, which is located near her house. Her husband, Sopheap, is a teacher. This couple can make a daily income of around USD 8.00.  

Sophan wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan, granted through HKL, with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is managing her eatery business in Molave. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well in supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. 

Recently, she took out a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 32 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with two children. Catherine has focused her buy-and-sell business on buying the harvest of her neighbors and selling it at the market with the help of her husband.  She requested a loan to buy more rice ("palay") to sell. 

Catherine has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Catherine hopes to buy a hectare of rice field of their own.

loans.use: to buy rice ("palay")  for her buy-and-sell business

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is a hard-working entrepreneur from Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is 32 years old and has children who are currently in school. Cristopher, her husband, works as a driver. She oversees the operation of their Jeepney, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) Jeepney, from which she is paid a *boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,500 every day. Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippine. 

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the Jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay. 

Ma. Luisa is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan assistance to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her Jeepney. She will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, Ma. Luisa hopes that her business will continue to operate and help provide for their everyday needs. She dreams for her children to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von, who is a 56-year-old woman, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three unmarried children and two married children. 

To make a living and support her family, she has been involved in a rice farming business on a small piece of farmland since 1980. Besides the farming business, she has one more way to make additional income: it is harvesting palm juice to sell.

Now she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy palm juice harvesting materials such as ladders and bamboo containers. With the support from this loan, she hopes that it will help to increase her family income. 

She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to buy palm juice harvesting materials such as ladders and bamboo containers

loans.name: Teolita

texts.en:
Teolita is 51 years old, married, and has five children.  She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds. In the future, Teolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Chiessa

texts.en:
Chiessa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has three children who are in school. 
She has a buying and selling of fermented shrimps and fish business in the Philippines. Chiessa has been in this business for 12 years.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional shrimps and fish. In the future, Chiessa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional shrimp and fish.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Helen has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 48 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Catalina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

Catalina has been pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 47 years old and married.  She has three children, and one of them is in school. She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines.

She has been pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Amuria

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Amuria. She is fifty-five years old and the mother of eight children. Three of her children are in primary school while the rest have completed school. She is married and lives with her family.

Amuria raises maize and beans and she also rears goats. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in April 2013 so that she could benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. She would like to expand her enterprise by buying more goats for rearing and later sell them in the local slaughter houses. She believes this will boost her income level. This will go a long way in ensuring she maintains consistent food security in her household.

She is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Hannah, a member of Muungano Self-Help Group. She is fifty-seven years old and has nine children. Five of her children go to school, while the other four are living on their own. She is married and lives with her family. 

Hannah raises maize and beans, a business she has greatly improved due to the enterprise management training she has received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. She is borrowing money to further expand her supplies by purchasing beans for sale from other farmers. Her main goal in life is to establish herself as a leading supplier of beans. She is hopeful that this will increase her income level; hence, she will be in a position to cater for her children's education.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy beans for sale.

loans.name: Mecil

texts.en:
Mecil is 44 years old and married and she has three children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Mecil requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins.

Mecil has been raising pigs for 22 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mecil would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
This is Loise, a 22-year-old married mother of one child. In 2013 she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to benefit from training on saving mobilization, enterprise creation and financial management. 

Loise runs a small shop where she sells jikos (cook stoves), basins, clothes and other household items. She is borrowing money to expand her enterprise by adding more stock. She feels that the demand for the goods is high, so expansion will help to maintain a consistent supply. 

Loise is very thankful to Kiva and its lenders for the continued support, and promises to repay the loan promptly. She hopes that her profits will increase, enabling her to support her child’s education through the purchase of a uniform and reading materials.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks such as clothes, jikos and basins.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is 53 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children. Avelina has farmland that primarily supports her family. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for land cultivation and labor costs. 

Avelina has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Avelina hopes to access a plot of redeemed land for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: for land cultivation and labor costs

loans.name: Lodgem

texts.en:
Lodgem is 45 years old and has four children.  She is married and has two children who are in school.

Lodgem is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Lodgem has been raising livestock for 18 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lodgem would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is 36 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Adeline has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for three years.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell. In the future, Adeline would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines. Elvira has been in this business for five years now.

She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional used clothes items like shirts and pants to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional used clothes items like shirts and pants to sell

loans.name: Enrique Otoniel

texts.es:
Enrique de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta 1° grado en la escuela, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, de Enrique depende su esposa e hijo y nadie más vive con ellos. 

Él tiene 2 años de trabajar como motorista en un restaurante, el trabajo es por turno y el tiempo libre lo dedica a la agricultura, ya que siembra 1 hectárea de maíz y 1 de frijol, el lugar está a unos 20 minutos de su casa y se va en bicicleta.

Enrique necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, específicamente abono y veneno, para la maleza y para las plagas, con esto espera que el cultivo sea de provecho.  

Él sueña con tener buena cosecha para poder vender y tener excelentes ganancias y así poder seguir invirtiendo en las próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Enrique is 29 years old and has a first grade education. He is married and his wife takes care of the household duties. They have a two-year-old son. Enrique’s dependents are his wife and son, and no one else lives with them.

For the past two years, Enrique has worked as a motorcycle delivery person for a restaurant. He works in shifts, so his free time is devoted to agriculture. Enrique has planted one hectare of corn and one hectare of beans. His plots are located about 20 minutes from his house, so he travels on a bicycle.

Enrique needs a loan so that he can buy farming supplies, specifically compost and poison, so that he can combat weeds and pests. He expects to have a profitable crop.

Enrique dreams of having a good harvest that he can sell so that he can earn an excellent profit. This would allow him to continue investing in future crops.

loans.use: to buy compost and poisons.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elsa works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elsa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to  purchase flour, yeast, margarine, butter, sugar, etc. for her bakery business.

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, margarine, butter, sugar, etc

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Alma has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and for business expansion in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Elizabeth. She is a member of Shalom Self-Help Group. She is 49 years old, married and a mother of four. She lives with her husband. 

Elizabeth keeps goats as her economic activity. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to better manage her enterprise. She is now borrowing from Kiva in order to boost her business by purchasing goat feed and kids for rearing, which she will later sell as matured goats to butchers. She hopes her business will flourish and provide more income that will go a long way in ensuring full support of her children's education.

She is grateful for the Kiva loan, which will be of help to her family, and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase goats and goat feed.

loans.name: Kisa Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Repher, a member of Kisa Self Help Group. She is thirty-one years old and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in October 2013.

She earns her living by operating a small cafe. She is proud to have acquired skills from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on record-keeping, savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management. She is borrowing the loan to enable her to add more stock of flour, sugar, salt, and milk in her cafe in order to meet the rising demand. This will help her meet her family’s basic needs and pay school fees for her children with ease.

Repher is happy thanks to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy additional stock such as flour, sugar, salt  and milk.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 39 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Perlita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Perlita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Perlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
This is Teresia. She is fifty-two years old, married and blessed with five children. She does tailoring and clothes-selling as her business.

She borrowed her first loan of 10,000 Kenya Shillings which she repaid promptly and stocked her second-hand clothes (Mitumba) business.  She is borrowing the second loan to further expand her enterprise. She hopes that the loan will boost her business hence generate income which will help her provide for family needs like clothing and educating her children.

Teresia is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support and she promises to repay the loan well.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es:
Danilo sueña con poder convertirse en un buen medico veterinario, y es por ello que se esta esforzando y luchando, es un joven muy sacrificado, que quiere salir adelante. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide nuevamente de este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de su universidad, como fotocopias, libros, etc. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que reciben y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Danilo dreams of becoming a successful veterinarian. For this reason, he is striving and putting forth the effort. He is a self-sacrificing young man who wants to get ahead. Danilo says that his previous loan was used to cover the fees for his degree, which was a great help.

Today he is requesting a new loan so that he can cover his university expenses, such as photocopies, books, and other materials. He appreciates this new opportunity that he has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to pay his university expenses.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Henry works hard to support his family.

He has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Henry is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for his business.

Henry has been sustaining his business activities through his past 14 loans from NWTF. He hopes that his hard work will help him attain his dream to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Joyce. She is thirty years old, married, and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. 

Joyce runs a kiosk where she sells sugar, tea leaves, soap, and foodstuffs. She gained knowledge from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on Enterprise development. She is borrowing a loan to purchase more stock of tea leaves, sugar and other foodstuffs to expand her retail shop. This will improve her income hence she will be in a position to pay school fees to her children and continue supporting her family needs, thus improving their standard of living.
 
Joyce is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of tea leaves, sugar and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 49 years old and married with eight children. Three of her children are in school; she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marivic has a business making and selling hollow blocks in the Philippines. Marivic requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her hollow blocks making business.

Marivic has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her hollow blocks business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old and married with five children.

Virginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

Virginia has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for nine years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Virginia aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and married with five children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is 48 years old and single.

Noeme runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Noeme has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Noeme would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn works hard to support her family. Rosalyn is married and has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Rosalyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business.

Rosalyn has been in this business for three years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rosalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 62 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, snack foods, diapers, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kwt Sawe Permata Indah Group

texts.en: The members of the KWT Sawe Permata Indah group run diverse types of businesses, including farms, small stores, door-to-door sales and food selling. Agung Ayu heads the group and earns a living by selling crops and breeding pigs. She successfully manages both of her businesses and earns good profits. Two members of this group recently left because they now have sufficient capital, but the fourteen remaining members are requesting a loan for 20,000,000 IDR to improve their business. Agung Ayu will use her portion of loan to buy piglets and sell more crops. With the full support of her husband, she will buy cacaos, bananas, coconuts and other crops from farmers and sell them in a local market. She plans to save her profits to meet her family's future needs.

loans.use: to buy piglets and sell more crops.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma finds ways to sufficiently support her family. She tills her farm area in Mabini, Baliangao, and plants a variety of commodities. She has gained more income from her banana plantation. She has seeked Paglaum for her capital needs. She availed another loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer in her banana plantation. She loaned an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Norma perseveres and always believes she can reach her goals to save enough for their house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a businesswoman from Molave. She is 43 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari (convenience) store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Marlyn is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items. 

Marlyn continues to look for better business opportinuites, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 39 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is happily married with her children. She has ventured in the siopao business. She has had this business for 12 years. 

She requested a loan to buy additional ingredients on her business. Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her siopao business

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 38 years old and married with three children who are all attending school.

Roselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Roselyn has borrowed and repaid twenty loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Roselyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: María Orfilia

texts.es:
María de 33 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada y su pareja es albañil, tiene 3 hijos que viven en casa de los cuales 2 trabajan en la agricultura y el menor estudia 5° grado.

María se dedica al destazo de cerdos desde hace 10 años, además se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, por lo general ella siembra 1 hectárea y media de maíz, el destazo lo realiza en su casa desde muy temprano y su pareja se involucra.  

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar 4 cerdos para el destazo, para comprar  150 aves para criarlas y venderlas, además construirá una galera.
 
Ella espera obtener ganancias de su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old and did not have the opportunity to study. She is in a relationship and her partner is a bricklayer. They have three children who live at home. Two of them work in agriculture and the youngest one is in the fifth grade.

María has been butchering pigs for the past 10 years. In addition, she is devoted to her farm work. She has planted 1.5 hectares of corn. The butchering is performed at her house, which she does from the early morning hours. Her partner is also involved.

María needs a loan so that she can buy four pigs for butchering, 150 birds that she will raise and sell, and materials for building a shed. She hopes to generate income from her business so that her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy four pigs for butchering, 150 birds that she will raise and sell, and materials for building a shed.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 45 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Vilma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Vilma has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from farming.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 44 years old and married.

Rosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rosa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Rosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sarys

texts.es:
La Sra Sarys tiene 34 años, es  madre  soltera tiene 2 hijos una nena y un varon en edad escolar , ella se dedica en la venta de ropas y a productos avon en la zona de Luque trabaja en este rubro desde el año 2009 esta manera genera un ingreso  para el sustento de la casa y para el gasto de la escuela de sus hijos.
 Pide este prestamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas varias para poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Sarys is 34 years old and a single mother with two children, a daughter and a son who are of school age. She sells clothes and Avon products in the District of Luque. Sarys has been in this line of work since 2009. She is able to generate an income for maintaining her household and covering her children’s school expenses.

Sarys is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of various types of clothes, which will allow her to keep working.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo muy luchador, y además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para ellas la clave del éxito es poder trabajar unidas y luchar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Raquel, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe trabajar un poco más para que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de productos de limpieza que hace,  vaya mejorando sus condiciones de vida. Se define a si misma como una persona trabajadora y por sobre todo luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos de limpiezas varios para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
This is a very hard-working group, and they are also participating in a study to eliminate poverty.  For them the key to success is being able to work together and struggle as a team.

One of the group members is Raquel, who in the study demonstrated a "level one" state of poverty, which means that she needs to work a bit harder in order to improve her life condition through effort and continual labor through the selling of cleaning products.  

She defines herself as a hard working person and above all a fighter.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase cleaning products of various types in order to continue with her sales.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning products for resale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is driven by her passion, which is sales. She is 59 years old, married, lives with her husband in Molave, Zamboanga del Norte, and earns a living by running a fruit stand in order to help support her family. She enjoys her line of work, and is a full-fledged member of PMPC. She has taken out several prior loans, and repaid her obligations religiously with no record of default. Now, she is requesting a new loan to buy additional fruit to sell. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store so that she can continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit to sell.

loans.name: Norissa

texts.en: Norissa signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Norissa is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.  In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Leona

texts.en:
Leona lives in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental with her husband and two grandchildren. 

Her husband has no permanent work. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through a sari-sari store business. It began with selling a small inventory of salt, sugar, oil, noodles, and canned goods to their neighbors. 

She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in February of 2008. She became a MIGS (Member in Good Standing), which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 20,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. 

She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store (small grocery)

loans.name: Narfe

texts.en:
Narfe is 26 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Narfe works very hard to provide for them.

Narfe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of items like cereals, cooking oil, vinegar, canned goods, candies, soft-drinks, shampoo, body soap, etc. to sell.

Narfe has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as cereals, cooking oil, vinegar, canned goods, candies, soft-drinks, shampoo, body soap, etc. 

In the future, Narfe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock like cereals, cooking oil, vinegar, canned goods, candies, soft-drinks, shampoo, body soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: As the married parent of three children, Erlinda works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. She is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to  buy vegetable seeds and other supplies for her farm. She has successfully repaid 21 previous loans and will use this one to further build up her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en: Sergia is 60 years old, married and the mother of five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by selling used clothing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 50,000 loan from NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell. Sergia has been in her current line of work for thirty years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is twenty-nine years old and is married.  He has one child and lives in Kasese -Uganda. Moses is in livestock production and also does motorcycle transport to get aside income. Moses has been in that business for ten years and has managed to look after his family and earn a living.  Bad weather and limited capital are his challenges. Moses has a dream of constructing a residential house. Moses wants money to buy goats for selling.

loans.use: to buy goats for selling.

loans.name: Jorge Leonardo

texts.es: Jorge de 24 años de edad, habita con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad en el municipio de Soledad. Allí desde los 16 años se dedica a la peluquería, atendiendo  su aptitud de comerciante que lo ha acompañado desde muy niño. Primero tuvo una tienda y posteriormente la vendió, pues sus ventas se disminuyeron y no lo vio como un negocio que le generara mucha rentabilidad, por eso con la preocupación de perder todo su capital, dio el dinero a su esposa para que vendiera artículos de belleza e iniciara una peluquería, aprovechando que  ella tenia experiencia trabajando en salas de belleza. y llegaba muy tarde a su casa. Hoy trabaja todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 dela noche vendiendo a crédito y de contado y comprando los insumos en almacenes especializados de belleza, donde los consigue mas económicos. Su meta mas adelante es tener 3 sucursales y lograr obtener su propia vivienda, para  generar  mayor bienestar a su cónyuge y a su hijo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará 5 sillas de peluquería, un lavacabezas, un aire acondicionado, productos de belleza, con los cuales mejorará las condiciones de su negocio en su imagen y productividad.
texts.en: Jorge is 24 years old. He lives with his spouse and his small child who is a year old in the town of Soledad. There he has been in hairdressing since he was 16 years old, responding to his aptitude for business that he has had since he was very young. First he had a store and later he sold it, as his sales had diminished and he didn't see it as a business that would generate much profit. Worried about losing capital, he gave the money to his wife to sell beauty products and start a beauty parlor, taking advantage of her experience working in beauty salons. Today he works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 10:00 P.M. selling specialized wholesale beauty supplies, which is most economical, on credit and cash. His goal to move forward in life is to have 3 branches and to be able to achieve having his own housing to generate greater prosperity for his spouse and his son. Today he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing he has done with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy 5 hairdressing chairs, a shampoo chair, an air conditioner and beauty products. With these, he will improve the conditions of his business in their image and productivity.

loans.use: to buy 5 hairdressing chairs, a shampoo chair, an air conditioner and beauty products.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo san Cayetano está en su ciclo 8, se unieron con el objetivo de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio del trabajo en conjunto poder ayudarse y mejorar sus vidas.
Tomasa es vendedora, comenta que hoy día es muy difícil la vida, pero que ella se sacrifica mucho para poder ayudar a su familia con su esfuerzo diario. Ella vende prendas variadas y ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le pide prendas de calidad, es por eso que le va muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con su lucha diaria para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group Cayetano is in its 8th cycle, meeting with the objective of being able to help themselves and others by means of work in conjunction with being able to help themselves and improve their lives.

Tomasa is a merchant. She says that today it is a very difficult life, but she sacrifices a lot to be able to help her family with the daily struggle. She sells various articles of clothing and already has a good customer base that always asks her for quality clothing items, which is why it is going well.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy various articles of clothing and in this way be able to continue her daily struggle to help her family.

loans.use: to buy various articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru:
Сабохат образованная женщина из района Хуросон. Ей 43 года. Она является преподавателем и работает в общеобразовательном учреждении в течение 10 лет. Ее муж работает директором в физкультурной школе. 
У Сабохат четверо детей. Один ее сын по имени Хасан является студентом. Он учится в Государственном Университете города Кургантюбе в факультете "Иностранных языков". Хасан учится по контракту в дневном отделении и по окончании ВУЗа получит квалификацию специалиста английского языка. Он любит изучать английский язык и поэтому хорошо учится. 
Целью данного кредита является оплата годового контракта Хасана. Сабохат и ее муж нуждаются в этом кредите, так как сейчас не имеют финансовой возможности. Они надеются, что им помогут и их сын продолжит учебу в ВУЗе.
texts.en:
Sabohat is an educated woman from the Khuroson region. She is 43 years old. She is a teacher and has been working in an educational institution over the course of ten years. Her husband works as the director of a athletics school.

Sabohat has four children. One of her sons whose name is Khasan is a student. He is studying at the State University in the town of Kurgantiube in the department of Foreign Languages. Khasan is studying under a full-time contract and at the end of college will receive an English language qualification. He loves learning English language and therefore studies well.

The goal of the current loan is to pay Khasan's tuition. Sabohat and her husband needs this loan, since currently they do not have financial opportunities. They hope for help and for their son to continue his studies at the university.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Rosa Mistica está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una y con ello poder mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Baudelia, ella es repostera, hace todo tipo de cosas dulces, es muy buena en lo que hace, y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien, todo lo que hace es para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar harina, huevos, manteca, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su producción.
texts.en:
This group is called Rosa Mistica. They participate in a survey on the elimination of poverty. On order to do this, the situation of each one of them is assessed individually so that they can improve their lives.

One of the members of this group is Mrs. Baudelia. She is a baker and she makes all kinds of sweets. She is good at what she does and this is why things are going well for her. All that she does is to benefit her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase flour, eggs, lard and other ingredients so she can continue baking.

loans.use: purchase flour, eggs, lard and more.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en: Cerila busies herself with her rice farm in Molave. She is a hardworking mother and looks after the needs of her children. For this cropping season, she hopes to increase her produce by adding more fertilizers and seedlings. She applied for a loan  to buy fertilizers and seedlings. Cerila looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings for next cropping

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 62 years old and married.  She has three children.  Soledad works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Soledad has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.  Soledad aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  Lilia has been in this business for seven years. Lilia earns additional income from weaving native products.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en: As the married parent of four children, Shirly works hard to support her family. She makes a living by growing rice in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending. Shirly is requesting a loan for PHP 16,000 from NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilizer to use on her farm. She has successfully repaid 12 prior loans, and plans to use this one to further build her business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of securing the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to sell.

loans.name: Yeremiah

texts.en: Yeremiah is  married and lives in Kasese, Uganda.  He has five children, four of whom attend school. He operates a retail shop of general merchandise since 2010.  He is also a teacher by profession.  He began the business to have day to day source of income.  He is a hard-working man faced with a challenge of debtors  and price fluctuation. Yeremiah has a dream of completing his house. He wants money to buy cement and bricks to achieve his dream.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to complete his house

loans.name: Pyotr

texts.ru:
Петр — сельскохозяйственник из Малой Кардашинки. Он 30 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством. На 45 сотках выращивает ранние и поздние овощи — помидоры, огурцы, пекинскую капусту, редис. Семья помогает Петру вести бизнес.
Петр планирует вложить сумму в 30 000 гривен в нужды тепличного хозяйства, а именно купить удобрений, семян, дрова, а также пленку, трубы и шланги для капельного орошения, а также сделать частичный ремонт теплиц.
texts.en:
Pyotr is an agriculturalist from Malaya Kardashinka. He has 30 years of experience working with greenhouse farming. On 45 acres, he grows early and late vegetables — tomatoes, cucumbers, Chinese cabbages, and radishes. The family helps Pyotr to run the business.

Pyotr plans to invest a sum of 30,000 hryvnia in the needs of greenhouse agriculture, namely to purchase fertilizers, seeds, wood, as well as film, tubing and hoses for drip irrigation; and also to make partial repairs on greenhouses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, firewood, plastic covering, pipes and hoses for an irrigation system and to fix what needs to be fixed in the greenhouses.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is a married woman with ten children. She is 55 years old and has four children who are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Venancia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Venancia requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Venancia has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Venancia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming rice business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase rise seeds and other farm supplies for her farming rice business.  Noralyn has been in this business for 10 years. Noralyn earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Noralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Arsenia has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Florida works hard to support her family.  She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an auto repair shop.  Florida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Florida has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en: Wilfred is married with four children aged 33 years living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop of general merchandise. He has been in that business since 2010, that's where he gets income to look after his family. He also does farming alongside his business to get additional income. Wilfred is faced with a challenge of limited capital and rental bills. Wilfred is a hard-working man and has made a strategy of completing his residential house to avoid rent. Wilfred is requesting a loan to buy iron sheets to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to complete his house.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 53 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Wilma has a fishing business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new engine for her fishing boat.

Wilma has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Mykailo

texts.ru:
Михаил занимается продажей стройматериалов. В этом бизнесе работает уже примерно 9 лет. Место для магазина в своем поселке арендует. Для работы у Михаила имеется собственный транспорт. 
Михаил планирует закупить дополнительную партию стройматериалов под реализацию. За счет реализованного товара хотел был развивать торговлю, укрепляя позиции бизнеса и помогая трем своим детям стать на ноги в будущем. Михаил — трудолюбивый, ответственный. Он всегда старательно считает расходы и доходы, экономит на мелочах, при этом при покупке крупных, ценных вещей всегда отдает преимущество качеству.
texts.en:
Mykailo sells construction materials. This business has been operating for about nine years. He leases a place for his store in his village. For his work, Mykailo has his own transportation.

Mykailo plans to buy an additional parcel of construction materials for resale. From the benefit of the sold goods, he would like to develop trade, strengthening the position of the business and helping his three children to get on their feet in the future. Mykailo is hardworking and responsible. He always carefully considers the expenses and income, saves on the little things, and at the same time in purchasing large, valuable items always gives priority to quality.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction supplies for sale in his retail store.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 34 years old and married, and she has two children, both of whom are in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Wilma has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 6 years. Rebecca earns additional income from fishing.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is forty one years of age and married with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Constance is a teacher by profession and has been in that profession for seventeen years. She also practices farming as additional income. 

Constance has been renting for all that time with a dream of buying land, but due to low pay which does not cover all her family needs, Constance has decided to request a loan to buy land to achieve her longtime dream.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Florence works hard to support her family.  She has a vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. Florence is borrowing PHP 1,7000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell for her vegetables business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.  Florence has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sipora

texts.en:
