Sipora is twenty-nine years old and married.  She has three children.  Sipora is a teacher by profession and has been in that service for four years.  She joined the profession because the parents had no money to pay for expensive courses.  Sipora also owns a retail shop to supplement her small salary.  

She is a hard working woman with a dream of educating her children.  Sipora wants money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for children.

loans.name: Idreda

texts.en: Idreda is thirty-nine years old, married, with six children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. Idreda sells produce that is dry maize, beans, and rice along-side her teaching profession. For fifteen years she has been in teaching and she likes the profession. Idreda is working hard to see her children go to school. Idreda has a dream of having improved standards of living however is faced with a challenge of low payments. Idreda wants money to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Omar Otoniel

texts.es:
Las ganas de progresar son las que a diario hacen que Omar se levante con mucho ánimo y entusiasmo, es un joven de 22 años, casado y sin hijos. Su interés por el cuidado de la tierra y las siembras lo llevo a estudiar Ingeniería Agropecuaria y por problemas financieros sólo logró completar segundo año de la carrera. Sin embargo, nunca ha dejado de aprender sobre el cultivo, puesto que desde pequeño su padre le ha enseñado a sobre agricultura. Hace cinco años su padre le heredo media manzana de tierra y desde entonces se dedica a la siembra de tomate, chiltoma, maiz y frijol.  
Omar desea una siembra de tomate exitosa, razón principal por la que solicita el préstamo puesto que requiere comprar insecticidas, fungicidas, abono foliares y solubles; asimismo para el pago de la mano de obra. Estima que el financiamiento será de mucha ayuda ya que si la cosecha es excelente, obtendrá buenas ganancias lo que será de mucha ayuda en la economía familiar. Tiene muchas metas y sueños, entre ellos culminar su carrera universitaria, mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda y ampliar el área de siembra. Su familia le apoya para que haga sus sueños realidad.
texts.en:
The desire to progress is what drives Omar daily to wake up with a lot of spirit and enthusiasm. He is a young man who is 22 years old, is married, and doesn’t have children. His interest in caring for the land and harvests led him to study agricultural engineering, but because of financial problems, he only succeeded in completing the second year of the degree. Despite that, he has never stopped learning about agriculture. It has been five years since he inherited a half block of land from his father, and since then, he has been dedicated to growing tomatoes, sweet peppers, corn, and beans.

Omar wants a successful tomato harvest. His main reason for requesting the loan is that he needs to buy insecticides, fungicides, fertilizers, and solubles and to pay for workhands. He thinks that the loan will be a big help since if the harvest is excellent, he will be obtain good earnings, which will be very helpful for his family’s finances. 

He has many goals and dreams. Among them are to finish his university degree, to improve the infrastructure of his home, and to grow the area he farms. His family supports him so that his dreams can become reality.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fungicides, fertilizers, and solubles.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Doing your taxes is no walk in the park, but Cesar and his wife Gloria are doing their part to help. Together, they run ATE Accounting (http://www.ateaccounting.com) in Doral, Florida. Cesar received his accounting degree in Columbia and had been volunteering with the IRS’ Volunteer Income Tax Assistance program before starting ATE Accounting in 2007. Because Cesar enjoys teaching accounting and taxes, educational seminars are a key component of his services. “During tax season in 2013, I trained over 80 students to set up their own tax office and they assisted over 150 students using Quickbooks,” he says. Cesar runs his classes in Spanish, helping to serve a population that traditional tax advisers may have trouble reaching. During tax season, Cesar and Gloria hire two part-time employees.

With this loan, Cesar will buy the most up-to-date tax software and 15 computers to provide training. Cesar’s long term vision is to “open an academy where I may teach classes on taxes, accrediting people for the IRS.”

loans.use: to pay for computers and software

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy medicines (serumes, vitamins, antibiotics, supplements) and recovery materials.

loans.name: Boanelger

texts.en:
Boanelger is originally from Puerto Rico and now lives and works in Orlando. Looking for ways to better support his family, he realized he had a good network of friends who owned small shops in the area, geared towards the Hispanic market. He knew the types of toys and games that would appeal to these buyers, having a daughter himself and understanding the culture. Having studied marketing and wanting to own his own business, Boanelger decided to start a business to design store racks and displays for toys and games that he sold. This business supports his wife and daughter.

Boanelger needs a loan to buy inventory and racks for the toys. He hopes to expand the business and work with the large supermarket chains in the area.

loans.use: to pay for inventory

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like net, gasoline, etc., for her fishing business.

Elvira has been in this business for four years. Elvira earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like nets, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Analin

texts.en:
Analin is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analin is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Analin has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Analin requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Analin has been in this business for six years. In the future, Analin would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel, originally from Syria and living now in Toledo, OH, started the Chicken Shack in last 2013. He runs a delivery and take-out restaurant, cooking a combination of Mediterranean and American food (think hush puppies sharing menu space with grape leaves). Basel’s wife and children depend on this income to support the family and they are currently living with relatives.

Basel needs a loan to purchase equipment and develop a sales and marketing plan.  This loan helps Basel take the first steps towards his vision for the business. He says he wants to own his own home, make a better life for his children, and provide the best service he can to his customers.

loans.use: to pay for equipment and develop a marketing plan

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru:
Марина занимается выращиванием цветов, дома есть одна теплица. В бизнесе задействована вся семья Марины — и супруг, и двое дочерей. В начале Марине трудно было начинать заниматься цветами, но постепенно бизнес пошел. 
Финансовую помощь в размере 15 000 гривен Марина планирует вложить в приобретение горшков для теплицы, а также дров для поддержания максимально нужной температуры  для цветов. Заниматься работой на земле Марине очень нравится. Она планирует в следующем году засадить гектар земли ягодами.
texts.en: Marina is involved in growing flowers and has one greenhouse. Her whole family - husband and two daughters - participates in this business. At the beginning, it was difficult for Marina to be involved in growing flowers, but the business gradually got off the ground. Marina is planning to invest the financial assistance in the amount of 15 000 hryvnia into buying flower pots for the greenhouse and also wood for maintaining the necessary temperature for the flowers. Marina really likes working on the land. She plans to plant berries on one hectare of land next year.

loans.use: to purchase flower pots and firewood

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: For four years Moses has been selling coffee and earning a salary alongside farming in order to earn a living. Moses is 30 years of age and married with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Moses has a dream of educating his children and being rich. Moses is a hardworking man faced with a challenge of limited capital. Moses wants money to buy cement to construct his family house.

loans.use: to buy cement to construct his family house.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.es:
The person appearing in the photo is Agnes. She is forty nine years old,  married and has eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.
Her economic activity is maize farming. She is borrowing a loan to start a poultry farming enterprise . She hopes by starting this new enterprise her level of income will increase and be in a position to continue supporting her family.
Agnes is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.
texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Agnes. She is 49 years old, married, and has eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

Her economic activity is maize farming. She is borrowing a loan to start a poultry farming enterprise. She hopes by starting this new enterprise her level of income will increase and she will be in a position to continue supporting her family.

Agnes is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis Enrique, tiene la edad  de 49 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  de fertilizantes adecuados para el estado de cosecha en que se encuentra el cultivo de café, además realizar algunos trabajos de mejoramiento del suelo por medio de labores culturales como lo es evitar la erosión del suelo por medio del agua de lluvia, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para realizar resiembra y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área y de esta manera mejorar la producción, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación, de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo de café, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de este cultivo. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en el cultivo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Enriqueis 49 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and children, who are his biggest priority. With his loan, he plans to buy sufficient fertilizers for his harvest, which includes coffee. He also does some work to improve the land through work that aims to avoid erosion of the land from rainwater. He will also buy some copperwood plants to replant them to increase the density of plants in the area, and, in this way, he will improve his production. He will also pay workhands to apply the products and to help around the farm; this will ensure that he gets good work. 

What he plans is to take advantage of the good climate and soil that he has in the area for growing coffee. He has many years of experience managing this crop. He will be able to buy better products of better quality so that his farm has a good crop and health, in addition to a sufficient harvest, and to have good production in a short time. 

He will use the income from the harvest he hopes to obtain for the wellbeing and education of his family. He also wants to achieve some family goals and to continue investing more in his crop. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn’t had any previous loan from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with a lot of ease and with low interest rates.

loans.use: to get assistance for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.es: Melvin, tiene la edad  de 49 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa, la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de alimento para el desarrollo y engorde de cerdos, además de la compra de algunos medicamentos adecuados para el buen desarrollo de los lechones, además hacer algunas mejoras en las instalaciones donde realiza el desarrollo de los animales. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de ubicación que cuenta la propiedad para el desarrollo de la actividad y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de estos animales. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que los cerdos tengan un buen desarrollo y saludables al igual que un engorde adecuada, y tener a corto plazo unos cerdos con un peso adecuado. Con el ingreso de la venta que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar  de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en la actividad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Melvin, age 49, is married.  He lives with his wife, and she is his greatest priority.  He plans to use the loan to buy feed for the growth and fattening of his pigs.  He will also buy some of the appropriate medications for the good development of the piglets.  Additionally, he will make some improvements to the place where he raises the animals.

What he plans is to take advantage of the good location of his property in order to develop his business activity.  He will also put into practice the several years of experience that he has in managing these animals.  He will also be able to buy the best products and the best quality so that the pigs develop well and healthfully and that they fatten sufficiently.  He will do this so that, in the short term, he will have pigs that weigh enough.

He wants to use the income that he hopes to get from the sale for his family’s well-being, to fulfill some family goals, and to continue investing more in the business activity.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had other loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided him with the loan with the easiest terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to fatten pigs.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Atención de calidad y productos en excelentes condiciones es lo que recibes al entrar a la pequeña tienda de ropa de Francisco, un hombre amable y trabajador que día a día lucha por brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Está muy agradecido  por el avance que ha tenido en su negocio gracias al financiamiento de Kiva a través de MiCrédito, puesto que logró comprar zapatillas de cuero y botas de hule industrial y de esta manera pudo cumplir la demanda de sus clientes. 
Con ánimos de seguir prosperando, Francisco solicita un segundo crédito para invertirlo en vestimenta, requiere comprar pantalones finos para hombres, también camisas de estilo vaquero, botas de cuero, zapatillas y camisetas. Deposita su confianza en el préstamo puesto que desea aumentar el número de clientela de manera que pueda generar mejores ingresos. Entres sus planes futuros esta mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, al mismo tiempo ampliarlo y seguir trabajando con mucho esmero y dedicación.
texts.en:
When people go into Francisco's small clothes shop they are met with attention to quality and products in excellent condition. He is a friendly, hard-working man who struggles daily to provide his family with better living conditions. He is really grateful for the previous business loan, which was financed trough Kiva in partnership with MiCrédito, as he managed to meet customer demand by purchasing leather shoes and industrial rubber boots.

Francisco is asking for a second loan to invest in clothing as he wants to carry on prospering his business. He needs to buy men's trousers as well as denim shirts, leather boots, shoes and shirts. He places his confidence in the loan as he wants to increase his customer base and be able to earn a better income.

His plans for the future include improving and extending his business and and continuing his work with a great deal of effort and dedication.

loans.use: to buy men's trousers as well as denim shirts, leather boots, shoes and T-shirts.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon, who is 24 years old, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. He is a single man. Currently, he is a security guard for one private company. So far, he has been in this career for four years, with an income of USD 8.00 per day, on average.

Mon wants to pursue his bachelor degree, but he can’t afford the school fees. Therefore, he is applying for a loan from Kiva, which he will use to pay his university fees. With the support from this loan, he hopes that he can get higher education. An education would allow him to seek for a better career, in the future. He is thankful for the loan, which HKL has granted with a much lower interest rate than other, general loan products.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and pig fattening. Luzminda is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es:
Marta de 58 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de  estudiar porque sus padres le decían que lo único que le iba a servir era aprender a trabajar, está soltera y tiene 6 hijos pero solo 3 viven con ella.

Marta se dedica a ayudar a sus hijos en las ventas de tortillas, es ella quien las reparte, para lo cual camina medio km y lo hace desde las 7:00 AM hasta las 6:00 PM. Anteriormente tenía un puesto donde vendía todo tipo de bebidas pero no le dejaba grandes ganancias.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar productos de primera necesidad y poner una tienda porque ya se siente cansada de caminar cuando va a repartir las tortillas. 

Sus sueños son tener una mejor vivienda y poder darles estudios a sus hijos para que tengan una mejor oportunidad.
texts.en:
Marta, age 58, did not have the chance to go to school because her parents said that the only thing that would do her any good was learning to work.  She is single, and she has six children.  Only three of them live with her.

Marta helps her children sell tortillas.  She is the one who distributes them.  In order to do so she walks half of a kilometer, and she does this from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She previously had a stand where she sold all types of drinks.  However, this did not leave her with good earnings.

She needs the loan to buy basic needs products and to set up a store.  This is because she is tired from walking when she goes to deliver the tortillas.

Her dreams are to have a better house and to be able to give her children an education so that they have a better opportunity.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products and to set up a store.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is thirty-five years old and married. He has two children, and he lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop, selling general merchandise. The income from this business helps him to run his daily activities and look after his family. Joseph also has a salt pan, from which he gets crude salt to sell, as an additional source of income.

Joseph has a dream of expanding his business. That's why he is asking for a loan, which he will use to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour, and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell at his store, including sugar, salt, and cassava flour

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 44 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with four children. He has a retail shop, and he is also a farmer. He grows maize, beans, and vegetables to sell. Right now, his monthly income is KES 13,000.

He will be using this loan to buy more retail goods to sell, such as rice, sugar, flour, and cooking oil. He will also buy fertilizer and seeds, for planting in his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

His future hopes and dreams are to grow his businesses, to earn more income, and to be able to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy more retail goods to sell, such as rice, sugar, and flour, as well as seeds and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business farming rice.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 11 years. Flordeliza earns more income from buying and selling rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Flordeliza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a married man with four children living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. 

He deals in cocoa buying and selling and has cocoa gardens which help him to supplement the cocoa he buys. He is very hard working and he used the previous loan to pay for labour. This helped him increase sales. 

He wants a loan to buy more cocoa to increase his stock.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to increase his stock.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 36 years old and married, and he lives in Divisoria, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He learned about PMPC and the financial assistance it offers to start-ups. Richard became a full-fledged member of the Co-op and took several loans already. All of them were repaid in a timely manner.

In need of working capital, he requested a loan to buy farm fertilizer and compost. This will help give his farming income a big boost. Richard always looks for better business opportunities and hopes to provide good living conditions for his family, especially including education for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and compost

loans.name: John

texts.en: John operates a bar, mainly selling beers and sodas, in Hoima, Uganda. He is a hardworking, married man, aged fifty-two. He has four children, only one of them attending school. He hopes to develop and expand his business. However, his problem is inadequate capital. He will use the loan facility to buy more beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beers to sell

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is a snack vendor in Danao, Plaridel. She has been in the business since she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts orders for any occasion for added income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth manages her eatery business in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and also accepts catering requests for added income. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be very happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business.

loans.name: Jun

texts.en:
This is Jun, 40, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. He is married to Juanita, who manages their household and and has two children. He and his wife work together to continually provide income to meet their family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Jun operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by buying  supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. Jun has a charming personality so people prefer to buy at his store. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business he is requesting a PHP 25,000, loan which he will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, corn rice, charcoal, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages. He also retails prepaid loads of mobile phones. He is positive this will boost his income as he expands his business. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.

Jun aims to grow his business to give his family a better life. He wants to give his children the best education possible. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Gloria is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of clothes to offer for sale in her clothing sales business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes to offer for sale.

loans.name: Jovime

texts.en:
Jovime is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her fishing business.

Jovime has been in this business for three years and earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleada de una tortillería.  Era lo que ella esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que ella quería ser. Marta tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos,  dos de ellos ya tienen familias diferentes, el tercero vive con ella e estudia primero básico en un colegio de su comunidad y todos ellos viven en Suchitepéquez.

La actividad principal que ella realiza es la venta de tortillas, ella lleva realizando actividad durante tres años y para ella es una buena actividad para tener un ingreso económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, la segunda actividad que realiza Marta es la venta de enchiladas en su comunidad para satisfacer las necesidades de las personas  que habitan por el lugar.

Los fines con que ella desea realizar un préstamo, es para  la ampliación de la venta de tortillas que ella tiene para así poder tener mejores ingresos económico para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su familia. 

Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de ella es ver que su hijo se convierta en un profesional en su comunidad y que tenga una vida mejor y un futuro de éxito.
texts.en:
Life gave her an opportunity to work as an employee in a tortilla store. It was what he had hoped—not only an open door, but also what was behind this door. What she found was something that defined who she wanted to be. Marta is 36 years old, is married, and has three children. Two of her children already have their own families, and the third lives with her and studies in the high school in the community. All of them live in Suchitepéquez.

Her main activity is selling tortillas. She has been doing this work for three years, and for her, it is a good way to have an income to be able to satisfy the needs of her family. The second activity that Marta does is to sell enchiladas in her community to satisfy the needs of the people that live in that area.

The purpose of the loan is to increase her sales of tortillas, so that she can have a better income to satisfy the needs of her family.

One of her biggest goals is to see her son become a professional in the community and for him to have a better life and a successful future.

loans.use: to increase her sales of tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction material for the floor of her house.

loans.name: Asasio

texts.en: Asasio is married with nine children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a bar and has been in that business for three years. He also practices farming to get additional income. Asasio has a dream of educating his children. He has a challenge of competition and bad weather mostly when it rains. Asasio wants money to buy sodas, beers, spirits and water to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beers, spirits and water to sell

loans.name: Lacin

texts.en:
Lacin is 41 year old, married and she has four children. She is a member of a group farm and has been working there for six years. By profession, she is a schoolteacher. In the morning, she works on her plot of land and after lunch she goes to school to teach primary grades. Lacin loves both of these activities. 

Now she is preparing for the next planting. With the loan amount, she wants to acquire quality vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel. She needs support, without which she cannot continue her agriculture activity. Please support Lacin.

loans.use: to acquire quality vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel.

loans.name: Isabel Karina

texts.es: Isabel de 44 años de edad vive con su esposo, ella posee una tienda y además de eso es costurera, ella tiene ocho años de tener la tienda, vende todos los días a vecinos del lugar, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Isabel solicita un crédito para comprar más productos (arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosa, frijol, etc.) ella espera tener mayores ventas y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Isabel, 44 years old, lives with her husband. She has a store and in addition she is also a seamstress. She has had her store for eight years and sells every day to her neighbors. With earnings from her sales she is able to pay for household necessities.

Isabel is requesting a loan to purchase more products (rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks, beans, etc.).  She expects to increase her sales and thus to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more products (rice, sugar, oil, soft drinks, beans, etc.).

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 54 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from personal products.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en: Jesselyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Jesselyn has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft drinks, rice and other groceries. She has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jesselyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like soft drinks, rice and other groceries.

loans.name: Levis Alexi

texts.es:
Levis tiene 29 años de edad, estudió hasta 3° año de bachillerato, ahora está acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica alas labores  del hogar, aún no tienen hijos ya que hace poco han unido su vida como pareja.

Actualmente, Levis se dedica a la agricultura y lo ha hecho desde que era niño, lo aprendió de sus padres pues también eran agricultores, él se levanta muy temprano para ir a trabajar, no tiene que caminar mucho pues el terreno le queda cerca de su casa y termina de trabajar aproximadamente a las 3:00 de la tarde. 

El crédito lo necesita, una parte para la agricultura y la otra parte para comprar ganado de pasto. 

Los sueños de Levis son tener hijos junto a sus pareja, verlos crecer y jugar con ellos, además tener variedad de ganado ya que cuenta con los terrenos suficientes donde tenelos.
texts.en:
Levis is 29 years old and studied until the third year of his degree. Now, he is married, and his partner is dedicated to household work. They still don’t have children, since it has only been a little time since they have married.

At present, Levis works in agriculture, and he has done this since he was a child. He learned it from his parents, since they were also agricultural workers. He wakes up very early to go work. He doesn’t have to walk much, since the land is located near his house. He finishes working around 3 in the afternoon.

Part of the loan he needs will go to agriculture, and the other part is to buy grazing cattle. 

Levis’ dreams are to have children with his wife, to see them grow up, and to play with them. He also wants to have a variety of cattle, since he has enough land to have them.

loans.use: to invest in agriculture and to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: It

texts.en:
It, 36 years old, is a married woman who lives in Pursat Province of Cambodia. She has three dependent children who are currently in school. To earn a living, she prepares some Khmer food and dessert to sell in front of the school and in the center of her community. So far, she has been in this business for five years with the average income is USD 2.00 a day. 

It wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine to access sanitation.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de 59 años de edad vive con sus dos nietas, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos y tiene más de 20 años de experiencia  en la comercialización de este producto, es asi como saco adelante a sus hijos, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Virginia solicita un crédito para invertir en el negocio y comprar pescado por mayor,  y asi tener mejores precios y ventas, y  poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Virginia, 59 years old, lives with her two granddaughters. She makes a living selling sea food and has more than 20 years of experience in the sale of this product. That was how she helped her children get ahead. With earnings from her sales she was able to pay for household necessities.

Virginia is requesting a loan to invest in her business and purchase seafood wholesale. Thus she will have better prices and sales and she will be able to give her family a better quality of life

loans.use: to purchase fish wholesale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has a food stall in Tala town and has been running it for four years now. He is 31 years old, married, and together with his spouse has been blessed with one child.

He will use this loan to buy maize flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil and beans for use in his hotel. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. This is his 6th loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and he paid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to be self-reliant and be able to provide the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Esther Elisa

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer emprendedora, se levanta todos los días en la madrugada porque tiene su negocio de venta de desayunos, en su ciudad natal, Ica. Diariamente ofrece diversos productos a los clientes, deliciosos panes y energizantes bebidas como quinua, emoliente, maca, entre otros. Ella cree que le está yendo bien porque siempre se esfuerza, es muy dedicada a su labor y sobre todo porque trabaja con la motivación de sacar adelante a su familia.
Esther está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le ha brindado podrá comprar un electrodoméstico para su casa como una nueva cocina para que así pueda preparar más bebidas para sus clientes, de esta manera seguirá luchando para más adelante poder poner su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Esther is an enterprising woman. She gets up at dawn every day because she has a business selling breakfasts in Ica, her hometown. 
Every day she offers a variety of products to her customers: delicious breads and energizing beverages such as quinoa, "emoliente" (a traditional Peruvian hot drink), and Peruvian ginseng, among others.  

She believes that her business is doing well because she always works hard and is dedicated to her work, and, above all, because her motivation for working is getting her family ahead.

Esther is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their support, she will be able to buy an electrical appliance for her home. She wants to purchase a new stove, so she can prepare more beverages for her customers. In this way, she will keep on working hard, so she can have her own restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stove.

loans.name: Familia Ramírez Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad de cultura mazahua (el término mazahua significa "Gente del Venado") se formó un grupo de tres personas muy orgullosas de su raíces que aún conservan su lengua nativa, costumbres y tradiciones. Comentan que no les gustaría perder sus orígenes y por ello enseñan a sus nietos todo lo que pueden acerca de su cultura.

Juana tiene 30 años de edad, está casada con el señor José Luis desde hace 10 años y son padres de una niña de de tres años llamada Maricruz. Desde que conoció a su esposo, Juana comenzó a elaborar hermosas piezas de resina, actividad iniciada por sus suegros y su esposo hace 14 años. Anteriormente, ellos se dedicaban a la compra y venta de lámparas y salían a diferentes puntos de la república Mexicana, pero en la capital encontraron a una persona que creaba artesanía de resina y decidieron invertir en ella. Entonces, comenzaron a vender en los mismos puntos donde ya vendían sus lámparas. Posteriormente comenzaron a comprar la materia prima para crear ellos mismos las figuras que quisieran; pequeñas réplicas de la Diana cazadora, búhos para licenciados, águilas, Cristos, ángeles, etcétera. Juana necesita un crédito para comprar resina, pinturas y catalizador para elaborar más piezas.

Juanita, como le dicen de cariño, platica que normalmente ella y sus esposo salen a vender durante dos meses completos y duermen en su vehículo para no regresar hasta su casa. La única dificultad que enfrenta es la falta de dinero para comprar más moldes, pues cada uno cuesta entre 500 y 600 pesos, dependiendo del tamaño. Sin embargo, esto no la detiene porque ella quiere seguir creciendo como artesana y continuar modernizando sus diseños. 

*En la imagen: Juanita es la mujer detrás de la niña. La foto fue tomada en el jardín del municipio donde habitan los integrantes.
texts.en:
In a community of Mazahua culture (the term Mazahua means “Deer People"), a group was formed by three people who are very proud of their roots, who still use their native language and practice Mazahua customs and traditions. They would hate for their origins to be lost and for this reason teach their grandchildren all they can about their culture. 

Juana is 30 years old and has been married to José Luis for 10 years. They have a three-year-old daughter named Maricruz. Since she met her husband, Juana has been elaborating beautiful works in resin, a craft that her parents-in-law and husband began 14 years ago. 

Before, they made their living buying and selling lamps, traveling to different parts of the Mexican republic. Then, in the capital, they met someone who made objects out of resin, and decided to invest in these objects. They started selling the resin objects in the same places they used to sell lamps. Later, they began buying the raw materials to create the objects they wanted for themselves: small replicas of Diana the Huntress, owls for lawyers, eagles, figurines of Jesus Christ, angels, etc. Juana needs a loan to buy resin, paints and catalyst to make more pieces.
	
Juanita, as they affectionately call her, explains that she and her husband usually go out to sell their products for two whole months, sleeping in the car so they don’t have to go back home. Their only difficulty is the lack of money to buy more molds, because each one costs between 500 and 600 pesos, depending on the size. But she doesn’t let this stop her, because she wants to continue growing as a craftswoman and modernizing her designs. 

*In the photo: Juanita is the woman behind the little girl. The photo was taken in the city park in the town where the group members live.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make crafts.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Jena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jena works hard to support her family. She has a meat butcher business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains and a general store.  Jena is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell for her butcher business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Jena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is 45 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Emelda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Emelda has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 42-year-old man who is married with eight children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He buys and sells cocoa in Bundibugyo. This is his main source of income.

James started this business in order to sustain his family. He hopes to have a bigger business.

He wants a loan to buy more cocoa for his business.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa for his business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina finds pleasure in her gardening activities. She is not only enjoying her hobby, but earning an income as well. 

At the age of 42, she is married and busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. 

She grabbed the opportunity to become a full member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She credits the cooperative for her capital supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Gina wishes to become a flower supplier in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Josie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from clothing sales, food vending and livestock farming. 

Josie is borrowing 28,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Josie has sustained her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of charcoal to resell, so as to earn more.

loans.name: Enosi

texts.en:
Enosi, 60, is married with 10 children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in cocoa buying-and-selling in Bundibugyo. This is the family's main source of income, and he works very hard to sustain it. 

Seasonality affects him so much in his business. He wants this loan to buy more cocoa to sell. 

He hopes to educate all his children with his earnings from this business.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda de 55 años de edad vive con su hija de 30 años de edad quien trabaja como empleada y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas  y verduras en el mercado municipal, Erlinda esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas que le generan buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Erlinda, aged 55, lives with her 30-year-old daughter, who works as a clerk and helps her financially. 

Erlinda makes a living selling fruits and vegetables in the municipal market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables wholesale to be able to continue with her sales, which have generated good earnings for her.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Jewelyn

texts.en:
Jewelyn, 43, is a hardworking mother of four children. She is engaged in the retailing business. 

Jewelyn sells a variety of groceries in her village. She has been in this type of business for five years and hopes it will last. 

Jewelyn shares that, through her income from the business, she is able to provide her four children with allowances to go to school. 

She wishes to expand on the products she sells and increase her income as well. To that end, she is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy noodles, canned goods, rice grain and spices to sell. 

Jewelyn is looking toward the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, rice grain and spices to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  

Erlinda is borrowing 11,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy vegetables to sell for her vegetable business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling charcoal in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling rice. Nida is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ma. Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Ma. Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and a tricycle transportation business. Ma. Rosalinda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Ma. Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Hello Lenders! Meet Gladys, 30, a mother of two who has defied the notion among her friends that farming is an old-fashioned way of earning a living. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and farming. Gladys hails from Kisii, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns that boost crop production in the area. Gladys, being someone who is very ambitious and someone who always takes advantage of positive things, would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boost her farming. Being a hardworking mother, Gladys has always ensured putting food on the table for her family. She also ensures she is able to take her children to school. Gladys detests living in conditions of poverty and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. This is why she is seeking a loan of 52,000 KES in order to be able to purchase a dairy cow. This will help in producing milk and manure to be used on her farm. Milk from the cow will be sold to the local market and this means improved cash flow. Through improved cash flow this means that profits will be higher and she can comfortably take care of her family and take her kids to school. Through your loan Gladys will be empowered economically and be able to improve her standard of living and also those of people living within the area. Gladys is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David - a smallholder dairy farmer in Kapsowar, Kenya. He is seeking a loan to build fences around his farm. The fence will create a boundary that will prevent his stock from wandering outside it's grazing area. The fence will also come in handy in the overall protection of his property.
This loan will make David's work of looking after his cows very easy.

loans.use: to fence his farm

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Mabinty. She is married and has 3 children aged 10, 15 and 20 years old. 

In 2008, Mabinty established her provision shop business. She began her business because she wanted to take care of herself, and to increase her monthly earnings and profit margin. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about SLL 870,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan to the amount of SLL 3,000,000 in order to purchase more items such as sugar, milk, sardines, lunchmeat and batteries for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 600,000.

In the future, Mabinty plans to educate her two children up to university, and to buy 2 plots of land to build on. She is looking forward to funds that will help her to develop her business so that she can educate her children properly.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, sardines, lunchmeat and batteries for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a businesswoman from Gokwe South District, Zimbabwe. In addition to volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she teaches students life skills education, Margret rents a small shop where she sells groceries such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, cornmeal, sugar beans, matemba (dried sardines), biscuits, sweets, and stationary.

Margret started the business at her home last year and she is very pleased with how far she has come. Margret would like to use the Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. She hopes to grow the business even more and increase its profitability to better provide for her family’s needs. She is also interested in doing her part to create more employment opportunities in her community.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Good Neighbors Group

texts.en:
This is a group of women who work for a community-based organization in Dandora, a slum in Nairobi. They all use charcoal for cooking. Traditional cook stoves generate a lot of indoor air pollution which causes respiratory diseases and which also consume a lot of charcoal.

Currently, on average, each group member spends USD 1.3 on charcoal everyday. The loan will enable them purchase high efficient cook stoves Jikokoa that will save them up to 50% of their daily consumption on charcoal. These cook stoves also reduce smoke and carbon emissions from the charcoal thus creating a better and cleaner environment for their families.

The families will be able to save USD 0.65 daily from the reduced consumption on charcoal. This translates to USD 234 every year for at least 5 years, the estimated lifetime of the cook stove. This money will be saved and used for other needs like paying for their children's school fees, paying rent and making their lives better.

loans.use: to pay for a high efficiency cook stove.

loans.name: Lulu

texts.en:
Lulu is a 21-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her aunt in Tanzania. She is a Camfed Learner Guide in her community where she helps young students tackle school and life challenges. When she is not helping students increase their school performance, Lulu runs a retail shop where she sells house hold expenses. She uses the profits from her business to help her aunt with the household expenses. She is also able to purchase more products to sell in her shop. 

Lulu is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can increase the amount and variety of products in her shop. Lulu also intends to renovate her shop.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell in her shop

loans.name: Winners Group

texts.en:
Sandra came from Akyempim in the central region of Ghana. She is 29 years old, and married with two children aged 11 and 7 years. She lives with her family in Akyempim. Both of her children are currently attending school. 

Sandra also bakes bread, which she sells at wholesale to individuals for resell. Sandra and her group members are the only local distributors of Elsa clean cook stoves in their district. The stove uses virgin pellets (Palm Kennel Shells), which are easily available as waste materials within the communities they operate. There is a high demand for Elsa clean cook stoves since they do not emit and improve indoor air quality and health of the users. Besides, it is cost saving as the fuel cost is either very negligible or zero. The benefits of the stove are spread by word of mouth. 

Sandra and her group members need a micro loan to buy more stoves to meet the growing demand they face. Funding their loan will also reduce deforestation and put an end to cutting down trees for firewood and charcoal. 

Sandra and her group members thank their micro lenders for their generosity and help to save the forest within their business communities.

loans.use: To purchase clean cook stoves

loans.name: Beisy Marisol

texts.es:
Beisy de 38 años de edad, estudió hasta educación media, está soltera y tiene dos hijos.

Beisy se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, ella se levanta junto a sus hijos a las 5:00 AM para realizar las actividades diarias que se centran en la agricultura y comercio de aves de corral.


	Ella necesita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como ladrillos, cemento, hierro, piedra, arena, etc. Para construir una vivienda para su familia, ya que actualmente su casa es de lámina y en invierno se filtra el agua.

Sus planes son que con los ingresos que obtiene de la siembra, del comercio de las aves de corral y del préstamo para la construcción de su vivienda podrá en un futuro darles mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Beisy, 38, studied up to middle school.  She is single and has three children.
Beisy makes a living in agriculture, work she learned from her parents,  She gets up along with her children at 5:00 a.m. in order to engage in daily activities that center around agriculture and the chicken business.
She needs the loan to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, rebar, stone, sand, etc. in order to construct a residence for her family since right now her house is made of corrugated tin and in the winter water filters in.
Her plans are that with the income that she gets from the crops, from the chicken business and from the loan for the construction of her residence, she will be able to give a better education to her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, rebar, stone, sand, etc. in order to construct a residence for her family.

loans.name: Ganyo  Farmers Group

texts.en: Agnes is 36 years old. She is married with four children who are currently attending school. Agnes is a farmer and grows cocoa, cassava, maize, yams and sweet potatoes. She lives with her family at Ayitey in the Central Region of Ghana. Agnes is the leader of the Ganyo Farmer Group from Assin Ayitey. Agnes' main problem is that she can't afford to buy an Elsa Clean Cook Stove outright to replace her open mud firewood stove. She can afford to pay by installments from the sale of her farm produce. Agnes is very anxious to buy a clean cook stove to reduce indoor air pollution and save the lives of her family. Besides, she will save the money spent to buy firewood because she can get the fuel for the clean stove (virgin pellet) within her community. Agnes is grateful to her micro-lenders for their unfailing support. Your micro-loan means reducing child- and maternal-mortality and illnesses.

loans.use: To purchase a clean cook stove

loans.name: Hokume

texts.en: Hokume is a 43-year-old married mother of two children. She is an IDP person (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in Bilasuvar region. Her husband is a driver, but his salary is not enough to cover their family's needs. Because of that, Hokume grows vegetables and fruits on her  small plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this business for five years. Her husband helps her in this business. She is asking for the support of Kiva lenders because she wants to grow a different crop, like potatoes, this season. She needs a loan 1500 AZN to buy fertilizer, manure, and high-quality seeds to plant. By no longer depending on bean crops to support the needs of her children, she plans to diversify her income and get ahead. This is going to be her first  loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Milcah. She is a super incredible farmer! She certainly ranks among the top successful smallholder farmers on Juhudi Kilimo's client list.

Born in 1976 into a humble family, Milcah's upbringing was difficult. She attended school and cleared secondary, after which she got into mixed farming 18 years ago. She also got married to a lovely husband who is 44 years old today. Together, they were blessed with 4 children.

Milcah practices farming on a 30-acre farm that is owned by the family in the village of Sugoi. On the farm, she grows passion fruit, beans, millet, vegetables, soybeans and maize. She also keeps more than five highly productive dairy cows for milk production. The 38-year-old farmer sells her produce in bulk 5 kilometres away from her home. Her key clients are the Cereal Board, institutions and local people. She owns motorcycles that help in farm transportation.

She is such a good farmer that the Kenyan Ministry of Agriculture picked her farm to be a model farm for other farmers. She is also a secretary of Emkwen Group, a group she formed to help members, who are smallholder farmers, to save and use the savings to access loans from financial institutions.

Milcah is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to build a greenhouse and to build a cow shed. She needs greenhouse technology to continuously improve the productivity, profitability and sustainability of her major farming systems. A greenhouse will provide a favourable environment for her plants. It will also protect the plants from adverse climatic conditions such as wind, cold, precipitation, excessive radiation, extreme temperature, insects and diseases. The dairy unit will also greatly boost her dairy management as she slowly transitions to zero-grazing.

With your lending, Milcah will have a year-round production of crops and off-season production of vegetable and fruits. She will also save on the use of natural resources such as water. Water requirement of crops is very limited and easy to control with this technology.

Milcah has a great credit history. In 2006, she took a KES 100,000 loan and successfully serviced it. She also took a second and a third loan of KES 40,000 and KES 80,000 in the years 2010 and 2012 respectively. This will be her fourth loan after successfully clearing the previous loans.

She stated that this loan will change her life. Profits from this investment will be be plowed back into the business to fuel further growth. There still remains so much space on her land for future growth. If there ever was an opportunity to invest a $25 loan in someone's future, it is here! You won't regret it!

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse and a dairy shed

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 36-year-old farmer from Sirgoit village in the Eldoret area of Kenya. He owns a small piece of land which is extremely fertile for agriculture.

The mixed-farmer sells milk, crops, and seeds produced on his farm at Eldoret market. He has been doing this work for the last 8 years with some help from his wife Faustine. The couple has 2 children. 

With children, the couple has had to find ways to increase their income to meet the increases in financial obligations. They have ventured into other personal businesses to make ends meet. Moses is seeking a loan to expand their horticulture farm and venture into poultry farming. The expansion is necessary for an increase in the farm's output. 

Diversity into poultry farming, which is quite easy to start, will bring various merits too. Not only is it a way of spreading risks, but it also brings additional income that is acquired very regularly. 

Moses aspires to  venture into the transportation business in the future to help him cut transportation costs, which is his highest expense. He stated that his family's lives will be greatly impacted by this loan.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and expand his horticultural farm

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
He is Marvin, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Marvin is married to Dorleen, a Dole employee, and they have children. One is in high school and the other two are in elementary level. He works hard to augment their income to fully support their daily needs and to send his children to school. 
 
Marvin operates a tricycle and drives it himself. In the  Philippines, especially in the provinces like Palawan, a tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited. Very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride tricycles from their homes to market, church, to their friends' homes and to other destinations within their community. He even transports them from one town to the other. He earns a minimum of PHP 700 a day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan, which he will use for repairs and maintenance of his tricycle. It is important that his tricycle is always in good running condition to provide continuous service. He is positive that his income is stable as tricycle transportation is really a need in their place.

Marvin hopes to buy a new tricycle to better improve his transportation service. He dreams of sending all his children to college and giving them a bright future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and were he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of his tricycle for his transportation service.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is an artisan from Peru who specializes in leather bags. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of leather. Arturo has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story: Arturo has specialized in tooled leather since 1995. His parents are in the clothing industry, where he learned many of the techniques he applies to leather. The father of two children, Arturo gets many design ideas from his wife, Veronica. "I prefer desk accessories, handbags, briefcases and luggage. We use hand tools and I've formed a community of artisans who collaborate with me. Our designs are lovingly crafted by hand, and we feel a personal attachment to what we do," he says. "I am thankful for everyone's support through this microcredit. The funds will allow me to purchase the raw material I need to prepare for the busy holiday selling season." Use the link below to view Arturo's leather bags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3957

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of leather

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Cathrine has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. 

In addition, Cathrine has a business selling kapenta (sardines) in her community. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Cathrine will purchase more kapenta to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own shop.  This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more kapenta to increase her supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal.

loans.name: Mario Paulo

texts.es: Mario de 44 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y con su hija, el se dedica a la actividad de taller de frenos y clocks, cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en la actividad, con lo que gana de su trabajo logra solventar las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Mario solicita un crédito para la compra de repuestos por mayor para poder ofrecer a sus clientes que le visitan, y mejorar sus ingresos, y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mario is 44 years old and lives with his wife and their daughter.  He works repairing brakes and clocks.  He has 15 years old in this field.  With the earnings from this work, he is able to cover the needs of his household.  Mario is seeking a loan to purchase spare parts in bulk in order to offer them to his customers and improve his earnings so that he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase spare parts in bulk.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a business minded woman who always dreams to succeed. She is 44 years of age, married, and has one child attending school. Marilyn’s husband is her partner in managing their footwear and watch repair businesses. They have been running theses businesses for six years, and they consider them as gainful businesses as well. Through their profits, they can provide their daily household expenditures. 

Marilyn is proud that with even a simple footwear business she is able to give a better way of living to her child. Marilyn wishes that she could give the best to her child. She plans to extend her watch repair by also selling watches. At this point, Marilyn is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more slippers, sandals, and necessities for her watch repair business. She hopes to satisfy her customers, by improving the service she renders.

loans.use: to buy more slippers, sandals, and necessities for her watch repair business.

loans.name: Dúo San Antonio Group

texts.es: Dúo San Antonio, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Ericka Marleni de 26 años de edad,y Lidia Irene,Ericka se dedica a la venta de verduras y productos comestibles, se ha dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años ya que es ka forma de que ella a podido salir adelante,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia en verduras y productos comestibles para surtir un poco mas su negocio, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado, el sueño de ella es tener un local mas grande y generar mejores ganancias y asi seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The group Dúo San Antonio is made up of Ericka Marleni and Lidia Irene. She is 26 years old, and makes a living selling vegetables and groceries. She has been working in this field for many years now, and this is the way that she has been able to get ahead. 

At this time she is requesting a loan to buy inventory of vegetables and groceries to supply her business a little more. She hopes that she can receive help through the requested loan. Her dream is to have a larger venue and to generate more revenues and in this way get ahead.

loans.use: to buy inventory of vegetables and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Ailleen

texts.en: Ma. Ailleen is a 36-year-old mother of three who runs a general store in the community of Misamis Occidental. With over four years in this business, she earns a good income to support the needs of her family. Her determination to become successful makes her work harder to gain revenue. She joined GDMPC recently and borrowed a loan to buy grocery items like canned goods and noodles, in addition to her working inventory capital. She is happy that, with this loan, she can generate more revenue and save a portion of it for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like canned goods and noodles, in addition to her working inventory capital

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland is married with two children and lives in Misamis Occidental with his family. He operates his own farm, which is his main source of income, growing and harvesting vegetables to make a living. He joined GDMPC and had borrowed a loan to buy new seedlings and manure fertilizer for his farm. He hopes to generate an abundant harvest with the help of this current loan. He also planned to save a portion of his revenue for the education of his children in the near future.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and manure fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente, a father of an only child, operates his own farm to make a living. For six years he has earned well to provide the family. He had planned to improve their farm in order to send his child to school. 

Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase manure fertilizer to have higher returns and to restore farm nutrients. 

In the future, he wants to provide a good education for his child, and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase manure fertilizer

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is 35 years old and married.  She has three children.  She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Dionisia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Dionisia has been in pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Floria

texts.es: Floria, tiene la edad  de 57 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  de fertilizantes adecuados para el estado en que se encuentra el cultivo de la caña de azúcar la cual en este caso es utilizada para la fabricación de dulce, además realizar algunos trabajos de mejoramiento del suelo por medio de labores culturales como lo es evitar la ersión del suelo por medio del agua de lluvia, además de realizar una resiembra y asi aumentar la dencidad de plantas por área y de esta manera mejorar la producción, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación, de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo de caña, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de este cultivo. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una producción adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en el cultivo. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Flora is 57 years old, married and lives with her husband and their children who are her top priority.  With her loan, she plans on purchasing fertilizers for her sugarcane crops that are used to make sugar, performing some work to improve the land to prevent erosion due to rain, replanting so that she can increase the density of plants in the area to improve her production, and paying for labor to apply these products and help with the planting, ensuring that the job will be done well.

She hopes to take advantage of the good climate and land conditions in the region for growing sugarcane, as well as her years of experience in managing sugarcane crops.  She will also be able to purchase better quality products in order for her crops to develop well and healthily, as well as have an adequate yield.  She plans on using the expected earnings from the crops on the wellbeing and education of her family, as well as reaching some family goals and continuing to invest in her crops.  

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  Previously, she had not had any loans from national banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided her a loan with great ease and a very low interest rate.

loans.use: with her sugarcane.

loans.name: Flor Alba

texts.es: Alba tiene 43 años de edad, vive con sus 5 hijos, es casada pero su esposo vive lejos ya que por motivo de trabajo tuvo que irse a otro lugar pero visita a su familia cada mes, Alba se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y en esta ocasión va a invertir el crédito en la compra de pollos, Alba tiene corralitos para criar sus pollos, lo que Alba  aspira es que adecuar los corrales para incrementar  mas pollos y seguir trabajando para que sus hijos sigan estudiando y no les haga falta lo indispensable.
texts.en: Alba is 43 years old, has five children, and is married.  Her husband lives far away because he had to move to away in order to work.  However, he visits the family every month.  Alba works raising small animals.  She is seeking this loan to purchase chickens.  Alba has small pens that she uses to raise chickens.  Alba aspires to acquiring more pens in order to increase the amount of chickens she has and continue working so that her children can continue studying, and so that they will not lack a thing.

loans.use: purchase chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace varios, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, el ven vive en casa propia con su madre, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de concentrado y vitaminas para los pollos y asi poder continuar con su crianza para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man whose face has been pixelated given the fact that he is 26 and lives in a dangerous region works raising chickens.  He has been raising chickens for many years, and with his earnings, he is able to cover some of his household expenses.  He lives in a house that he owns with his mother.
