Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar como granos, abarrotes, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su negocio.

El guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Francisco is a very friendly person and always has a smile on his face for his customers who visit his grocery store in the rural part of El Carmen de Viboral.

Thanks to his charisma and good nature he has been able to win the hearts and recognition of the people in the area who prefer to visit his store to buy their goods.

He works every day to provide a good quality of life for his four children for whom he wants to provide a good future.  He is asking for this loan to buy a stock of products such as grains, groceries, sweets, beverages, and other things in order to provide a boost to his business.

He hopes to be able to continue his business so he can continue to impact the lives of his customers through good service.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 50 years old, single and works hard to help her nephew in his studies.

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her ready-to-wear business.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Danilo De Jesus

texts.es:
Danilo es un hombre de 46 años de edad el cual se desempeña como padre amoroso y como agricultor, en vista de que los ingresos no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, comenzó con una actividad que realiza en los ratos libres que le quedan como jornalero en otras fincas y es la cría y venta de pollos de engorde con los que intenta mejorar las condición es de vida de su familia ya que como cabeza de familia está a cargo de todos los gastos en su hogar por lo que no le queda mucho capital para invertir en su negocio. 

Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de pollos de engorde y concentrados con los que podrá mejorar sus ventas e impulsar esta actividad, teniendo más activas en su micro negocio y haciendo más atractivo a la vista de los clientes pues tendrá más pollos para ofertar.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposa.

Apoya a un campesino del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Danilo is a 46 year old man who is also a loving father.  As a farmer, his income is not enough to cover the household expenses, so he started a new activity that he does in his spare time, working as a laborer on other farms, as well as raising and selling chickens.  He is trying to improve his family’s living conditions and as the head of the family, he takes care of all the expenses.  There is little left over to invest in his business.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan to buy chickens and feed so he can improve his sales and build his business, having more in his business and making it more attractive to his customers by having chickens to sell.

His greatest dream is to have a good income so that his family wants for nothing because he experienced this growing up and it affected him, so he works hard for his children and wife.

Please help a Columbian farmer with great dreams for his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Adolfo Arnoldo

texts.es:
Adolfo de 47 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado en la comunidad donde reside, ya no pudo continuar debido al conflicto armado que vivió el país, está soltero y no tiene hijos, solo su madre depende de él.

Adolfo se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos (maíz, frijoles y maicillo) él siembra tres hectárea de estos cultivos, además cuida de las fincas de café que tiene su madre en la comunidad para lo cual camina por las madrugadas, tiene que levantarse a las cuatro de la mañana para partir a los lugares de trabajo y estar pendiente de los cultivos de café, maíz, frijoles y maicillo.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar abono para los cultivos de café, y para pagar mano de obra.

Adolfo sueña con lograr en el futuro mejores cosechas de café para vender mas y obtener muy buenos resultados económicos, también está dentro sus planes sembrar cinco hectáreas mas de café para aumentar los cultivos.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 47 years old and has a ninth grade education in his community.  He was not able to continue because of the armed conflict that swept through the country.  He is single and has no children.  His mother depends on him financially.

Adolfo raises basic grains (corn, beans, and barley).  He planted three hectares of those crops and also cares for his mother’s coffee crop.  He walks in the early morning and has to get up at 4:00 am to go to his places of work and care for the crops.

He needs this loan to buy fertilizer for the coffee crops and to pay for labor.

Adolfo wants better coffee harvests in the future so he can sell more and have better financial results.  He also plans to plant five more hectares of coffee to increase his crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Sophan (in photo) is 38 years old, a widowed mother with two sons. One of her sons is a construction worker and another attends school. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

In spite of being widowed, Sophan still tries to earn income to support her standard of living and send her son to school. She is a traditional singer who sings for Khmer wedding events.

She plans to request a loan to replace her motorbike because the old one is breaking and uses more gasoline than new ones!

Sophan will also use the rest of the loan to connect her house to a private electrical utility service because she needs to use electricity from her neighboring house, for which they charge her lots of money. Connecting directly to a private electrical utility service will not cost a high price.

loans.use: to replace her motorbike and connect her house to a private electrical utility service.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampot Province, Yoeun is 65 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is in university. She grows rice on three hectares of land as her main source of income, and she also sells coconuts to supplement her income. 

This is not Yoeun's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan amount this time to pay school fees for her son, who wants to pursue a Bachelor Degree majoring in Accounting. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son, who wants to pursue a Bachelor Degree majoring in Accounting.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea (in photo) lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married for many years, but still has no child yet.

Chea is a weaver, while her husband works for a factory that produces ice. The house where she lives is breaking in some parts (roof and walls) so she applied for a loan in order to repair her house and she will also use the rest of the loan to fill in the land around the house.

loans.use: to repair her roof and walls and fill in the land around the house.

loans.name: Tipindule Group

texts.en:
Emily is 32 years old and married to Henderson, who is 45 years old. They have five children and other dependents who go to school. She runs a grocery store selling assorted items and she wants this loan to purchase goods in large quantities from wholesale shops in Nkhotakota trading center to attract more customers in her village. Emily is involved in business to alleviate poverty levels in her family and to be economically empowered.

Emily works from home and has been operating her business for six years. She plans to expand her grocery store into a wholesale shop and to buy a secondhand vehicle for her family when she generates enough profits. Since she started accessing loans she has seen herself making more profits and she hopes the training in Business Management she received offered by Microloan Foundation will help her achieve her goals. As a woman she is self-reliant and she has managed to buy good clothes for her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more soft drinks, banana juice and mango juice.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 27 years old. She is married with two children aged between 3 years and 4 months, who do not yet go to school. She sells sorghum and has been running the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for her children and goats.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell

loans.name: Nancy Stefanni

texts.es: Nancy Stefanni, tiene la edad  de 27 años, está soltera,  vive con su hijo y sus padres, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra  d productos para uso personal como lo son colonias, maquillajes y prendas de vestir tanto para hombres como para mujeres, con esta compra de mas productos espera mejorar su inventario y así ofrecerle a los clientes una mayor cantidad de mercadería y alternativas para que escojan y así mejorar las ventas, la idea de esta compra es seguir suministrándole los clientes de los productos y así mantener la clientela que le han comprado a lo largo de varias años. Con el ingreso de las ventas que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en su negocio. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Nancy Stefanni is 27 years old, single, and lives with her son and her parents, who are her first priority. With her loan she plans to buy personal use products like perfumes, makeup, and clothing, for both men and women. With this purchase of more products she hopes to improve her inventory and so offer her customers better-quality merchandise, so as to maintain the clients who have bought from her steadily through the years. She wants to put the income from the sales that she expects toward her family's wellbeing and studies, to attain certain family goals, and to continue to invest in her business. This is the first loan she has gotten with FUDECOSUR. She has never taken out a loan with a state bank, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with more help and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sell cosmetics and other products

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith de 67 años de edad se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada desde el año 2010 cuando una amiga mayorista de mercancias le sugirió y desde entonces ha sido intermitente en ella, pero ya decidida ha logrado aumentar sus ventas y hoy quiere tener un amplio capital para incrementar sus ventas para apoyar a sus hijos y nietos con sus utilidades. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito directamente al cliente, mediante compras de contado de productos de belleza, acero, oro golfi, galletería  etc. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva , primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Galleteria con motivos de fin de año, productos de belleza y accesorios de oro golfi y de acero. Todo ello para aprovechar la temporada navideña que se acerca y en la que tradicionalmente incrementan sus ventas y hacen que su inversión impacte positivamente su negocio, en tanto que aumenta su capital de trabajo y le ofrece la oportunidad de comprar en mayor volumen y de atender a su clientela real y potencial.
texts.en:
Judith is 67 years old and has been selling various merchandise since the year 2010, when a wholesaler friend suggested it to her. Since then she has done this work intermittently, but she is decided now, and has managed to increase her sales. Now she wants to have a large amount of capital to increase her sales to help her children and grandchildren with their supplies. She sells on credit directly to her clients, through cash purchases of beauty products, steel, goldfilled, cookies, etc. 

Now she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy cookies for the end-of-year season, beauty products, and goldfilled and steel accessories. All of this is to take advantage of the Christmas season, which is coming soon, and during which her sales usually increase. Because of this, her investment will have a positive impact on her business, as it will increase her working capital and give her the opportunity to buy in larger quantities and to serve current and potential customers.

loans.use: to buy cookies for the end-of-year season, beauty products, and goldfilled and steel accessories

loans.name: Teltaaba Guille Group

texts.fr:
Mme Alimata est la représentante du groupe TELTAABA GUILLE. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a15 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend des céréales depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 06 sacs d’haricots, 05 sacs d’arachides, 04 sacs de mil.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de renforcer son activité et aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin de céréales.
texts.en:
Alimata is the representative of the Teltaaba Guille group. She is married and mother to five children, the eldest of whom is 15 years old and the youngest four. Four of the children attend school and Alimata has five dependants.

She has been selling cereals for the past seven years and gets her supplies from the market in her neighborhood. Her customers live in the same neighborhood. She would like to buy six sacks of beans, five sacks of groundnut and four sacks of millet. 

Alimata would like to save her profits so she can boost her business and help out with the cost of her children's schooling. Her ambition is to open a large cereal shop.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of beans, five sacks of groundnut and four sacks of millet.

loans.name: Rut Arcelia

texts.es: Arcelia es una señora de  54 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos,  su esposo es comerciante de papas, Arcelia es una  señora que vive en Ecuador pero nació en Colombia y dejo este país porque no se puede vivir tranquila por motivo de los conflictos que se dan entre la guerrilla y los militares, Arcelia se dedica desde siempre a la actividad de crianza y comercialización de pollos,  y de este motivo el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra pollos para comercializarlos en las ferias de las ciudades más cercanas, lo que Arcelia desea es mejorar su negocio, sus ventas y quedarse viviendo en Ecuador.
texts.en:
Arcelia is a married woman of 54 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is a potato trader. Arcelia was born in Colombia but lives in Ecuador having left Colombia because the conflicts between the guerrillas and the military meant she couldn't live in peace.

Arcelia has always made a living breeding and selling chickens. She is going to invest the loan in buying chickens to sell in the markets in the neighboring towns. Arcelia hopes to improve her business, increase her sales and continue living in Ecuador.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Farlou Bagdad Group

texts.fr: Mame Diarra  est la présidente du groupement FARLOU BAKHDAD. Il est composé de 10 membres qui sont toutes des femmes. Elles habitent dans le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fin de semaine pour organiser des tontines. La présidente évolue dans le commerce de tissus, On la reconnait sur la photo par la main levée. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de 7 ans dans cette activité. Elle est à son 2ème prêt et sollicite celui-ci pour acheter des tissus dans la sous région pour venir les revendre dans sa commune. Elle démarre sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 17h. A l’avenir, elle souhaite disposer de son propre magasin et être autonome vis-à-vis de son fond de roulement. Ainsi, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mame Diarra is the president of the Farlou Bagdad group, which is made up of ten women. The women live in the same neighborhood and get together at the end of every week to organise "tontines" (a revolving finance system where each member periodically puts in an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to different members). The president has a trading activity selling fabrics. She is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is married and a mother, and she helps out her husband with the daily outgoings and their children's schooling fees. She has seven years' experience in her business and is on her second loan. She is requesting this loan so she can buy fabrics in her sub-region to resell in her municipality. She begins her day at nine o'clock in the morning and finishes at five in the afternoon. In the future she would like to have her own shop and be autonomous in terms of working capital. She will thereby be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell on.

loans.name: Ablam

texts.fr: Ablam femme d'un mécanicien et maman de 03 enfants de 20 17 et 7ans, revend des produits alimentaires(tomate, lait, riz, huile végétale) devant la devanture de sa maison. Cette activité qu'elle exerce depuis 2004 lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge. Elle désire un prêt à WAGES pour s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients. Elle espère à l'avenir passer plus de commandes et bien nourrir la famille. Ablam est âgée de 37ans.
texts.en: Ablam is the wife of a mechanic and mother to three children, who are aged 20, 17 and seven years old respectively. She sells groceries (tomatoes, milk, rice, vegetable oil) in front of her house. This activity, which she has been carrying out since 2004, earns her sufficient income to take care of herself. She would like a loan from WAGES so that she can stock up on goods to satisfy customer demand. In the future she hopes to be able to make more orders and feed her family. Ablam is 37 years old.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es:
Willian de 30 años de edad, estudió hasta 9º grado pues sus padres eran pobres y no podían darle un nivel de estudio superior, está casado y su esposa se dedica alas labores del hogar, tiene dos hijos que están pequeños y dependen de él.


Wilian actualmente se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, él siembra dos hectáreas de maíz y lo aprendió de su padre, ya que desde niño andaba con él, además de la agricultura Willian trabaja como albañil, él se levanta a las 5:00 AM y se traslada a su parcela, luego se va donde trabaja como albañil.


Él necesita el crédito para sembrar maíz y comprar algunos materiales de construcción.


Él sueña con tener una vivienda propia pues donde vive es de su padre, además desea sembrar mas y de mejor calidad, tener un vehículo para transportar la cosecha y para movilizar a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilian is 30 years old and only studied until the 9th grade because his parents were poor and weren't able to pay for him to continue to higher education. He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores. He has two small children who depend on him. 

At the moment Wilian is a farmer and he cultivates two hectares of corn. He learned this labor from his father, who he accompanied as a child. As well as being a farmer, Wilian also works as a bricklayer. He gets up at 5:00 AM to go to his plot and then he goes to where he works as a bricklayer. 

He needs the loan to cultivate corn and buy some construction materials. 

His dream is to own his own house because where he lives now is his father's. He also hopes to plant more crops of a better quality and own a vehicle to transport the harvest as well as move his family around.

loans.use: to cultivate corn and buy some construction materials.

loans.name: Rosa Judith

texts.es: Rosa de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella es caficultora dese hace 20 años, se dedica al cultivo y venta de café, su hijo mayor le ayuda con las siembras, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con las ganancias que tiene logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Rosa está solicitando un crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc.  para continuar con sus cultivos y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 47 years old. She lives in her own home with her three children. She has been a coffee grower for 20 years. She grows and sells coffee. Her oldest son helps her with the crops and she sells her products in different markets. With her earnings she is able to pay for some household expenses. Rosa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pest control, etc. to continue with her crops and thus obtain better profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 44 años de edad, el es una hombre emprendedor y decidido para poder superar en la vida, el no se deja vencer por los obstáculos que la vida le pone sino el alcanza todo sus mentas y sueños, el tiene cinco hijos que mantener, los primeros  dos ya tienen familias apartes y los tres últimos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad. 	

El obtiene sus ingresos económicos por medio de la producción de maxan en la comunidad donde el vive, sus padres le enseñaron dicha actividad desde hace 10 años, el realiza la venta de su producto en el mercado y en los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito es para la compra de terreno para poder cultivar mas maxan en su comunidad, ya que para el es de mucha importancia que sus plantas de maxan produzcan hojas de primera calidad y así no perder a los clientes con que el cuenta.

Una de las grandes aspiraciones de el es la siembra de más plantas de maxan y ver crecer a sus hijos en el campo de la educación y convertirse en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 44 years old. He is an enterprising man who has decided to get ahead in life. He doesn't let obstacles that life puts in his way defeat him and he reaches all of his goals and dreams. He has five children to support. The first two already have families of their own and the three youngest are excellent students in the community school. 

He gets his income by growing maxan in the community where he lives. His parents taught him this activity ten years ago. He sells his product in the market and around the community and that way he has income to improve his family's living conditions.

The use he will give this loan is to buy land to be able to grow more maxan in his community, since it is very important for the maxan plants to have high quality leaves so he won't lose the customers he has.

One of his biggest goals in life is to plant more maxan plants and see his children being educated and have good professions in life.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie is 72-years-old. She is married with eight children aged between 21 and 49; three of them go to school. She has been farming for 16 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to buy land.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for potatoes.

loans.name: María Alejandra

texts.es:
María de 37 años de edad, por ser parte de una familia muy pobre no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de ella. 

María actualmente se dedica a vender frutas en el cantón donde vive y lo ha hecho desde hace 10 años, también trabajó en la agricultura por medio de sus padres, horario no tiene pues hasta que termina de vender regresa a su casa .


Ella necesita el crédito para ampliar más el negocio de frutas y comprar materiales para mejorar su casa.

Los sueños de maría son tener una tienda en su casa, para ya no tener que salir a la calle, ypoder darle el estudio  que ella no pudo a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old. Because she is from a very poor family she didn't have a chance to go to school. She is married and her spouse works in agriculture. She has 3 children and 2 of them depend on her.   

Right now, María works selling fruit in the canton where she lives and she has done it for 10 years. She also worked in agriculture through her parents. She doesn't have a schedule, she goes home when she finishes selling.   

She needs the loan to expand her business and to buy materials to improve her home. Maria's dream is to have a store in her house and be able to give her children the education she couldn't have.

loans.use: to expand her business more and buy materials to improve her home.

loans.name: Grisell Angie

texts.es:
GRISELL ANGIE, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos por ahora, ya que solamente se está dedicando a sus estudios que en éste momento son su prioridad.
Grisell Angie, es estudiante de la carrera de Cosmética Dermatológica, carrera que se dedica a mejorar el aspecto físico de las personas, ya tiene un año estudiando le parece que es una carrera bonita, entretenida, creativa e interesante. Es una muy buena alumna, tiene calificaciones altas, pues su meta es ser una gran profesional en la especialidad que ha elegido.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como cremas que son un poco costosas, algunas herramientas que siempre le piden y que son de uso personal así que debe renovarlos. Gracias a éste préstamo ella podrá estudiar tranquila ya que podrá cubrir los gastos que le genera la compra de materiales y así podrá avanzar más rápido en su aprendizaje.
texts.en:
GRISELL ANGIE is 19 years old. She is single and doesn't have any children for now because she is just concentrating on her studies, which are her priority right now.  

Grisell Angie is studying Cosmetic Dermatology. This major is dedicated to improving people's physical aspect. She has been studying for a year and she thinks it is a nice, interesting, creative and entertaining major. She is a very good student with high grades and her goal is to be a great professional in the specialty she has chosen.

She will invest the loan she has received in buying materials such as creams that are a little expensive, some tools that she is always asked for that are for personal use so they have to be replaced. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to study in peace because she will be able to cover the expenses generated by buying materials so she can advance more quickly in her learning.

loans.use: to invest in buying products and tools for her major in cosmetic dermatology.

loans.name: Dermis

texts.es: Dermis de 48 años de edad se dedica a actividades de publicidad, él es locutor y vende  cuñas publicitarias, desde hace 25 años cuando decidió dedicarse a lo que más le gusta : “la locución y a todo lo que de la comunicación se deriva”. Su cónyuge es manicurista y con ella reside en una casa familiar, con sus hijos en las edades de 14 a 22 años de edad. Desde una emisora Dermis diariamente locuta y vende espacios publicitarios que promueven el merado de muchos personas que quieren vender sus productos también. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará papelería, gorras de promoción, camisetas y tarjetas de presentación. Con esta inversión aumentará el conocimiento de su potencial clientela, respecto al desarrollo de su actividad y así se incrmentarán sus ventas, porque sus metas es ampliar el mercado de clientes y finalmente tener su propia vivienda, para aportarle a un mayor bienestar en su familia.
texts.en:
Dermis, 48, works with advertisement. He is a radio announcer and sells radio advertisements. He loves everything related to broadcasting and communications, so he decided to work with this twenty-five years ago. His wife is a manicurist. They live in a house with their children, aged 14 and 22. Dermis works at a radio station, where he presents different programs and sells advertisements to businesspeople that want to sell their products.

Dermis is applying for a CrediKiva, which would be the first loan he receives from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will buy promotional merchandise such as stationery items, caps, shirts and business cards. This investment will help him to reach potential clients and increase his sales. His goal is to have more clients and be able to buy a house, which will result in the improvement of his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy promotional merchandise such as caps, shirts and business cards.

loans.name: Pengwende Guille Group

texts.fr:
Mme TIMPOKO  est la représentante du groupe PENGWENDE GUILLE. Elle se porte très bien. Marié, elle est mère de 05 enfants, le plus âgé a 50 ans et le moins âgé a 30 ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle  a 01 personne  en charge.
Madame est productrice de boisson locale depuis 10 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les habitants de son quartier.
Elle  veut s’acheter 01 sac de mil.
Mme TIMPOKO  veut épargner ses bénéfices pour aider ses enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand cabaret.
texts.en: Mrs TIMPOKO  is the representative of the PENGWENDE GUILLE group. She is very well, married, and the mother of five children aged between 50 and 30. One of them attends school and one of them is still under her responsability. She has been production local drinks for the last ten years. She stocks up on materials in her neighborhood, and then sells to other neighbors. She is asking for this loan in order to purchase one bag of millet. Mrs TIMPOKO would like to save her profits in order to help support her children. She hopes to one day open a large bar.

loans.use: purchase one bag of millet .

loans.name: Maguette Elisabeth's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 42 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 31 juillet 2013. Ce dernier est constitué par des femmes qui habitent le même quartier et  elles font comme activité le commerce et la couture.
Maguette debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 filles. 
Elle envisage d'acheter avec le prêt 4 moutons à 35000f l'un de l'aliment pour les nourrir un sac de 50 kg à 17500f. Une fois bien engraissés elle compte revendre un mouton à 50000f. En activité parallèle elle va acheter 10draps à raison de 10000f l'un pour le revendre à 15000f.
Les bénéfices lui servent à renforcer son épargne et aider son mari dans la gestion du foyer: achat de médicament pour les enfants en cas de maladie, renforcer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en: This group of 42 women are part of the village bank that was created on 31 july 2013, which is composed of women living in the same neighborhood, all of whom are involved in commerce and sewing. Maguette (seen standing to the right of the photo, with her hand raised) is 41 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children, including 4 girls. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase 4 sheep at 35 000 f each and a 50 kg bag of feed for 17 500 f. Once they have been properly fed and grown, she hopes to seel each sheep for 50 000 f. In parallel, she will also purchase 10 sheets for 10 000 f that she will resell for 15 000 f each. She will use the profits to reinforce her savings and suppor ther husband in taking care of household expenses such as purchasing medication for the children when they are sick, and other daily expenses.

loans.use: purchase sheep and sheets

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: MATY est une femme qui est mariée et mère de famille. Elle n’a pas de parents bénéficiaires dans l’institution. Elle habite dans un quartier non loin du guichet. Elle est à son 3ème crédit et demande ce dernier pour acheter et vendre des fleurs artisanales. Elle a comme charges particulières les frais médicaux de sa famille, pour les autres dépenses quotidiennes, c’est son  mari qui s’en charge. Elle a une expérience de 3 ans dans cette activité. MATY démarre sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 17h. Elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille grâce à l’augmentation de ses revenus. Elle souhaite aussi avoir un magasin de produits cosmétique pour diversifier ses produits et tout ca elle ne peut l’avoir que grâce à l’aide de l’institution.
texts.en: MATY is a married woman and the mother of a family. Her parents are not beneficiaries of the lending institution. She lives in a neighborhood that is near the desk. She is asking for her third loan, in order to purchase and sell artisanal flowers. Her expenses include her family's medical fees. Her husband takes care of other daily living expenses. She has been exercising this activity for the past 3 years, beginning at 9 am and ending it at 5 pm. She hopes to improve the living conditions of her family thanks to her business. She also hopes to open a stand to begin selling cosmetics in order to diversify the products she sells. None of this would be possible without the help of UIMCEC.

loans.use: purchase artisanal flowers to resell to customers

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 39 years old and a single mother of one child. She rears livestock, and also grows cash to sell; she has been in this business for 10 years. She also supports three people in her family.

She will use this loan to buy a dairy cow. She will use the anticipated profits to service her loan, as well as buy another dairy cow.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she has paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to built rental houses.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, Channy is aged 32 years and married. She has three children. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 13 years, Channy is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Channy is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy chickens to raise in order to earn additional income for her family. She hopes to fatten her chickens so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Peugeot

texts.en:
Peugeot is 32 years old, and married with one child. He is living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Peugeot has been in the teaching profession for three years, and this has helped him to get new ideas and admiration to have his own home. 

Peugeot bought land using his personal savings, and now is requesting a loan to buy cement and bricks to start construction.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks to start construction

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is 57 years old, and married with six children; they are living in Kasese, Uganda. Emmy is a public servant, and has been in service for 30 years. He also practices farming for additional income and food security. Emmy likes being a leader; that's why he joined the service. Emmy has a dream of educating his children. 

He appreciates the loan given to him, since he managed to pay school fees for his children and three children are now graduates. 

Emmy is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 41 years old; she is married with two children between the ages of 10 and 16; two of them go to school. She has been farming for 21 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for potatoes.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa une femme de 36ans a pour mari un brodeur avec 04 enfants en charge.L'ainé a 21ans et le dernier 6ans. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des articles de mercerie(tissus, popelines,boutons...) et se fait aider par 02 personnes. Elle espère avoir à l'avenir une grande boutique et assurer l'avenir des enfants.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 36-year-old woman. Her husband is an embroiderer and the couple are raising 4 children, the eldest of whom is 21 and the youngest, 6. Akossiwa sells haberdashery items (fabrics including poplin, buttons, etc.) and has two people helping her. She hopes in the future to own a large shop and to ensure a good future for her children.

loans.use: to buy buttons, poplin and other fabrics.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry (shown in photo) has been married for almost 30 years and has seven children; two sons and five daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home, two are garment factory workers, two others attend school, and another one is still young. 

Ry and her husband are rice and lotus farmers. In addition, her husband is also a fisherman when he is free.

Anyway, Ry wants to generate income to better support her standard of living. That’s why she decided to apply for a loan in order to buy a cow to raise. She will be able to earn income from selling the cow for beef when it is fully grown, or a calf when the cow gives birth. 

Ry’s family is living in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ayawo

texts.fr: Ayawo âgé de 36ans vit avec son épouse et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Deux d'entre eux âgés de 11 et 9ans sont scolarisés. Il est menuisier de profession et après son apprentissage a ouvert un atelier en 1998. Il désire acheter plus de bois afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients c'est pour cela, il demande un premier crédit à WAGES. Ayawo veut donner une bonne vision à son atelier et subvenir aux mieux au besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Ayawo is 36 years old and lives with his wife and their 3 children in Lomé. Two of the children, aged 11 and 9, attend school. Ayawo is a carpenter and opened a workshop in 1998 after completing his apprenticeship. He would like to buy more wood and other materials so that he can satisfy his customer demand, which is why he is requesting his first loan from WAGES. Ayawo would like to ensure his business' future and to do his best to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (wood, nails, glue).

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 49 years old, and married with four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop of general merchandise, and also runs a bar as additional income. 

Francis is very thankful to Kiva for the support they have given him when he has managed to start a retail shop out of the loan which was given to him. 

Francis is requesting money to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour and other general merchandise

loans.name: Consolee

texts.en:
Consolee aged 25 years; she is married with two children, ages 2 and 5. One of them goes to school. She has been farming for 10 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to improve her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for potatoes.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 35 years old, married to Joyce, and they don't have a child yet. He runs a barber shop in Nakuru town, and has been in the business for eight years.

He will be using this loan to buy more shaving machines for use in his business. This will enable him to serve more customers and thereby make more income, which he will use to expand his wife's cereal shop by buying more stock of cereals.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In the future he hopes to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy shaving machines.

loans.name: Fortunee

texts.en:
Fortunee is 49 years old; she is married with four children between the ages of 4 and 25. Two of them go to school. She has been farming for 20 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to buy a new house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for potatoes.

loans.name: Comnab

texts.en:
Comnab (shown in photo) is 20 years old, single, and lives with his family. He is a student and has been working as a waiter in a shop for one year.

Comnab lives on an island in the Mekong River, around 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Now he is in his second year at Royal University of Phnom Penh, majoring in history. He would like to apply for a loan to for pay his school fees.

He knows that being a waiter gives him experience that doesn’t relate to future work, but he can earn some money for living.

He will graduate in 2016. He strongly hopes that he will become a professional teacher in history.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 57-year-old woman married to Michael, who adds additional income to support the welfare of their family. They are blessed with three children.  Rose has been operating a cereals stall business for a period of 10 years, earning an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.  

Rose was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer, and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 30,000.  She intends to use this amount to buy maize and beans to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Rose plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children, and hopes to open an additional cereals store in her hometown.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans

loans.name: Safaou

texts.fr: Mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés, Safaou a pour mari un maçon. Elle est revendeuse de couches et divers au marché depuis 2006. Pour renforcer son activité, Safaou sollicite un quatrième prêt pour acheter des couches pour bébé. Elle souhaite avoir d'autres points de vente et assurer l’éducation de la famille. Madame Safaou est âgée de 36ans.
texts.en: Safaou is the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom attend school, and her husband is a builder. She has been selling nappies and other items at the market since 2006. Safaou is requesting a 4th loan in order to buy more nappies and strengthen her business. She would like to have other selling locations and to ensure her family's education. Safaou is 36 years old.

loans.use: to buy nappies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children. She does poultry farming, and it has been profitable for the last 15 years she has been in the business. Her spouse also provides additional income.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she will use the loan to buy poultry feed. She will use the anticipated profits to service the loan.

Her future hopes are to be successful and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 19 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 31 juillet 2013 et qui regroupe des membres qui sont très solidaires et qui vivent dans une bonne entente. Leur activité principale c'est le commerce.
Absatou debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 27 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont une fille.
Avec le prêt elle envisage de faire du commerce, elle va acheter des habits prêt à porter pour enfants et bébés.Pur une valeur de 50000f elle compte avoir une bénéfices de 10000f.
Ces bénéfices sont réinvestit dans son activité, et lui permettent aussi de renforcer son épargne et de verser ses intérêts.
texts.en:
This group of 19 women is part of the "banc villageois" created on the 31st of July, 2013. It groups together people with a strong sense of solidarity and who all get along well. Their main activity is retail.

Absatou, standing on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is 27 years old. She is married and the mother of 5 children, one of whom is a girl. She plans to use her loan for her business, to buy ready-to-wear clothing for children and babies. She expects to make 10 000 francs profit from a 50 000 franc investment. This profit will be reinvested in her business and will also enable her to build her savings and to make her interest payments.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de huit membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 04 juin 2011. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et les environs. Les membres vivent dans  la bonne entente et sont solidaires. Leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l’embouche.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 garçons. Elle fait comme activité le commerce d'huile. Elle fait cette activité depuis bien longtemps et s'en sort parfaitement bien.
Elle achète de l'arachide qu'elle transforme elle même. S'il n'y en a plus comme en cette période, elle achète des bidons d'huile qu'elle revend au détail. Elle achète le bidon d'huile de 20 litres à 15500 F et revend à 850 F le litre. Elle refait ce processus à chaque fois que son stock s'écoule. Elle travaille en collaboration avec son mari et ses enfants.
Avec les bénéfices, elle renforce son épargne, assure son quotidien et pourvoit à ses besoins propres.
texts.en:
This group of 8 people is part of the "banc villageois" created on the 4th of June, 2011. It is made up of people who live in the same village and the surrounding area. The members all get along well and have a good sense of solidarity. Their main activities are retail and livestock-fattening.

Fatou, standing on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is 50 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children, 3 of whom are boys. She sells oil. She has been doing this work for a long time and she does it well. She buys groundnuts from which she makes the oil. If there are no groundnuts available, she buys cans of oil which she resells to retail customers. She buys 20-litre cans of oil for 15 500 francs and resells the oil at 850 francs per litre. When her stock runs out, she goes through the same process again. She works with her husband and children. She uses the profits to build up her savings and to take care of her family's daily needs as well as her own.

loans.use: to produce groundnut oil.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru:
Шарофат живет в маленьком районе Файзабад. Она работает лаборанткой в Санитарно-эпидемиологическом центре в течение 6 лет. Ей 61 год. Она мать двоих сыновей. Им по 33 и 24 года. Ее сыновья работают в России. 
Целью запрашиваемого кредита Шарофат является ремонт дома. Она хочет создать хорошие условия для житья. Ваша поддержка ей очень необходима.
texts.en: Sharofat lives in the small Fayzabad region. She has worked as a laboratory assistant at the Sanitation and Epidemiological Center for six years. She is 61 years old and has two sons, ages 24 and 33, who work in Russia. Sharofat is requesting a loan for home repairs to create good living conditions. Your support is very much needed.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Nhong's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampot province, Nhong is 45 years old and a mother of four children, two of whom are in school. 

She earns income for her family through cropping rice and raising cows and pigs to earn more income. With this business, she can earn about 16,600 KHR per day.
 
This is the first loan for Nhong with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that this latrine can give her family a healthier life.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 36 years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with one child. He sells clothes and has been in the business for 10 years.

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of clothes such as jackets, trousers and blouses for selling. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Fifty-three-year-old Editha is a resident of Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married and has two children, ages 17 and 20. 

Editha has a sari-sari (variety store) where she sell basic household needs like noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, seasonings, toiletries and rice. This business has existed for five years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, chips, canned goods, noodles, toiletries and seasonings. Editha hopes that with additional capital, she can continue making a better profit out of her business.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and aims to increase her business profitability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, canned goods, noodles, toiletries and seasonings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his school fee to study vocational training.

loans.name: Risper

texts.en:
Risper is a 61-year-old widow who has been blessed with six children.

She and has been operating a fish-selling business alongside a vegetable stall as a secondary business for a period of ten years. She earns an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Risper was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 30,000. She intends to use this amount to open an additional fish-selling stall and hopes to have a bright future with a successful lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy an additional fishes, green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Youn's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Kampot province, Youn is 61 years old and a mother of seven children. To struggle for her living, she grows rice and raises pigs as her main sources of income. Moreover, her husband can earn additional income by working for others for a fee to support her family’s needs. She can earn about 18,500 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day.

This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she repaid her past loans completely. In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions for good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

loans.name: Hebron Group

texts.en:
Chiinsawmkim, the featured borrower of the group, is a hardworking homemaker who devotes her time for the well being of her family. She is pictured with her hand raised with the other group members. 

Her husband serves in the army regiment and sustains his family from his salary while she looks after the household. “Taking care of the children all alone is not easy,” she said. She needs to be brave and have courage while her husband is away most of the time. They support their children by giving them the best education in their best capability. Their eldest son goes to college while the other two are still in high school. She manages the household economic activities tightly with the money her husband sends her. She spends her time in the evening with her children in their study and looks after them whether they are learning their lessons or not. 

There are times that they experience power cuts in the area that disturb the study hours of the children. She notice this quite often and said that it disrupts the academic performance of the children, which led her to access the Kiva 45-watts solar home lighting system loan that can illuminate up to four bulbs for 12 hours a day. Since it has a 90-metre wire, it can be installed anywhere as per the user’s convenience. 

Solar home lights are eco-friendly and the best way to safeguard the children from damaging their eyesight as they usually study after dusk using candles or lamps. She believes that it will provide a better study environment for the children and protect their eyesight from damage. 

The rest of the group members wanted to purchase 45-watt solar home lighting system for their families and business activities.

loans.use: To buy mini solar home lighting so that her children could study for longer hours with better eyesight after sunset.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old and married. Together with his spouse he has been blessed with one child. 

He is a farmer in Nyahururu town and has been in the business for five years now.

He will use this loan to buy a dairy cow and thereby get more milk for supply. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. His future hopes are to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.en:
Jean Paul, age 35 years, is married and has two children, age 4 and 10. Both of them go to school. 

He has been farming for 20 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for potatoes.

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.en:
The members of the 'Emmanuel' group are married members who, on average, are 40 years old and have three children. They all live in the same area. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution ID-Ghana in order to better their businesses' condition. 

They are on their third loan and intend to repay it promptly. They are into wood, eggs, slippers, and silver businesses. 

Christian is 51 years old, married and has one child. He plans to buy wood to sell to customers. He sells his products daily for cash at his area to a mixed group of customers. He hopes to earn a good monthly profit, which will be used to pay back [his part of] the loan and to also help his wife in taking care of their child. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy wood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 40, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampot province. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in university, and the other two are in school. 

To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice on five hectares as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via raising pigs and cows. She has been involved in her business for ages, and she can earn income of about $4 USD per day. 

For Touch, this is not her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay school fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in accounting. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in accounting.

loans.name: Anastasiya

texts.ru:
Анастасия замужем. У нее есть 11-летняя дочь. Анастасия имеет свой бизнес.


Анастасия занимается тепличным хозяйством на протяжении 15 лет. Она выращивает ранние и поздние овощи: помидоры и огурцы. Анастасия целеустремленная и трудолюбивая. В будущем планирует расширять хозяйство и строить новую теплицу.

Предыдущий кредит помог ей построить теплицы и получить хорошую прибыль во время сельскохозйяственного сезона. В этот раз Анастасия просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на установку отопления для трех теплиц. Кредит поможет ей увеличить доход. Анастасия потратит дополнительную прибыль на развитие бизнеса и нужды семьи.
texts.en:
Anastasiya is married and has an 11-year old daughter. Anastasiya has her own business. She has been in greenhouse farming for 15 years. She grows  spring and winter vegetables: tomatoes and cucumbers. Anastasiya is goal-oriented and hard-working. In the future she plans to expand her farm and build a new greenhouse.

The previous loan has helped her to build greenhouses and earn a good revenue during the agricultural season. This time Anastasiya is applying for a loan in the amount of 40,000 UAH in order to install heating in three greenhouses. This loan will allow her to increase her revenue, which she will use for business development and her family needs.

loans.use: to set up a heating system in three greenhouses.

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en:
Zaldy is a 39-year-old married man from Ajuy, Iloilo. He is a fisherman and catches crab for a living. This has been his livelihood for eight years now and brings an income of 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month, but his income is barely enough for his three children, ages 6, 8 and 9. 

He is asking for a loan to buy bamboo and a hull for his boat. He is determined to make his business profitable so he can continue to support his family, especially the schooling of his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and see his kids successful.

loans.use: to buy bamboo and a hull for his boat

loans.name: Sahak

texts.en:
Sahak is happy for his chance to cooperate with Kiva for the second time since his first deal greatly helped him to organize his farm’s hay-mowing activities and he also bought new cultivating blades. 

Sahak lives in the village Geghamavan, which is in the Gegharkunik region. His wife and daughter still work at the local school and his son is a student of Yerevan State Pedagogical University in the Department of Philology. Sahak is happy with his farming activities, where he takes care of cows, bulls, heifers, piglets, sheep, horses and chickens. His farm products -- milk, cheese, meat and eggs -- bring the main income for his family. 

Sahak, like any farmer, is already impatient to store a lot of fodder for his farm cattle, which must be enough till the spring. This loan in an amount of 320,000 Armenian drams he asks in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle, which he will keep with his gathered hay for coming cold winter months.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
This is Violeta, 57, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Aniceto and they have only one child who is in high school. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income to meet her family’s daily personal and household needs.

Violeta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying  supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy sacks of rice, beverages, canned goods, coffee and other grocery items to expand her product inventory. This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Violeta aims to grow her business to give her family a better life. She wants to send her child to college to get the best education. She prays for her family to stay happy and strong in the Lord. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41 years old and from the town of Ajuy, in Iloilo. She is married with three children. Her eldest is 24 and the youngest is 4. To provide for them, she has been into a fishing business for a year now. Her husband, on the other hand, works as a carpenter to provide for the family. 

Elizabeth wishes to make her business successful. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and piglets so she can also raise hogs.

The loan will give her hope and provide expansion for her business. Any income generated will be for food, reinvestment in the same business and schooling for her child.

In the future, she hopes to make her business more profitable and reliable for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and piglets

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is 32 years old, and she lives in Ijevan city of the Tavush region. She is married and she has a daughter and a son. Her husband works at a private company; he works as a distributor. 

Arevik is also employed. She has no higher education, but she is doing well in her clothes trading business.  

Arevik says that she is usually a very active and laborious person, and together with her work, she perfectly manages to take care of her family, but the weakness and unhealthiness that she feels lately worries her a lot, since it is a very unfamiliar feeling and state for her.
 
She asks for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams since she decided to have a medical examination to find out the reason for feeling unusual and tired, with great hope that there will be nothing serious.

loans.use: to have a medical examination and find out the reason for feeling unusual and tired

loans.name: Soviet's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampot province, Soviet is 36 years old and a mother of three children. 

To support her living, she grows rice as her main source of income and raises cows and pigs to supplement her income. She can earn about 16,600 KHR per day. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three members and she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine.

She hopes that she can give her family a healthier life.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Kai's Group

texts.en:
A farmer from Kompot province, Kai is 52 years old and a father of three children. 

He earns income to support his family via rice cropping and raising cows and pigs. He has been involved in his business for ages, earning him about 13,600 KHR per day.

For Kai, this is his first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, he is a group leader. He will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. Kai hopes that he can update his lifestyle and live in good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Badingda

texts.fr: madame Badingda a 56ans. Elle revend des cahiers de graphismes dans une école et sollicite un septième prêt pour acheter des marchandises. Son activité basée à SOKODE(une ville de Lomé) lui permet de se prendre et de renforcer son activité. Elle a démarré en 2005.
texts.en: Badingda is 56 years old. She resells graphics schoolbooks in a school and is requesting a 7th loan in order to buy more merchandise. Her business, based in Sokode (a town in Lomé), allows her to be self-sufficient and to earn money to reinvest in her business, which she started in 2005.

loans.use: to buy schoolbooks.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma es madre soltera, ella vive con sus padres y  su hijo de 13 años de edad que esta estudiando y que por cierto le gusta mucho asistir a la escuela, Norma se dedica a la crianza de chanchos desde hace un año y que le va bien en este negocio, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para criarlos en un lotecito que le presta su padre para que crie sus chanchos, la mas grande aspiración de Norma es comprar mas chanchitos y de esta manera su negocio sea mas rentable para darle lo  que su hijo necesite para que siga estudiando.
texts.en:
Norma is a single mother. She lives with her parents and her 13-year-old son, who loves to go to school. Norma has been raising pigs for a year and is doing very well.

Norma will use this loan to buy pigs to fatten. She will do this in a piece of land that belongs to her father. Her biggest goal is to buy more pigs in order to have a more profitable business and give her son everything he needs to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Saman

texts.en:
Saman is 35 years old. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and the other one is still young. Her husband is a driver, he drives for a company. She is hired by her villagers to farm and gets paid with fees. 

She needs to buy wood to repair her house and she needs to fill the land because her land is covered by water after rain or floods.

Saman hopes that she will have a new house after the repairs, so she would like to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To fill the land around her house and purchase wood for repairs.

loans.name: Bhoomika

texts.en:
Bhoomika is a sincere, honest and hardworking woman pictured with her mother. She is 22 years old and from Imphal. She says that her ambitious quality let her reach this profession. After graduation, she was in search of a job and was among the selected list of cabin crew. This achievement made her very happy. She embraces loyalty and will work loyally until she reaches her goal. 

She lives with her mother and brother. After her father passed away, their family's financial condition was in turmoil. Her mother's income could hardly manage for their household expenses, and she was in urgent need of job so that she could lend financial help in the household. She considers her late father a very honest person with high moral principles and a man of dignity. She misses him every day and hopes to meet him and reunite with him again someday in heaven. 

“My mother is a great person and also my best friend,” she said. Her mother has been playing a great role in bringing her up with love and care. A mother’s role in one’s life is priceless. “My childhood memories were indeed bright and cheerful because of the love and support of my family,” she said. 

Bhoomika cherishes her family.

Now that she catches the opportunity to work as a cabin crew, she hopes to earn a fair amount to pay for her expenses and become self-reliant. With the Kiva loan, she will be able to pay the security deposit without any financial distress. It was her dream to become an air hostess and take it as an opportunity to explore, serve and interact with people from across the globe. She feels overjoyed to be in this profession. “I feel relieved! Happy and excited!” she exclaimed.

This loan will help her family overcome financial instability. She and her family are deeply thankful toward WSDS in helping them to avail themselves of the loan. She said, “I will forever remember this great help showered by WSDS upon me. Thank you once again WSDS and Kiva.”

loans.use: To pay the security deposit fee for cabin crew training as an air hostess.

loans.name: Maria Marcelina

texts.es: María de 61 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos ya mayores de edad los que dan un aporte económico a su hogar. Ella es una mujer luchadora que después de perder a su esposo se propuso sacar adelante a sus hijos tratando de darles lo mejor apoyada en su venta de productos de limpieza y elaboración y venta de quesos y cremas las cuales realiza desde hace mucho tiempo. María desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y es por ello que desea construir un corredor con pasamano en su vivienda, ya que anteriormente obtuvo un crédito con FUSAI el cual le permitió construir su baño sanitario en su vivienda, actualmente desea adquirir un nuevo crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro, lámina y polines para construir un corredor con pasamano en su vivienda.
texts.en:
María, 61, lives in a house of her own together with her three children, who help her with the home expenses. She is a hardworking woman who decided to get ahead with her children after her husband died, and try to give them everything they needed by selling cleaning products, cheese and ice creams. She has been doing this for a long time.

María wants to improve her family’s living conditions, which is why she wants to build a veranda and a banister at home. She received a loan from FUSAI before and used it to build a bathroom. She is now requesting a new one to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron bars, metal sheets and beams to build a veranda and a banister at home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron bars, metal sheets and beams to build a veranda and a banister at home.

loans.name: Tadjou

texts.fr: Homme de 38ans, et père de famille, mr Tadjou pour aider sa famille à mieux s'épanouir il a démarré la vente des chaussures, sacs et autres produits au marché. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite un sixième prêt pour acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients. Il espère ouvrir une grande boutique afin d'installer les produits et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Tadjou is 38 years old and a father. In order to help his family's development, he started a business selling shoes, bags and other items at the market. He is requesting a 6th loan in order to buy more merchandise so that he can satisfy his customer demand. He hopes to open a large shop in which to sell his products, and to fulfill his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy shoes, bags, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, nylon, and fishing weights

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 30 years old, married, and one child who attends school. She is a resident of Coron, Palawan,  Philippines. Maribeth manages her household while operating her business.  She works hard to continually provide income to meet her family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Maribeth operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages, piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by buying  supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her general store has the complete items that a Filipino household usually needs everyday so people come to her store.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales Maribeth is requesting a loan for 32,000 PHP, which which she will use to buy groceries such as rice, biscuits, cooking oil, canned goods, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.  This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business.  Her earnings from her store will help greatly in providing for her family's daily needs and for the school needs of her child.
 
Maribeth aims to expand her business so she can give her family a better life.  She wants to send her child to college and get the best education for her. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio un audaz campesino dedicado de lleno al mundo del campo el cual fue heredado por sus padres, se levanta desde tempranas horas de la madrugada hasta que se oculta el sol. 
Es un hombre de 50 años veterano que solo quiere servirle a su comunidad con sus cultivos sanos, quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar insumos como abonos, riegos y algunos exterminadores de plagas, su razón es que estos insumos tienen un alto costo y no dispone de capital para darle el adecuado mantenimiento a sus cultivos.
Su sueño es seguir ejerciendo su profesión, tener salud y suerte para seguir prosperando con el tiempo
texts.en: Julio is a bold farmer dedicated to the world of the land which he inherited from his parents. He gets up very early in the morning and works until the sun sets. He is a 50 year old veteran who only wants to serve his community with his healthy crops. He wants to request a loan to buy inputs like manure, irrigation and some pest controls. His reason is that these inputs have a high cost and he doesn't have the capital to provide proper maintenance for his crops. His dream is to continue to exercise his profession, enjoy good health and luck to continue to prosper over time.

loans.use: to buy inputs like manure, irrigation and pest control for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: make cement construction blocks.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 43 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 2 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que cada día lucha por mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y es por ello que desde hace más de 15 años se instalo un taller de mecánica automotriz en su vivienda y es gracias a este negocio que ha logrado cancelar el crédito adquirido anteriormente para terminar de construir las paredes de su vivienda, por lo cual se siente muy agradecido con la institución. Carlos desea construir otra pared en su vivienda y colocar 2 puertas y 2 ventanas por lo que al haber obtenido buenos resultados con el crédito anterior ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro, 2 puertas y 2 ventanas para construir una pared e instalar 2 puertas y 2 ventanas en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is 43 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion and his two children, aged 16 and 2 years old. He is a hard-working man who every day strives to improve the living conditions of his family. For this reason he opened a car repair shop at his house 15 years ago. It is thanks to this business that he has managed to pay off his last loan to complete the construction of the walls of his house. He feels very grateful to the institution for this support. 

Carlos want to construct another wall on his house and install two doors and two windows. As he had good results with the last loan he decided to request another loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, two doors and two windows to construct a wall and install the doors and windows on his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, 2 doors and 2 windows for his house.
