loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a kitchen and bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start her own business selling clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new engine for his business truck.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 57 years old, married, and has four children. She operates a butchery business and also sells livestock, which she has been doing for 10 years.  

Peninah requested her third loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy more stock of livestock to sell as well as more meat to sell in her butchery. She will use the anticipated profits to build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and meat

loans.name: Freedom 2 Group

texts.en:
These women are part of the group called Freedom 2 from the Teshie district of the city of Accra. They know each other well and live in large traditional families along with their husbands, children and other relatives. They are on average 46 years old and have at least two children. 

The women in this group are retail merchants who sell various items such as: kenkey (cooked corn paste), fish, detergent, powder, cosmetics, biscuits and toffees. To increase the size of their business, the members decided to join the ID-Ghana loan program. They are on their seventh loan cycle. 

Elizabeth, standing second from the right in the photo, is a member of the Freedom 2 group who sells soap, powder and other detergents. She intends to use her loan to buy more soap, powder and other detergents to sell to customers. She will buy from the market and sell in Teshie to her customers. 

The members of the Freedom 2 group expect good profits from their different businesses in this loan cycle. In addition to repaying the loans, they use some of the income to meet personal expenses and increase their business. They want to strengthen this partnership with ID-Ghana to maintain adequate stock supplies.

loans.use: To buy more soap, powder and other detergents to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new gate for her house.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman who is blessed with four children all of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwanamisi operates a tailoring business, making women’s attire for sale at home. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other tailoring operators to be her major challenge. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Pavel

texts.ru:
Павел женат. У него двое детей. Павел имеет свой бизнес. 

Павел занимается фермерством на протяжении 16 лет. Он выращивает ранние и поздние овощи в теплицах. Павел целеустремленный и трудолюбивый. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес дальше, т.к. это единственный источник дохода в семье.

Павел просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 40 000 гривен на постройку новых теплиц c системой парового отопления. Это поможет Павлу получать более ранний урожай, значит продавать свой товар по более высокой цене. 
Павел надеется получить хорошую прибыль и потратить ее на нужны своей сеьми - питание, одежда, улучшение жилищный условий.
texts.en:
Pavel is married and has two children. He has his own business. Pavel has been involved in farming for 16 years. He grows early and late season vegetables in greenhouses. Pavel is goal-oriented and hardworking. He wants to continue growing his business because it provides the sole source of income for his family.

Pavel is requesting a loan in the amount of 40 000 hryvnia to build new greenhouses with a steam heating system. This will help Pavel obtain an earlier harvest, leading to an ability to sell his product at a higher price. Pavel hopes to earn a good profit and spend it on the family needs - food, clothing and improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to build new greenhouses with a steam heating system

loans.name: Hadare De Guille Group

texts.fr:
Mr Hadaré est le représentant du groupe HADARE DE GUILLE. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 04 enfants, le plus âgé a 10 ans et le moins âgé a 2ans½. 02 vont à l’école. Il a 04 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est  agriculteur depuis 07 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les  provinces. Ses clients sont les commerçants son quartier.
Il  veut s’acheter 05 boites d’oignons, 01 boites de semence de tomates, 02 boites de semences de poivres.
Mr Hadaré veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité et aider a la scolarisation de ses enfants. Il ambitionne être un grand jardinier.
texts.en:
Mr. Hadaré is the representative of the Hadare de Guille group. He is doing very well. He is married and the father of four children ranging from 2.5 to 10 years of age. Two of his children attend school. He has four dependents. 

Mr. Hadaré has been working as a farmer for seven years. He stocks up in the provinces. His customers are the neighborhood shopkeepers. He would like to buy five boxes of onions, one box of tomato seeds and two boxes of pepper seeds. Mr. Hadaré would like to use his revenue to reinvest in his business and help with the school expenses of his children. His goal is to become a well-known vegetable grower.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of onions, one box of tomato seeds and two boxes of pepper seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Sudat

texts.en:
Sudat is 45 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has 8 children with 6 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Sudat has been working hard to manage her produce business, where she sells produce. 

To help expand her business, Sudat has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more flour, beans, millet and groundnuts for sale, and will help Sudat to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Sudat hopes that in the future she will be able to increase on her capital income. 

Sudat is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sudat who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more flour, beans, millet and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her business, which sells produce. 

To help expand the business, Juliet has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more flour, beans, millet and rice for sale. This will help Juliet to generate greater profits and take good care of her children. Juliet hopes in the future to be able to earn more profit so as to pay school fees for her children. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juliet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more flour, beans, millet and rice for sale

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es:
Jesus es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo caña de azúcar; plantas que procesa en su trapiche y posteriormente vende.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar las condiciones de la maquina que utiliza para sacar el jugo de la caña y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y pagar a un técnico para el arreglo de su máquina.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.

Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus is a campesino, a modest and hard-working man with the drive and grit that distinguishes the men and women of rural Colombia.

Jesus is a born entrepreneur and learned everything there is to know about farming and raising animals when he was just a boy.  He has his own farm now, growing sugar cane.  He also processes his crop in a mill that he owns.

Jesus wants to expand his farming operation and make improvements to his mill.  He is applying for a loan, part of which he will use to buy supplies--fertilizer, for example--and the rest to pay for repairs to the machinery he uses to process his crop.

The loan will help him to develop his business and better provide for his family.

Jesus says that the thing he wants most is to provide himself and his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and maintenance services for his farming business.

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es:
Juan un hombre con un sueño el cuales tener su propia empresa, deseo que inicio gracias a la motivación que le da su Jefe quien tiene un taller de confección y vio en el grandes dotes para que cree una empresa.

Buscando ser independiente y con el apoyo del jefe quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar una maquina Plana y así formalizar su negocio de confección aspirando a que este sea sostenible en el tiempo pues con el piensa alimentar, brindar educación a sus hijos los cuales tienen una edad de 5 y 6 años. 

Juan solo pide la ayuda se compromete a pagar cumplidamente sus cuotas pues ve en esto gran futuro, no solo tiene las ganas, tiene el apoyo de su jefe de su familia y eso es suficiente para lanzarse a una aventura que espera sea lucrativa y de mucha enseñanza para su vida.
texts.en:
Juan, a man with a dream of owning his own business, wants to give thanks for the motivation that his boss gave him who has a tailor shop and saw in him great talent to start a company.

Seeking to be independent and with the support of his boss he wants to request a loan to buy a sewing machine and therefore formalize his tailor business, aspiring to be sustainable in time with the thought of feeding and providing education to his children who are 5 and 6 years old.

Juan only asks for help, promising to dutifully make his payments as he sees in this grand future, he not only has the drive, but has the support of his boss and family and that is enough to embark on this adventure that he hopes will be lucrative and teach him a lot for his life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start his tailor business, hoping to provide the economic needs in his home.

loans.name: Humphreys

texts.en:
Humpreys is 63 years old. He is married to Mary, and together they support ten children between the ages of 12 and 28 years. Mary helps provide additional income for the family.

Humpreys has a hotel business which he has run for more than 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. Humpreys has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 20,000 which he will use to increase stock of cooking ingredients in bulk for his hotel. He will buy goods like tomatoes, onions, potatoes, meat, flour and rice.

With the anticipated profits, Humpreys will be able to increase his source of income.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to lead a prosperous life together with his family.

loans.use: to increase stock of cooking ingredients

loans.name: Diego Alveiro

texts.es:
Diego es un joven campesino, trabajador y humilde, que desde niño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. 

Esto le ha permitido progresar y, hoy en día posee un cultivo de café, actividad que realiza todos los días y las cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Montebello donde actualmente reside, adicionalmente, realiza labores de jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, pues con ello complementa los ingresos con los que vela por el bienestar de sus padres que tanto lucharon para sacarlo adelante. 

Con el apoyo del crédito comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes y otros), con esto seguirá cuidando sus cultivos y tendrá una mejor cosecha, mucho más productiva, con lo que mejorará los ingresos a la hora de vender sus productos. 

Diego, con su espíritu emprendedor, su pujanza y tenacidad, quiere seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener una finca propia, en la que pueda cultivar mucha más variedad de productos y así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, garantizando una estabilidad económica para dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is a young farmer, a hard-working and humble man who learned from an early age to work the fields thanks to the training received from his parents. This has enabled him to make progress and nowadays he has a coffee cultivation that he farms every day. The crops are sold in the market square of the Montebello municipality, where he curently lives. 

He additionally works as day laborer on various farms in the region, in this way supplementing the income to provide for the wellbeing of his parents who so struggled to get him ahead.

With the loan, he will buy agricultural inputs through bulk purchases (compost, pesticide, fertilizers and others).  He will in this way continue to take good care of the crops and he will have a better harvest, much more productive, to improve earnings when the time comes to sell his product.

Diego, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, wants to keep striving to achieve the dream of owning his own farm to grow a much greater variety of products, and so improve the profitability of the business, ensure financial stability, and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, seed, irrigation and soil preparation inputs.

loans.name: Suleyma

texts.es:
Suleyma de 28 años de edad, tiene como nivel académico 6º grado, actualmente está acompañada y tiene dos hijos los cuales están estudiando.
Suleyma se ha dedicado al comercio desde que estaba pequeña, ahorra ella tiene una tienda en una  escuela de la comunidad, esto lo aprendió por su madre quien también tenía dicho negocio. En el chalet de la escuela Suleyma vende productos alimenticios como pupusas, panes con pollo entre otros.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar productos para el chalet y lámina para mejorar el techo del mismo.
Sus planes a futuro son seguir con su negocio y mejorarlo ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos, además espera apoyar a sus hijos para que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Suleyma, 28, left school after the 6th grade.  She is partnered and has two children, both in school.  

Suleyma has made a living from small businesses since she was just a girl and now has a small food stall that she operates at a local school.  She learned the business from her mother who operated a similar business before.  She sells pupusas, sandwiches and other lunch foods.

Suleyma is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy supplies for her business and the rest to buy roofing materials for her kiosk.  The business, she says, is her main source of income and her goal is to carry on improving it.  She says, too, that she wants to ensure that her children get the best possible education.

loans.use: to support her food business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is divorced with three school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Caroline has operated a clothing sales business for the past two years. She sells in a shop to her neighbors, town dwellers, and passersby. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a single woman. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a business selling cosmetics. She sells on retail to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a food stall business out of her home, which earns her other source of livelihood. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Amina dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of cosmetics for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her metal shop.

loans.name: Turinimana

texts.en:
Turinimana is 31 years old. He is married, with three children aged between eight years and three months. Two of them go to school. 

He has a shop and has been running in a business for the past two years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar, salt, soap, and rice to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: COUMBA est une promotrice qui évolue dans le commerce des tissus. Elle est une habituée du guichet et est à son 7ème prêt. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20 ans dans cette activité. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont le plus grand à 25 ans et les plus petits 5 ans. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des charges quotidiennes de sa famille.  Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h. Elle voulait agrandir son volume de vente et augmenter son stock de marchandises et diversifier ses produits.  Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
COUMBA is a developer in the commerce of fabrics. She is a regular client of the branch office and is now on her seventh loan. She has over twenty years of experience in this business. She is a married mother of seven children, of whom the oldest is 25, and the youngest ones are 5. 

COUMBA helps out her husband in managing the everyday family expenses. Her day starts at 8 AM and ends at 5 PM. She would like to expand her sales volume, increase her stock of merchandise, and diversify her products. Thus, she will be able to grow her revenues and improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to resell

loans.name: El Hadji Hamady

texts.fr: El Hadji Hamady est un homme qui habite à quelques kilomètres du guichet. Il est marié et père de famille. Il évolue dans le transport, il a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce secteur. Et demande ce crédit pour acheter un moteur enfin de pouvoir réfectionner son taxi. Il a comme charges toutes les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de même que les frais médicaux de ses enfants. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 19h. A l’avenir, il souhaite augmenter son parc automobile et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi il pourra diversifier ses activités et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: El Hadji Hamady is a man who lives a few kilometers from the branch office. He is married and the father of a family. He works in transportation and has over ten years of experience in this sector. He is asking for this loan to purchase a motor to be able to refurbish his taxi. His expenses include all the day-to-day expenses of his family and his children’s schooling costs, even their medical expenses. Hamady’s days starts at 8 AM and ends at 7 PM. For the future, he would like to expand his fleet of vehicles and increase his revenues. Thus, he will be able to diversify his business and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a motor to refurbish his taxi

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 50 years old, married with three children, and lives in Kasese, Uganda. Francis is a gardener and has been in that service for three years.

Francis has managed to acquire land from his own personal savings. At his old age, he says, he is tired of rent. He is working hard to build his family a house. Francis wants money to buy sand, cement and bricks to build his family a house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks for construction of a family home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mobile phones and replacement parts

loans.name: Angelica Del Carmen

texts.es: Angélica de 57 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 20 años de edad. Ella es una mujer admirable que siempre se esmera en mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y es por ello que se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir y vendiendo diversidad de artículos de belleza por catalogo. Angélica anteriormente solicitó un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio de productos de belleza, pero ahora desea comprar una maquina industrial que le permita también mejorar la elaboración de prendas de vestir y obtener así mejores condiciones de vida, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una maquina industrial, compra de equipo y productos de belleza.
texts.en: Angélica, 57, lives with her husband and 20-year old son.  She cares greatly for her family and is always on the look-out for ways to better provide for them.  She operates small businesses making and selling clothing and reselling beauty products.  Angélica used a past FUSAI loan to stock her beauty products sales business and is applying for a new loan, part of which she will use to buy a sewing machine to make clothes for sale and the rest to buy beauty products for resale.  The investments will allow her to carry on the businesses and go on supporting her family.

loans.use: to support her two retail businesses.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 22-year-old hardworking single man who has been operating a transportation business for a period of two years. He earns an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

James was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000. He intends to use this amount to buy an additional motorcycle, and add to his personal savings.

James plans to use the anticipated income to buy a land and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy an additional motorcycle.

loans.name: Amarelys

texts.es: A Amarelys el hecho de que todos comemos porque es una necesidad básica que no espera el tener dinero para satisfacerla, fue la idea  que la llevó a emprender un negocio de elaboración y venta de comidas especialmente de almuerzos. Esto ocurrió en Febrero de hace 2 años, aprovechando su gran aptitud para la cocina, pues siempre le ha gustado cocinar y y puso al servicio de la comunidad su talento. Anteriormente lo tenia en otro barrio y cuando se mudó donde su suegra, junto a su esposo emprendieron en ese barrio un negocio de restaurante donde vende sancochos, comidas rápidas chichas, refrescos y bebidas. Su meta es tener mas adelante su propia vivienda y mejorar las condones del restaurante ampliándolo para aumentar la potencialidad de clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamieto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mesas, manteles, refrescos y bebidas además de silletería y dulces. Con esta inversión la capacidad de producción mejorará y con ello el volumen de sus ventas que cada vez mas se han ido incrementando y  sus clientes muchas veces no pueden satisfacer su necesidad de consumo de almuerzos,  porque la infraestructura no alcanza a responderles, teniendo que irse a otros lugares si el servicio.
texts.en:
For Amarelys the fact that we all eat as it is a basic necessity which need to be filled whether we have money or not. This was the idea that led her to start her business of making and selling meals, especially lunches. This happened in February of two years ago, taking advantage of her strong aptitude for cooking. She has always liked to cook and she opened this talent to the public as a service.

Previously she had a food service in another neighborhood and when she moved in to her mother-in-law's she started a restaurant business with her husband in this neighborhood selling sancocho (a traditional soup), small fast foods, sort drinks and other drinks. Her goal for the future is to have her own house and to improve the conditions of her restaurant expanding it to increase the potential amount of clients.

Currently she is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first loan she has had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy tables, tablecloths, soft drinks and other drinks, as well as seats and candies. With this investment her capacity of production will improve as will the volume of her sales which have been increasing steadily. She cannot always fulfill all the demand from her clients for lunches as her infrastructure is not big enough to serve them. So they have to go somewhere else for lunch.

loans.use: tables, tablecloths, soft drinks and other drinks as well as seating and candies.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is 24 years old. He is not married. He is a motorcyclist and has been working for the past two years. With the loan, he would like to buy spare parts in order to repair his motorcycle. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice, beans, and palm oil to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Ingabire

texts.en: Ingabire is 33 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 13 years and 12 months; 4 of them go to school. She sells vegetables and has been selling in a business for the past 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more vegetables to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yagurukundo Group

texts.fr:
Emmanuel  fait partie du groupe  Yagurukundo et  habite à  Bubanza. Il a 34 ans et est marié à Violette ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 13 ans,dont 3 étudient.
 

Il fait le commerce du  riz et du haricot  depuis  3 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz et de haricot à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  avoir une grande boutique des habits  et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is part of the group Yagurukundo and lives in Bubanza. He is 34 years old and married to Violette, a farmer. Together they have five children, from 2 to 13 years old, of whom three are students.

Emmanuel has been doing commerce in rice and beans for three years. 

He is on his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and to purchase a large amount of rice and beans to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to have a large clothing shop and to see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of rice and beans to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Sylevan

texts.en:
Sylevan is a 38-year-old married Ugandan. They have five children, aged 16, 13, 10, 7, and 4. He is hardworking and honest according to the community members.

He is a produce dealer, and he has been selling maize, cassava and beans in a local trading center since 2010. He has applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000, and will be able to buy corn and beans cheaply. Since it is now the season, he can make more profits.

His plan for the future is to buy a vehicle to assist him in transportation of his produce to the market centre and from farmers. However, he faces challenges of poor weather and bad roads that lead to the high cost of transport, which reduces his profits.

loans.use: To buy corn and beans for resale

loans.name: Zemstaaba Silgo Group

texts.fr:
Mr  Sambo  est le représentant du groupe ZEMSTAABA SILGO. Il se porte très bien. Marié, il est père de 15 enfants, le plus âgé a 35 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 06 vont à l’école. Il a 09 personnes en charge.
Monsieur est éleveur depuis 50 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. Ses clients sont les commerçants son quartier.
Il  veut s’acheter 02 moutons et 30 poules.
Mr Sambo  veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour la scolarisation de ses enfants et améliorer son activité.
texts.en:
Mr.  Sambo is the representative of the group ZEMSTAABA SILGO. He is in good health. A married father, he has fifteen children. The oldest is 35 years old, and the youngest is 3. Six go to school. He has nine persons to support. 

Mr. Sambo has been a livestock farmer for fifty years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. His customers are merchants in his district. He wants to purchase 2 sheep and 30 hens. He wants to use his profits for his children’s education and to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sheep and 30 hens

loans.name: Gloriose

texts.en:
Gloriose, 32 years old, is married with two children who are five and nine years old. Both of them go to school. She has been farming for 13 years. With the loan form Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from farming will be used to buy more seeds.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for her maize crops

loans.name: José Mardoqueo

texts.es:
José de 55 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casado y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian en la escuela, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. 

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía doce años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseñó su padre ya que él siempre quería que sus hijos se prepararan en dicha actividad, el lugar donde trabaja le queda a una distancia de 10 minutos y viaja a pie, sus hijos se involucran y le ayudan mientras no asisten a estudiar.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar 2 litros de veneno y dos litros de foliar, también comprará un saco de abono para echarle a la milpa.

Sus sueños son que a su familia no le falte nada y que los hijos se preparen académicamente ya que él no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old and did not have the opportunity to study. He is married and has five children, 3 of whom study in school. His wife does the housework. José has worked in agriculture since he was 12 years old. He was taught this by his father as he always wanted his children to learn this trade. The place that he works is 10 minutes walk away. His children are involved in the work and help him when they are not at school.

He needs the loan to buy two liters of poison and two liters of foliar spray as well as buying a bag of fertilizer which he will apply to his corn. His dreams are that his family does not lack for anything and that his children prepare themselves academically as he never had this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy poison, foliar spray and fertilizer for his corn crops.

loans.name: Sherif

texts.en:
Sherif is a final-year student at the Wisconsin International University College and pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Management and Computer Studies. 

The loan is to help pay for his school fees. The completion of his studies would put him in a position where he can be promoted and then also broaden his knowledge on the structures in his institution. He says that "Getting higher in my career is motivation enough and it inspires me to do more".

In five or ten years time, he will have climbed higher in the organizational ladder of his institution, doing something new and challenging.

His education would have been badly affected if he was denied this loan facility, which goes to say that his efforts over the past three year period would have been in vain. He also wishes that investors knew that Ghana is democratically stable.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees for his Bachelor's degree

loans.name: Mt Elgon Group

texts.en:
Paythogras is in his late thirties and is a married father of two school-aged children. Since 2012, he has been running two businesses, selling milk (fresh and yoghurt) to cafeterias and restaurants, and secondly, a charcoal store. He works from 6am to 9am selling milk and up to 8:30pm selling charcoal. Paythogras is able to purchase and sell 2 to 3 buckets of milk per day and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is his third credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania, to be apportioned among Mt Elgon, which has three members group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.
 
He used his previous loans to buy one more bucket of milk (totalling three now) and to replenish his charcoal store. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. He is so thankful for Kiva's support and he used the returns to cover school fees, household expenses and to put back into his businesses. 

Paythogras will invest his loan to increase stocks for his businesses. He dreams to grow his businesses.

loans.use: to increase stocks for his businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food containers

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 44-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells fruit and vegetables, and at the same time works as a parish councilor, and grows food crops like carrots and onions. He faces hardships of weather vagaries and price changes. Besides that, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Stephen needs a loan to buy onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy onions to sell.

loans.name: Kabonero Mirembe Group

texts.en:
Grace is a member of the 40 members strong Kabonero Mirembe Group wherein members guarantee the others so as to access credit. She is a farmer growing crops such as tomatoes, onions, cassava, potatoes and coffee. 

Grace is facing the challenges of limited capital. However, she hopes to look after her family well and become a model farmer in her village. 

Grace needs a loan to lease a garden for planting tomatoes, onions, cassava and coffee which she will sell.

loans.use: to lease a garden for growing tomatoes, onions, cassava and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 30 year old single lady with 2 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a banana farmer and at the same time a retailer; a business she started with the hope of looking after her family well. 

She faces the challenge of limited capital but has hopes of having enough monthly income to sustain her family. Regina needs a loan to rent a kisubi (banana) plantation.

loans.use: to rent kisubi (banana) plantation.

loans.name: Denise

texts.en: Denise is 37 years old. She is married with flour children between 12 and 6 years old, all of whom go to school. She has a restaurant and has been running a business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, cassava and millet to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava and millet to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her shoe-making business.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 25 years. She is married and together with her husband they have been blessed with three children of nine, seven and four years old.

Dorothy sells fish, a business she has done for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000. She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 15,000 which she will use to purchase fish for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Dorothy will be able to improve her living standards as well as repay her loan. Her hopes and dreams to grow her business and financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Yaquelin

texts.es: Yaquelin de 49 años de edad se dedica a la venta de mercancías variadas, pues desde su matrimonio decidió apoyar a su esposo en la generación de ingresos, para lograr el desarrollo armónico  de sus hijos en las edades de 28 y 31 años. Yaquelin encontró su oportunidad de obtener dinero mediante la actividad comercial,  mientras que su esposo se dedica al desarrollo de obras civiles, siendo contratado eventualmente por empresas y cooperativas importantes de la ciudad. En la actualidad su mercadeo lo realiza mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, Yaquelin y su esposo trabajan de la mano, y el dinero lo administran conjuntamente, por eso en esta oportunidad está aplicando a un  credikiva, primer financiamiento  mediante el cual comprará mercancias como cosméticos, ropa etc y tambien invertirá en materiales constructivos, pues a su esposo  realiza su trabajo a todo costo y se queda muchas veces corto para dar respuesta efectiva, lo cual logrará superar con su credikiva. Su meta es generar mayores ingresos y que ella y su esposo logren una mayor cobertura de clientes, para mas adelante tener su propia casa y alcanzar una mayor estabilidad en sus ingresos familiares por parte de la actividad que desempeña su esposo.
texts.en:
Yaquelin, 49 years old, earns a living selling various types of merchandise.  Since marrying, she decided to support her husband in obtaining income, to achieve the proper development of their children, who are 28 and 31 years old.  Yaquelin found her opportunity to earn money through sales activity, while her husband works at developing  public works,  and has in time made contracts with important companies and cooperative groups of their city.  Currently she carries out her sales through specialized product guides or catalogs.   

Yaquelin and her husband work hand in hand and administer their funds jointly.  This is why at this time she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing, through which she will buy merchandise such as cosmetics and clothing and also invest in construction materials.  Her husband carries out construction work buying materials needed and at times is short of money to make an effective deal,  a problem he can overcome with the Kiva loan.  

Yaquelin's goal is to increase their income and for her husband to have a larger group of customers, so that in time they can buy their own house and have greater stability in their family income through her husband's work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cosmetics and clothing, and also construction materials

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 38-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children. Her spouse is the main income source of the family, and she cooperates with him by working in clothing sales, which she has done for the past four years. 

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will purchase the new winter clothing collection. She states that by selling additional good-looking and eye-catching clothes, she will receive higher income and therefore live in better conditions. In the future, she looks forward to opening a small store where she will be able to better display her products, as her business is currently established in her house.

loans.use: to purchase the new winter clothing collection

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 27 years old and lives in the town of Lyatonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 10 years, Charles has been working hard to manage his butcher shop where he sells fresh meat. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh meat to sell and help Charles to generate greater profits and provide enough basic needs for his family. Charles hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big farm with cows. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Charles, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but own businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fresh meat to sell in his butcher shop.

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en: Hiyam is a 40-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and three children who attend school. Hiyam has been involved in the agricultural field since 2012. She also produces homemade food, which she sells to many customers in her region and in neighboring villages. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase agricultural supplies, with the aim of increasing her productivity and, therefore, her income. Hiyam does her best to keep supporting her family, whatever it takes.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Amy Diouf's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de 2 membres a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois.
Ces deux femmes sont du même village, elles sont unies par de bonnes relations professionnelles et sociales.
Madame Amy est la responsable elle est mariée âgée de 38 ans et mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés .
Elle s'active dans le commerce de produits sanitaires composés de savons . Avec son nouveau crédit elle va se payer des caisses de savons et des bouteilles de savons liquide qu'elle va revendre au détails dans le petit marché de son village.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et de renforcer son capital financiers.
texts.en:
This group counts 2 members and has been created when the village association was founded.

Amy and Fatou are from the same village, and share a good relationship from a social and professional point of view.

Amy is the group leader. She is 38 and a married mother of 5 children, all of whom go to school. She is in the retail business, and she sells soaps and detergents. With her new loan, she will purchase cases of soaps and bottles of liquid soap that she will then resell at the local market.
 
The profits will help her pay for her family's needs and will also be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase soaps and detergents

loans.name: Agathe

texts.en:
Agathe is 37 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 5 and 17. Three of them go to school. She has been farming for 17 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for potatoes. The profits from the business will be used to buy land.

The agricultural sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for potatoes.

loans.name: Domithile

texts.en:
Domithile, 38, is married with two children ages 12 and 18. Both of them go to school. 

She has been farming for 18 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer. The profits from the business will be used to improve her savings.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 28 years old married woman. They both support their family, through their businesses. Their children are in the school-going age. Gladys sells cereals, a business she has done for the last half-year. She earns a monthly income of KES 5,000.

Gladys has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 15,000. She will use the loan to build a storehouse for her cereals.

She has hopes and dreams for the future. She plans to save enough money to pay school fees for the children. She also desires to get a piece of land and build a house for the family.

loans.use: to build a storehouse for storing cereals.

loans.name: Ancilla

texts.en:
Ancilla is 44 years old; she is married, with three children between the ages of 7 and 14; two of them go to school. She has been farming for 20 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for potatoes. The profits from the business will used to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for her potatoes crops.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 38 years old. She is married and together with her husband they have been blessed with 3 children who are 15, 13, and 10 years old.

Jane runs a cereals business which she done for the last 18 years, earning a monthly income of Ksh 40,000. Jane has requested for her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Ksh 30,000 which she will use to add stock of cereals to resell at a profit.

With the anticipated profits, Jane will be able to boost her business further. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have an expanded successful business that sustains her family through the earned profits.

loans.use: to add stock of cereals

loans.name: Atilio

texts.es:
Atilio de 59 años de edad, tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta segundo grado, está casado y tiene siete hijos, de los cuales solo dos viven en casa y los mayores han formado sus propios hogares.
Atilio se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol desde los doce años de edad, aprendió cuando lo llevaban sus padres a los cerros donde sembraban. Además durante mucho tiempo fue auxiliar de albañil y ahora pone en práctico este trabajo construyendo vivienda.

Hace cuatro años lo capacitaron sobre la siembra de hortalizas (chile, pepino, tomate y ejotes) le ayudan sus hijos mayores y un sobrino que vive cerca, lo que le ha permitido tener muy buenas cosechas de hortalizas las cuales llevan a pie hasta el pueblo y luego van a venderlas a la ciudad.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, invertirá en las hortalizas y los cultivos de maíz y de frijol.

Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda pues es de adobe, espera ponerle el piso de ladrillo ya que es de tierra y afecta la salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Atilio is 59 years old. He had the opportunity to study until second grade. He's married and has seven children, of whom only two live at home. The older ones have made their own homes.

Atilio has earned a living growing staple goods like corn and beans since he was 12 years old. He learned when his parents took him to the hills where they farmed. Also, he was a bricklayer assistant for a while and now puts this work into practice building a house.

Four years ago, he trained on planting vegetables (chiles, peppers, tomatoes and green beans). His grown children and a nephew who lives nearby help him, which has allowed him to have very good crops. He takes them by foot to the town and later cells them in the city.

He needs the loan to buy fertilizers. He will invest in the vegetables and the corn and bean crops. His dream is to improve his home. It's made of adobe and he wants to put in a brick floor, because it's currently made of earth, which affects his family's health.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and invest in crops of maize and beans.

loans.name: Kevin Mauricio

texts.es:
Kevin es un hombre joven de 22 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y se dedica enteramente a sus estudios de ingeniería en telecomunicaciones.
Él es inteligente, soñador, activo, constante, responsable y muy estudioso. Su carrera la realiza en una universidad privada, cursa el décimo semestre (le faltan dos) y ya se encuentra preparando su tesis(requisito para obtener el título de ingeniero).
Kevin es de tez morena, cabello corto negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el español y cursa clases de inglés técnico en la misma universidad. Al finalizar su carrera él se encargará de resolver problemas de transmisión y recepción de señales e interconexión de redes. Su sueño es terminar pronto su carrera y trabajar en una empresa para ayudar y agradecer a sus padres por todo el apoyo brindado. Su vida la comparte en casa de sus padres con sus dos hermanas menores.
Es por esos motivos que Kevin solicita un préstamo para pagar; su inscripción a inglés técnico, gastos de preparación de su tesis y dos cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en:
Kevin is a 22 year old young man, single and without children. He is entirely devoted to studying telecommunications engineering.

He is smart, dreamy, active, steady, responsible and very studious. His degree is done in a private university, and he's in his tenth semester (two left) and is already preparing his thesis (required for an engineering degree).

Kevin is of dark complexion, short black hair and medium height. His first language is Spanish and he takes classes in technical English at the same university. At the end of his degree he has to deal with problems of signal transmission and reception and networking. 

His dream is to finish his degree soon and work in a company to help and thank his parents for all their support. His life is shared in his parents' house with her two younger sisters.

It's because of these goals that Kevin's seeking a loan to pay registration for technical English, thesis preparing costs and two university fees.

loans.use: to pay registration for technical English, thesis preparing costs and two university fees.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 39 years old and married with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Charles owns a retail shop with general merchandise. For fourteen years, he has practiced farming for food security. He began the business to look after his family. 

Charles has a dream of expanding his business, however, he is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital. Charles is hardworking and wants a loan to buy cassava flour, maize flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour, maize flour and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Ruhengeri Twizamure Cb Group

texts.en:
The group is called Twizamure, which means “support themselves” in English. The 24 group members sell different items and they have common goals for changing their life through loans. 

Eugenie is the group leader, aged 25 years old. She is married and has twins who are four years old. Eugenie sells local drinks and has been selling for four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and sorghum for making local beer to sale. She will use the profits from her business to reinvest and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and sorghum for making local beer

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie, 33, is married with five children aged between 1 and 12. All of them go to school. She has been farming for five years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for her Irish potatoes crops. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for her Irish potatoes crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt, rice, sugar, maize flour and other general merchadise for selling

loans.name: Faith And Hope Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Rebbeca, a member of Faith and Hope Women Group. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. She is 26 years old, married and blessed with five kids. 

She has been running a dressmaking business for the last two years. Hand in Hand East Africa enterprise training has enabled her to manage the enterprise wisely, especially record keeping and customer relations and retention. She has applied for a loan to add more stock of fabric to her shop. The business will earn her more income and supplement her husband's income to help educate their children.

She is happy for this loan and grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the help and support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fabric.

loans.name: Kihingo Fadc Commercial Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
Raphael, the man raising his hand, is a member of Kihingo Fadc Commercial Farmers Self Help Group. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. He is forty eight years old and married with four children.

Raphael earns his living by growing maize and beans. After being trained by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, he learned better ways of managing and improving his farming business. He is borrowing the loan to purchase farm inputs such as pesticide and fertilizer. He hopes his income will improve so that he can use the anticipated profits to pay for his children's education.

He appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the loan and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pestcides.

loans.name: Julio Alfredo

texts.es: Julio es un joven de 33 años de edad, el tiene 2 hijos pero por motivo de trabajo no les ve seguido a ellos ni a la madre de sus niños, él atiende su local que es una mecánica general, comenta que trabaja desde muy temprano hasta la noche  ya que su lucha la hace todo para bienestar de sus hijos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tubos para hacer rótulos y comprar objetos de mecánica, lo que anhela  Julio  es atraen mas clientela y seguir trabajando duro para  reunir dinero y comprar una casita para vivir con su familia y asi sus hijos mejoren su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
33-year old Julio has two children, but because of his work he cannot see them or their mother regularly. He is a mechanic in a local garage and works from early in the morning to evening time. He works hard to ensure the wellbeing of his children.

Julio plans to use the loan money to buy tubes to make exhaust pipes and the tools that he lacks. He is getting more clients and continuing to work hard so he can save money to buy a house to live in with his family. He also wishes to improve his chikdren's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy piping to make exhaust pipes

loans.name: Sefroza

texts.en:
Sefroza is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Sefroza has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells clothes, posho, lamps, and batteries. 

To help expand her business, Sefroza has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy clothes, posho, lamps, and batteries, and will help Sefroza to generate greater profits and increase her standard of living. Sefroza hopes that in the future she will be able to buy more stock. 

Sefroza is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sefroza who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy clothes, posho, lamps, and batteries

loans.name: Melvis

texts.es: Melvis de 44 años de edad,  tiene un negocio de confecciones de ropa en general,  en su propia vivienda donde habita con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 8, 13 y 16 años. Su negocio inició desde el año 1998, pues desde muy pequeña como le gustó el arte de elaborar vestidos, viendo  a su madre, que es una confeccionista experta	. Así fue que cuando contrajo matrimonio, decidió genera ingresos con lo que más le gustaba y se puso a estudiar diseño de modas y aprendió así técnicamente la modistería, perfeccionando su arte, para iniciar su aventura de negocio.  Hoy sus ventas son de contado, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía y desde las 6 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche, todo ello con el fin de ser muy productiva y generar cada vez más ingresos. En la actualidad su meta familiar principal es apoyar la educación de su hija, que está estudiando en la universidad y requiere de mucha inversión. Su mayor desafío es tener recursos suficientes para aumentar la productividad y llevar a cabo sus sueños de prosperidad. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará: una máquina plana, una fileteadora con el fin de mejorar cada vez su capacidad productiva y competitiva y obtener  más  ingresos que beneficien a su familia. Produciendo mucho más; con esta inversión generará un empleo más y esto es muy bueno para la sociedad, pues requerirá una persona adicional, que apoye su producción haciendo así que esta inversión sea muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Melvis is 44 years old. She has a business sewing mostly clothing in her own home where she lives with her husband and her three children aged 8, 13 and 16. She started her business in 1998 as since she was young she liked the art of sewing clothing. This comes from her mother who is an expert seamstress.

So when she got married she decided to generate income by doing what she likes. She started to study fashion design and learned the technical part of dressmaking, perfecting her art so she could start her adventure into business.

Today her sales are in cash and she works from Monday to Friday from 8 in the morning until 6 pm or even until 10 pm. All this with the goal of being very productive and generate ever more revenue. Right now her goal is to support her daughter's education. She is studying at university and this requires a lot of money. Her main challenge is to have enough resources to expand her productivity and bring about her dreams of prosperity.

She is applying for a loan from Kiva which is the first loan she has had through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will buy a flat lock sewing machine and a serger with the goal of improving her production capacity and competitiveness and obtain more revenues to benefit her family. And producing much more: this investment will create another job and this is good for society, as it requires another person to help her with her production. That will make this a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a flat lock sewing machine and a serger.

loans.name: Emmanuel 2 Group

texts.en:
The four women who make up the Emmanuel 2 group live in nuclear families in the Teshie neighborhood in Accra. They average 48 years of age and three children each. The women know one another through community ties, kinship, marriage and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They each have small-scale businesses involving soft drinks, groceries, cutlery sets and books. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution ID-Ghana and are now on their third loan cycle. 

Rebecca (standing second from the left in the photo) is a major vendor of soft drinks. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 boxes of different soft drinks in the market at Accra. Her sales are made to a mixed customer base, paying with cash. She operates this business at her residence.

With this loan, Rebecca hopes to make a good monthly profit that will be used to meet her child’s needs and also for increasing her capital. She would like to continue collaborating with ID-Ghana. She is single, 49 years old and lives with her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase 10 boxes of different soft drinks in the market at Accra.

loans.name: Editrudis

texts.es: Editrudis inició su negocio de almuerzos, en un barrio ubicado al sur occidente de la ciudad, atendiendo a sus habilidades para preparar comidas y el deleite que genera entre sus consumidores. Su negocio está bien ubicado en el sector y goza de renombre, por eso trabaja de lunes a domingos  desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche y ha agregado otros servicios como los de llamadas a celulares, recargas, deliciosas picadas que consumen sus clientes en las fiestas que ofrecen. Su meta mas adelante es tener un restaurante bien organizado y lograr adquirir su propia casa y su gran desafio es darle estudios a sus hijos con la calidad que ellos ameritan.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  materias primas para elaborar nuevos productos alimenticios, que ofrecerá a la hora del almuerzo y recargas para celulares, con ello aspira a ampliar la variedad de productos y ganar un poco mas, lo cual se constituye en el éxito de esta inversión, pues mejora el negocio de Editrudis.
texts.en:
Editrudis started her lunch business in a neighbourhood located in the southwest part of the city. She uses her cooking skills to make meals that delight her customers. Her business is well located and has a good reputation. Editrudis works every day of the week from 7 am to 9 pm. She also offers other services such cell phone calls, recharging cell phone cards, and delicious snacks that her customers buy at holiday times.

Her future goal is to open a well-run restaurant and to buy her own home. An even greater challenge is to provide the quality of education that her children deserve.

Editrudis is now applying for a loan through Kiva, the first loan she has had with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She plans to use the money to buy ingredients to make different dishes for lunches. She will also buy cell phone cards. With these purchases she hopes to expand the services she offers and earn a little more money. She would then consider this to be a good investment as well as an improvement to her business.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make new lunch items

loans.name: Giselt Paola

texts.es: La venta de productos de aseo doméstico y el comercio de ropa en general, son los dos negocios que generan ingresos que benefician el desarrollo de su hogar de Giselt, conformado por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 10 años. Giselt para apoyar el ingreso familiar, se puso a vender champú, con un capital semilla que le dio su cónyuge y le prestó su suegra a quien le pagó con las utilidades, por cuenta del buen resultado que obtuvo. Jabón líquido, champú. ampollas para el cabello ropa y de todo un poco de lo que solicita su clientela, tiene en su haber Giselt para vender a sus compradores a crédito y de contado,  todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 2 y 30 de la tarde, y comprando en los almacenes especializados en cada producto, donde le ofrezcan el mejor precio. Su meta mas adelante es tener un gran almacen y comprar su propia casa, pero aun debe hacer mas esfuerzos de inversión, como el credikiva que solicita a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual planea comprar dos vitrinas ropa en general y diversos articulos de la temporada, que permanecerán exhibidos para impactar la decisión de compra de su clientela e incrementarán sus venta mejorando así las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
The sale of household cleaning products and of clothing are the two businesses that generate the revenues to support Giselt's household which is made up of her husband and 3 children between the ages of 1 and 10. 

To contribute to her family income, Giselt began selling shampoo, using seed capital given by her husband and lent by her mother-in-law, who she pays back with the profits from the good results she obtains. 

Liquid soap, shampoo. hair products, clothes and a little bit of whatever her customers ask for, Giselt has these available to sell to her buyers on credit or for cash. She works every day from 6:00 am to 2:30 pm. She buys from the specialist stores for each product, where the best prices are offered. 

Her goal for the future is to have a large store and buy her own house, but she must still make more investments, such as the Kiva loan which she is requesting from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she plans to buy two display cabinets, general clothing and various seasonal items which will remain on display to influence her customers' buying decisions, increase her sales and improve the conditions of her business.

loans.use: to buy two display cabinets, general clothing and various seasonal items

loans.name: Yosam

texts.en:
Yosam is 37 years old and lives in the town of Lyatonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom currently attend school. For the past six years, Yosam has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential goods like sugar, salt, and water. 

To help expand his business, Yosam has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items that his shop lacks, and will help Yosam to generate greater profits and take good care of his family. Yosam hopes that in the future he will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Yosam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yosam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items for his shop

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 26 years old and lives in the town of Lyatonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential goods like sugar, salt, and water. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential items that she lacks for her shop, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential items for her shop

loans.name: Illuminathe

texts.en: Illuminathe is 22 years old. She is not married. She sells foodstuffs and has been running a business for three years. With this loan, she would like to buy more onions, carrots and tomatoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy onions, carrots and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and salt for his shop

loans.name: Anualite

texts.en:
Anualite is 27 years old. She is married with 2 children, aged 7 and 2 years old, one of whom goes to school. She has a bar and has been working at her business for 3 years. 

After getting her loan, she would like to buy more beer and Turbo King dark ale to sell in her bar. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beer and Turbo King ale to sell in her bar.

loans.name: Simeho

texts.en:
Simeho is 33 years old and married without children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Simeho runs a retail shop of general merchandise, a business he has been in for six years. He also practices farming and teaching for additional income.

Simeho wants to improve his standard of living, which is why he is working hand. Simeho is faced with a challenge of limited capital. Simeho wants money to buy salt, bread, sugar and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy salt, bread, sugar and other general merchadise for selling.

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina (seated in front in the picture), who works alongside her partners Maybee (pictured top right) and Clever (pictured top left), is an artist and designer who specializes in handbags. She would like to purchase a new sewing machine for her workshop.

Karina has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is her story:

"We share a passion for design, as well as experience working as part of an airplane crew. We started creating our own designs, not only for women traveling, but also for the active woman who requires a bag that is both aesthetic and versatile. Our greatest challenge is to be able to balance it all, looking after our kids and taking an active role in their education, as well as working and looking after our venture."

"A new sewing machine would allow us to improve the finishing and detailing on our handbags, and will also make our work more efficient. Thank you to everyone who supports us with this microcredit."

Use the link below to view Karina's handbags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8568

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine for her workshop

loans.name: Siriporn

texts.en:
Siriporn is an artisan who specializes in hand-knotted gemstone bracelets. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones.

Siriporn has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"I had a simple childhood but my dreams were wonderful. When I moved to Chiang Mai I took the first step toward working with beads. I love taking long walks and admiring nature. It inspires me."

"This microcredit will give me the cash I need to purchase gemstones and prepare more items for the upcoming holiday season. I use several types of stones and, in order to get the best price, each one requires a high minimum order quantity that I normally cannot afford."

Use the link below to view Siriporn's hand-knotted gemstone bracelets on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8066

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of gemstones for her bracelets

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 33 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Jane has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential goods like sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil.

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of UGX 4,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items like sugar, rice and all types of flour. It will help Jane to generate greater profits, improve her social status and educate her children in better schools.

Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to own more branches of the same business. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase soda, soap, cooking oil, bread and sugar.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 35 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo, in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past three years, Lawrence has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells spare parts.

To help expand his business, Lawrence has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more spare parts to sell. This will help Lawrence to generate greater profits, and pay rent for the working place and medical bills for his family. Lawrence hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business into a repair garage.

Lawrence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lawrence, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more spare parts to sell
